Título: Contratista Líder de desarrollo de software
Descripción: Acerca del empleo Somos el centro de innovación y negocios de Medellín; nuestro propósito es contribuir al mejoramiento de la calidad de vida de los habitantes de la ciudad a través de la Ciencia, la Tecnología y la innovación y la transformación de la economía local en una economía del conocimiento.  Experiencia +5 años liderando proyectos y equipos de desarrollo de software, desarrollo de sistemas, solución o plataformas tecnológicas en entornos de gran alcance a través de tecnologías de la web. + 3 años trabajando con ingeniería de datos, soluciones complejas con integraciones usando múltiples protocolos de comunicación.  Responsabilidades Aprovechar los marcos de arquitectura empresarial para tomar decisiones sistemáticas; Aportar una perspectiva de "panorama general" a la adopción de nuevas ideas; Proponer soluciones técnicas para ayudar a los tomadores de decisiones a aplicar los cambios relevantes; Trabajar con el equipo para colaborar en decisiones clave con respecto a la implementación de aplicaciones y arquitectura de software; Realizar revisiones de código; Supervisar la solución de software en cada iteración de la versión del sistema.  Habilidades • Lenguajes: React JS, javascript (navegador), Python 3, HTML 5, C#, PHP • Bases de datos: Relacionales y noSQL – Programación SQL, optimización de queries • Metodologías de gerencia de proyectos (PMP) • Marcos agiles (SCRUM). • Metodologías de gestión de servicio de servicios tecnológicos. (ITIL) • Preferiblemente Manejo de herramienta JIRA • Competente en Git, SVN • Conocimiento sólido de microservicios, y cloud computing  Salario: especificar propuesta económica en su solicitud. Contrato: Prestación de servicios El / la aplicante debe vivir en Medellín o el área metropolitana del Valle de Aburrá.  Si te interesa aplicar a esta oferta aplica antes del 30 de noviembre de 2022.
Descripción (inglés): [{'translation_text': 'We are the center of innovation and business of Medellin; our purpose is to contribute to the improvement of the quality of life of the inhabitants of the city through Science, Technology and innovation and the transformation of the local economy in a knowledge economy. Experience +5 years leading projects and teams of development of software, development of systems, solution or technological platforms in wide reach environments through web technologies. + 3 years working with data engineering, complex solutions with integrations using multiple communication protocols. Responsibilities Take advantage of the frameworks of business architecture to make systematic decisions; Provide a perspective of "general management" to the adoption of new ideas. Propose technical solutions to help decision makers to apply the relevant changes; Work with the team to collaborate in key decisions regarding the implementation of applications and software architecture; Perform revisions of code; Supervise the software solution in each iteration of the system version. Skills • Languages: React JS, javasscript (navegador), Python 3, HTML 5, C#, PHP • Data Bases: Related, and non-management.'}]

Descripción: Acerca del empleo About Distillery  Distillery is a high-growth technology services company specializing in end-to-end custom software development and IT staffing for startups, small and mid-size businesses, and enterprises. We help our clients to imagine, design, engineer and deliver business-defining software and digital experiences whether they’re looking for a fully managed team, scalable workforce, or individual engineers.  About The Position  Become a part of the friendly and skilled team of QA engineers! You will be able to solve challenging tasks, work with first-class developers, designers, and managers and take part in large-scale international projects.  Responsibilities  Develop automated test scripts for UI and API layers Maintain, review, propose and implement improvements to existing frameworks, tools and processes Integrate your scripts into CI/CD pipelines Create test documentation such as test plans, test cases, bug reports Collect test results, provide clear feedback on the current quality level Perform a code review of the scripts that have been written by other engineers Сommunicate effectively with other team members  Requirements 5+ years of software test automation in commercial projects Solid experience with Cypress framework (Selenium can be a plus) Work on the mobile app that duplicates a CRM Production experience with Java Production experience with at least one of the following test frameworks: TestNG JUnit or similar SQL knowledge Understanding of REST principles Experience with UI testing frameworks Experience with API libraries such as RestAssured Experience with Git Experience with Jenkins or similar CI-CD tools Understanding of software testing principles and theory Conversational English skills including the ability to communicate and collaborate with a globally distributed Experience working in an Agile development process (Scrum/ Kanban/ Scrumban)  Nice To Have  Experience with Appium framework Mobile app testing experience Experience with Spring Experience with containerization (e.g. Docker) Experience with SOAP testing Understanding queue (like Kafka) and asynchronous requests Experience with Shell Scripting Experience with any BDD frameworks such as Cucumber  Why You’ll Like Working Here  The ability to work on and partner with multi-national teams that are committed to our BEST core values: Best People, Best Expertise, Best Service, Best Teamwork A generous, competitive compensation package for exceptional performers, as well as a generous compensation of sport and medical insurance Internal hackathons and meetups where each employee can act as a speaker Attendance sponsorship of IT events, professional conferences, and financial coverage of online and offline courses Hybrid working environment Professional and personal development, as well as the ability to change your area of expertise English language courses

Descripción: Acerca del empleo Caseware is one of Canada's original Fintech companies, having led the global audit and accounting software industry for over 30 years, with more than 500,000 users across 130 countries and available in 16 different languages. While you might not have heard of us (yet) over 36,000 accounting and audit professionals list Caseware as a skill on their LinkedIn profiles!  As Caseware continues to grow and innovate, we have an exciting opportunity for a Java Developer on our Smart Engagements (SE) Team. The Smart Engagements Team is responsible for building a feature-rich business-critical application that also serves as a platform for third-party development. You will be developing backend components with microservices, using cutting-edge technologies and cloud ecosystems on AWS for audit and accounting engagement functionalities in an all-in-one central platform.  Please note: Successful candidates will participate in our 90-day Onboarding Program where you will learn the entire technology stack involved in the SE team. You will be provided with the online courses, hands-on labs, and mentoring required to develop your full potential in this career path toward your professional success. In the last 15 days of the program, you will be assigned a requirement to put into practice everything you have learned, but don't worry, you will also be guided by a mentor who will help you strengthen your software development skills.  You’ll be responsible for: Developing Java and Spring Boot code using object-oriented programming, with special emphasis on building microservices, multi-thread programming, and event-driven architectures Developing code using cloud platforms with a focus on AWS cloud technologies on dockerized environments using dockers and Kubernetes Creating automated test cases Fixing bugs and creating new functionalities from user stories Developing critical components that makeup Caseware’s core product using: Java and Spring Boot, AWS S3, DynamoBD, RDS Aurora, Lambda, SNS, SQS, EKS, AWS SDK for Java, JUnit, Cucumber, GitHub & GitHub Actions, IDE: IntelliJ IDEA.  You should have: 2+ years of experience working with Java and web services (REST or SOAP) or microservices 1+ year of experience working with service-oriented architectures (SOA) Knowledge of OOP, design patterns, and SOLID principles Knowledge of deploying web applications made in Java on any application server (Apache Tomcat, Jetty, Glassfish, JBoss, Wildfly, etc) Knowledge of relational database design (RDD) Advanced English  Benefits Permanent contract with all legal benefits Competitive compensation — above the market average 100% remote work environment and an excellent work-life balance Computer and related hardware are provided for you to work from home Paid parental leave, vacation & holidays Opportunity to work for a growing global SaaS leader Be part of a diverse winning team who embraces diversity, equity, and inclusion A culture that promotes independence, innovation, trust, and accountability Open space to be creative, innovative and strategize for the future Engaged leadership with regular feedback and career growth discussions

Descripción: Acerca del empleo Remote, Colombia  Hi, I'm Erika Plazas, your Recruiter. At CSG, we choose to see beyond a resume paper. We put your story, perspective, background, and what you have to offer first. While the traditional approach works for some, many miss out on fantastic talent like yourself, and we refuse to make that mistake. Instead, we believe that by channeling the power of all, we make ordinary customer and employee experience extraordinary.  Channel the power of YOU as the next Full-Time, Software Development Engineer – Java at CSG.  Who will love this job  A hybrid – you excel when you can choose your work style - remote, in-office, or a combination of both A grower – you learn new skills and expose yourself to experiences that you can apply quickly to enhance results A thinker – you take advantage of resources and implement ideas in new ways to find solutions A collaborator – you love to work on projects that have functional workflows An empath – you know how to connect and communicate with different audiences worldwide((Soft Skills: 5 bullet points. Trade/Add from Library))  What you'll do  You will report to Senior Manager Software Developer to contribute toward designing, writing code, modifying, and debugging CSG product applications while analyzing and performing bug verification, release testing, and beta support for assigned products You will partner with end user to establish requirements and complete technical documentation You will understand development processes from beginning to end, including specification, documentation, and quality assurance Be adept at learning new programming languages with guidance while performing unit and system testing  You should have  Research shows that candidates from underrepresented backgrounds often don't apply for roles if they don't meet all the criteria – unlike majority candidates meeting fewer requirements. Channel the power of YOU and apply to discover if we're a match.  Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, related field, or equivalent experience 3 years of development experience Experience in Java Experience in SQL Server Experience in Scrum Methodology Proficient in English in a business environment  Perks & Benefits  Work from Home, in-office, or hybrid Medical & Dental Coverage Life Insurance Emotional and Mental Well-being Initiatives Volunteer Time Off Birthday Day Off Meal Allowance Education Reimbursement  Our Story  For over 40 years, we've serviced the world's most recognizable brands with future-ready solutions in customer engagement, revenue management, and payments that make ordinary customer experiences extraordinary. As a trusted technology provider in telecommunications, retail, financial services, and healthcare, our solutions impact over 900 customers in over 120 countries. Over 5,000 customer-obsessed CSGers in more than 20 countries made it possible and helped reach our $1 billion in revenue milestone.  Our Way of Life  Our people power a culture of integrity, innovation, and impact. In return, we power our people with the choice to work from home, in-office, or a hybrid work combination that integrates well with their lifestyle. You'll find CSGers exercising this choice at most of our locations worldwide.  We are committed to building and nurturing a diverse, supportive, and inclusive work environment where individuality is valued, and our people can flourish. We believe our workforce should reflect the world we live in and that we are stronger because of our differences. By embracing different backgrounds, attributes, experiences, and perspectives, we will help our employees, customers, and communities excel while, together, we work toward making social equality a reality.  We are committed to making a bigger community impact by creating new opportunities and access for underrepresented communities, protecting the environment, and developing technology solutions that foster digital inclusivity. That's just who we are. If not us, then who?  Follow us! LinkedIn | Facebook | Twitter  Location(s):
Descripción (inglés): Remote, Colombia  Hi, I'm Erika Plazas, your Recruiter. At CSG, we choose to see beyond a resume paper. We put your story, perspective, background, and what you have to offer first. While the traditional approach works for some, many miss out on fantastic talent like yourself, and we refuse to make that mistake. Instead, we believe that by channeling the power of all, we make ordinary customer and employee experience extraordinary.  Channel the power of YOU as the next Full-Time, Software Development Engineer – Java at CSG.  Who will love this job  A hybrid – you excel when you can choose your work style - remote, in-office, or a combination of both A grower – you learn new skills and expose yourself to experiences that you can apply quickly to enhance results A thinker – you take advantage of resources and implement ideas in new ways to find solutions A collaborator – you love to work on projects that have functional workflows An empath – you know how to connect and communicate with different audiences worldwide((Soft Skills: 5 bullet points. Trade/Add from Library))  What you'll do  You will report to Senior Manager Software Developer to contribute toward designing, writing code, modifying, and debugging CSG product applications while analyzing and performing bug verification, release testing, and beta support for assigned products You will partner with end user to establish requirements and complete technical documentation You will understand development processes from beginning to end, including specification, documentation, and quality assurance Be adept at learning new programming languages with guidance while performing unit and system testing  You should have  Research shows that candidates from underrepresented backgrounds often don't apply for roles if they don't meet all the criteria – unlike majority candidates meeting fewer requirements. Channel the power of YOU and apply to discover if we're a match.  Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, related field, or equivalent experience 3 years of development experience Experience in Java Experience in SQL Server Experience in Scrum Methodology Proficient in English in a business environment  Perks & Benefits  Work from Home, in-office, or hybrid Medical & Dental Coverage Life Insurance Emotional and Mental Well-being Initiatives Volunteer Time Off Birthday Day Off Meal Allowance Education Reimbursement  Our Story  For over 40 years, we've serviced the world's most recognizable brands with future-ready solutions in customer engagement, revenue management, and payments that make ordinary customer experiences extraordinary. As a trusted technology provider in telecommunications, retail, financial services, and healthcare, our solutions impact over 900 customers in over 120 countries. Over 5,000 customer-obsessed CSGers in more than 20 countries made it possible and helped reach our $1 billion in revenue milestone.  Our Way of Life  Our people power a culture of integrity, innovation, and impact. In return, we power our people with the choice to work from home, in-office, or a hybrid work combination that integrates well with their lifestyle. You'll find CSGers exercising this choice at most of our locations worldwide.  We are committed to building and nurturing a diverse, supportive, and inclusive work environment where individuality is valued, and our people can flourish. We believe our workforce should reflect the world we live in and that we are stronger because of our differences. By embracing different backgrounds, attributes, experiences, and perspectives, we will help our employees, customers, and communities excel while, together, we work toward making social equality a reality.  We are committed to making a bigger community impact by creating new opportunities and access for underrepresented communities, protecting the environment, and developing technology solutions that foster digital inclusivity. That's just who we are. If not us, then who?  Follow us! LinkedIn | Facebook | Twitter  Location(s):

Descripción: Acerca del empleo Importante empresa de producción requiere para su equipo de trabajo Técnico, Tecnólogo y/o Profesional en el campo de producción / industrial, que cuente con mínimo un ano de experiencia en el área. Que cuente con las siguientes capacidades: Manejo de personal, Turnos rotativos, Métodos y tiempos, Analista de datos, Buen manejo de ofimática, Balanceos de línea, Disponibilidad de tiempo, Entre otros. IMPORTANTE TENER EN CUENTA: Horario rotativo Manana, Tarde y TRASNOCHO. Salario: $ 1.300.000 Funciones: Coordinar la producción diaria de acuerdo a la materia prima, verificar cumplimiento de BMP, Manejo de personal, cumplimiento de metas. Ubicación: Villa Olímpica.
Descripción (inglés): [{'translation_text': 'Important production company requires for its technical, technologist and/or professional work team in the field of production / industrial, to have at least one year of experience in the area. It has the following capabilities: Personnel management, Rotary turns, Methods and times, Data analyst, Good handling of office automation, Line balances, Availability of time, Among others. IMPORTANT TO HAVE IN ACCOUNT: Morning, Afternoon and TROSNOCHO rotary hours. Salary: $ 1.300.000 Functions: Coordinate the daily production according to the raw material, verify compliance of BMP, Personnel management, fulfillment of goals. Location: Olympic Villa.'}]

Descripción: Acerca del empleo En Xertica somos la consultora de tecnología que habilita la transformación digital de las organizaciones líderes de América Latina a través de soluciones basadas en la nube.  Requerimos para nuestro equipo de trabajo Technical Architect de Salesforce, para el equipo regional.  Objetivos: * Analizar y diseñar soluciones innovadoras con base en los procesos y necesidades de los clientes dentro de la plataforma de Salesforce, asegurando el uso de estándares y mejores prácticas. * Tener claridad de cómo se deberá de implementar la solución de acuerdo a la metodología. * A partir del diseño de la solución, generar la estimación de tiempos y recursos necesarios para la implementación exitosa del mismo. Asegurando la entrega completa de documentación de acuerdo a la metodología definida en Xertica. * Tener un amplio conocimiento de la plataforma de Salesforce y sus funcionalidades.  Las responsabilidades principales en este rol son: * Cierre de Oportunidades de acuerdo a la cuota de AEs. * Diseñar y asegurar la factibilidad técnica de las soluciones propuestas * Capacidad de liderar workshops para entender los requerimientos y arquitectura. * Preparar un plan de implementación técnico de acuerdo a metodología. * Dominar las funcionalidades y limitantes de la plataforma de Salesforce. * Configurar y desarrollar base de la solución en Salesforce para demostraciones. * Validar el gobierno e integridad de las conexiones de Salesforce con otros sistemas. * Capacidad de comunicar arquitectura de Salesforce y temas técnicos  Se buscan personas con experiencia en la nube de Financial Services de Salesforce. 3+ años de experiencia en consultoría de procesos de negocio o implementación del CRM Salesforce. Preferible Certificaciones de Salesforce o conocimiento comprobado.  Carreras: Ingeniero en Sistemas o Informática o afin.   Buscamos gente con valores como Actitud Ganadora, un gran Enfoque a Resultados, Instinto Resolutivo, un excelente Enfoque en el Servicio y con ganas de seguir aprendiendo cosas nuevas para afrontar los cambios.  ¿Por qué trabajar en Xertica? Horario flexible y teletrabajo Diversidad de proyectos en LATAM y USA Tenemos programas para equilibrar tu vida laboral y personal Podrás hacer certificaciones con nuestro partner (salesforce) y ganar incentivos  "El futuro digital de Latinoamérica está en nuestras manos, únete a esta gran empresa" ¿Estás listo para ser Xertica? ¡Postulate!
Descripción (inglés): [{'translation_text': 'In Xerstintica we are the technology consultant that enables the digital transformation of the leading organizations of Latin America through cloud-based solutions. We require for our technical architect team of Salesforce, for the regional team. Objectives: * Analyze and design innovative solutions based on the processes and needs of the customers within the platform of Salesforce, ensuring the use of standards and best practices. * Have clarity of how the solution should be implemented according to the methodology. * From the design of the solution, generate the estimation of times and resources necessary for the successful implementation of it. Design and ensure the technical feasibility of the proposed solutions. * Capacity to lead workshops to understand the requirements and architecture. * Prepare a technical implementation plan according to methodology. * Close the Opportunities according to the AEs. * Design and ensure the technical feasibility of the solutions proposed in Xertica.'}]

Descripción: Acerca del empleo At Kin + Carta, we’ve got opportunities to offer you — for growth, for leadership, for big, world-changing impact and for, dare we say it, fun. We are a global workforce that is committed to building a world that works better for everyone. And that starts with our Kin. That’s why we’re proud of:  The life we create within our virtual walls, every day Being B Corp certified Our honor as a “Best Company to Work For” by Women's Choice Award  The role  Kin + Carta is seeking a Java Software Engineer who is excited about development within the emerging technology ecosystem. You will be working on client-facing projects within Fortune 500 companies in the enterprise software space.  Solid communication skills, a servant leadership attitude, a love of learning and an analytical mind are a must.  Role responsibilities  Consulting with Fortune 500 clients in order to build enterprise-grade cloud-native applications Supporting team members in order to deliver products to market in an efficient manner Partnering with top-notch designers to create award-winning user experiences Bridging the gap between elegant front end design and existing enterprise backend architectures Mentoring less experienced engineers to foster their career path and growth  Minimum Qualifications  We want all new hires to succeed in their roles at Kin + Carta. That's why we've outlined the job requirements below. To be considered for this role, it's important that you meet all Minimum Qualifications. If you do not meet all of the Preferred Qualifications, we still encourage you to apply.  Strong level knowledge of Java and Java web applications Strong understanding of modern Spring frameworks (Spring Boot, Spring Cloud Services, etc) Solid OOD and OOP skills are required Previous experience working with Postgres Previous experience delivering products in an Agile environment Experience developing enterprise applications that support high traffic volumes 3 or more years of professional software development experience Exposure to modern software practices such as TDD, CI/CD, etc. is required BS in Computer Science or a related field Certifications in Google (Associate Cloud Engineer, Professional Cloud Developer) or Pivotal (Pivotal Certified Developer Java, Spring Professional) are preferred.  Preferred Qualifications  Previous exposure to Pivotal Cloud Foundry is a huge plus Previous consulting experience is a plus Working experience with microservice architectures is a plus Working experience with public cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) is a plus Working experience with modern web application frameworks (AngularJS, ReactJS, etc) is also a plus  About Kin + Carta  Kin + Carta is a global digital transformation consultancy committed to working alongside our clients to build a world that works better #ForEveryone. Our 2,000 curious minds make creative connections between people, data and technology to create connected outcomes across the full lifecycle of the product and platform ecosystems.  We’re makers, builders and creators by nature, and we come to work every day to build experiences for some of the world’s most influential companies. We help businesses accelerate their digital roadmap, rapidly innovate, modernize their systems, enable their teams and optimize for continued growth.  We are a technology business with trust and human connection at its heart. As a Certified B Corp, our triple bottom line focus on people, the planet and profit is at the core of everything we do.  We welcome our Kin to show up as their authentic selves every day. Because this is so important to us, Kin + Carta is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. To read further about our commitment to Inclusion, Diversity, Equity and Awareness, check out the IDEA page on our website.  If you need accommodations at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.

Título: FronEnd Engineer (Angular y React con Ingles) España
Descripción: Acerca del empleo Multinational company based in Spain, is looking for a FrontEnd Engineer to join a highly motivated team to work on an international project with high technological value.  We are looking for a New Talent with experience in Javascript and Angular knowledge, eager to work on several projects with us.  We take care of the management of the relocation process (work visa, plane ticket, etc...). Integration into a multidisciplinary team in a dynamic, collaborative and creative environment.  REQUIREMENTS  Must have: University Degree in Computer Science, Systems and / or Telecommunications. Minimum experience of 4 years as a FrontEnd developer. - + 3 years of experience developing commercial web applications - + 3+ years of experience with JavaScript, Angular (NodeJS recomended) Experience developing SaaS-based web applications using an Agile/Scrum/Kanban methodology Experience with Restful APIs. Knowledge of Azure stack. Excellent written and verbal communication skills (English)  Offer Management of relocation process (work visa, plane ticket, etc...) Job stability with professional growth. Flexible Schedule Excellent work environment We offer a permanent contract and salary according to the candidate's value. Location: Madrid / Sevilla / Malaga  Join Us  De acuerdo con la Ley Orgánica 15/1999 de 13 de Diciembre de Protección de Datos de Carácter Personal, le informamos que sus datos serán incorporadas a un fichero responsabilidad de Vortech PCI Group S.L. con el fin de participar en procesos de selección. Para ejercer sus derechos de acceso, rectificación, cancelación y oposición de sus datos personales (ARCO) podrá comunicarlo por escrito e indicando sus datos personales a rgpd@vortech.es

Descripción: Acerca del empleo FullStack Labs is the fastest-growing software consultancy in the Americas. We help organizations like Uber, GoDaddy, MGM, Siemens, Stanford University, and the State of California, build distributed software development teams, and deliver transformational digital solutions. As an employee-first company, we focus on hiring the most talented software designers and developers in the western hemisphere, by creating a positive, respectful, and supportive work environment where they can achieve their greatest potential.  We’re most proud of: Offering life-changing career opportunities to talented software professionals across the Americas. Building highly-skilled software development teams for hundreds of the world’s greatest companies. Having delivered hundreds of successful custom software solutions, which have positively impacted the lives and careers of millions of users. Our 4.7-star rating on GlassDoor. Our client Net Promoter Score of 64, twice the industry average. Sustained growth of 100% - 200% per year.  The Position:  We're looking to hire several mid-level and senior Accessibility Engineer to join our team. You'll work with our incredible clients in one of two ways: Team Augmentation / Staffing: You will integrate yourself directly into our client's team and work alongside their existing designers and engineers on a daily basis. Design & Build: You will work on a FullStack Labs product team to build and deliver a product to our clients.  What We're Looking For: 3+ years of professional software development experience. 5+ years preferred but not required. Meaningful experience working as a Accessibility Engineer. Experience working on large, complex systems. Experience working on Agile / Scrum teams. A four-year college degree is required. Ability to take extreme ownership over your work. Every day is a challenge to ensure you are performing to the expectations you and your team have agreed upon. Ability to identify with the goals of FullStack's clients, and dedicate yourself to delivering on the commitments you and your team make to them. An understanding of best practices and a commitment to following them. Ability to work through new and difficult issues and contribute to libraries as needed. A positive mindset and can-do attitude. Forensic attention to detail. You’re passionate about software development...it’s not just your career, it’s your hobby. You’re constantly striving to learn new things and improve. You follow industry news, regularly tinker with new technologies, and read books and blogs to keep your skills current. Ability to consistently work 40 hours per week.  Benefits: Competitive Salary. Paid Time Off (vacation, sick leave, maternity and paternity leave, holidays). 100% remote work. The ability to work with leading startups and Fortune 500 companies. Health policy with Sura 100% for you and up to 4 primary family members. English Classes. Sodexo food card. 2 additional extra-legal bonuses per year worth up to 10% of salary. Virtual company events each month. Ample opportunity for career advancement. Continuing education opportunities.  FullStack Labs is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form, which can be provided upon request during our hiring and interview process.  Learn more about our Applicants Privacy Notice .

Descripción: Acerca del empleo Summary: The QE Engineer II Understands and applies quality methods and practices to ensure on-time delivery of high-quality projects  Responsibilities: Work closely with product owners, engineers, and team members to identify areas and methods to help improve testing efficiency, expand coverage, and increase product reliability Maintains documentation of test results to assist in debugging and modification of software Perform setup and administration of tools used by the testing team Collaborate with other team members to resolve any issues or defects Hold and facilitate test plan/case reviews with cross-functional team members. Ensure that validated deliverables meet functional and design specifications and requirements. Coordinate with business in understanding reported issues, requirements, and expected behavior Scope of assignments may cover a broad range and complexity of technologies Continual learning of quality best practices and technologies May help coordinate technical dependencies with other teams Provides estimates for own deliverables Design and implements test strategy for projects and provide estimates for new test projects… III, IV Builds an internal and external network to leverage best practices and technologies Mentors others on quality methods and techniques Coordinates technical dependencies with other teams Participates in the definition of project objectives Provides LOEs and schedule needs for proposed objectives  Requirements: Bachelor or master’s degree in computer science or a related technical field 3 to 4 years in Data Quality Assurance. Good understanding of exploratory testing practices Solid understanding of Agile development Strong SQL skills (SQL Server preferred) Knowledge and experience testing ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) or database stored procedures. Understanding of Data Governance and Data Modeling is a plus Exposure to testing data for data marts, data warehouses, data integration solutions and Data Analysis tools (Tabular models and Power BI are desirable). Solid experience writing Test Plans, Test Cases, Test Scripts and Test Summary reports. Proven experience understanding automation framework requirements and helping build test framework and its execution end-to-end.  Preferred Skills/Requirements: Recommendations and advocacy for Quality best practices and experience working with build management tool like Jenkins, Azure DevOps, etc. Good understanding/Working Experience in Data Automation framework.

Descripción: Acerca del empleo About Distillery  Distillery is a high-growth technology services company specializing in end-to-end custom software development and IT staffing for startups, small and mid-size businesses, and enterprises. We help our clients to imagine, design, engineer and deliver business-defining software and digital experiences whether they’re looking for a fully managed team, scalable workforce, or individual engineers.  About The Position  Become a part of the friendly and skilled team of QA engineers! You will be able to solve challenging tasks, work with first-class developers, designers, and managers and take part in large-scale international projects.  Responsibilities  Develop automated test scripts for UI and API layers Maintain, review, propose and implement improvements to existing frameworks, tools and processes Integrate your scripts into CI/CD pipelines Create test documentation such as test plans, test cases, bug reports Collect test results, provide clear feedback on the current quality level Perform a code review of the scripts that have been written by other engineers Сommunicate effectively with other team members  Requirements 5+ years of software test automation in commercial projects Solid experience with Cypress framework (Selenium can be a plus) Work on the mobile app that duplicates a CRM Production experience with Java Production experience with at least one of the following test frameworks: TestNG JUnit or similar SQL knowledge Understanding of REST principles Experience with UI testing frameworks Experience with API libraries such as RestAssured Experience with Git Experience with Jenkins or similar CI-CD tools Understanding of software testing principles and theory Conversational English skills including the ability to communicate and collaborate with a globally distributed Experience working in an Agile development process (Scrum/ Kanban/ Scrumban)  Nice To Have  Experience with Appium framework Mobile app testing experience Experience with Spring Experience with containerization (e.g. Docker) Experience with SOAP testing Understanding queue (like Kafka) and asynchronous requests Experience with Shell Scripting Experience with any BDD frameworks such as Cucumber  Why You’ll Like Working Here  The ability to work on and partner with multi-national teams that are committed to our BEST core values: Best People, Best Expertise, Best Service, Best Teamwork A generous, competitive compensation package for exceptional performers, as well as a generous compensation of sport and medical insurance Internal hackathons and meetups where each employee can act as a speaker Attendance sponsorship of IT events, professional conferences, and financial coverage of online and offline courses Hybrid working environment Professional and personal development, as well as the ability to change your area of expertise English language courses

Working Here  The ability to work on and partner with multi-national teams that are committed to our BEST core values: Best People, Best Expertise, Best Service, Best Teamwork A generous, competitive compensation package for exceptional performers, as well as a generous compensation of sport and medical insurance Internal hackathons and meetups where each employee can act as a speaker Attendance sponsorship of IT events, professional conferences, and financial coverage of online and offline courses Hybrid working environment Professional and personal development, as well as the ability to change your area of expertise English language courses

Descripción: Acerca del empleo Colombia /  AI Fund – Bearing.ai /  Full time  Bearing is at the forefront of bringing AI to the maritime shipping industry. This is a trillion dollar industry that moves 90% of the goods we interact with on a daily basis, but has traditionally lagged far behind other industries in adopting new technologies. At Bearing, we’re changing that. We’re building an AI-driven platform that helps shipping companies dramatically streamline their operations and tackle their single biggest pain point. We’ve already built our first product and have some of the world’s biggest shippers as our partners. Our team is made up of highly experienced AI engineers and tech industry veterans and we’re backed by the AI Fund and shipping industry investors.  We are currently looking for an exceptionally talented DevOps Engineer to join our small team. You will be responsible for leading scaling efforts for our technology platform. Since you’ll be joining an early-stage startup at the ground level, you’ll need to be able to wear multiple hats and thrive while working in a dynamic environment.  What You Must Bring:  Must have 2-5 years of experience working in platform engineering, software product deployment, and API integration Must have hands-on experience in developing modern-software-deployment-flow. The candidate should have expert level knowledge of tools such as Jenkins, Docker, GitHub and Kubernetes Must have hands-on experience managing cloud-based work environment and storage system such as AWS, Google Cloud, or Azure Must have hands-on experience in building commercial-grade APIs. The candidate should have expert level knowledge in either OpenAPI or GRPC, and understand how to scale API from proof of concept (POC) to handle substantial traffic Must have hands-on experience in building development, testing, and deployment flow. The ideal candidate should be able to independently create a continuous integration system that automates unit-testing, integration-testing, and pre-deployment testing Must have a good understanding of service-based software architecture. Having hands-on experience in building microservices is a big plus Must be able to write clean and efficient code. Familiarity with object-oriented programming is a big plus  What We Have to Offer:  Food & commute benefits. Work from home benefits Medical and dental Insurance coverage for you and family members. Monthly education budget Collegial atmosphere Direct and transparent communication style Innovative environment Work with global AI Leaders Be part of a great cause to improve lives everywhere through artificial intelligence  At Bearing, we are committed to providing an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy (including childbirth, lactation and related medical conditions), national origin, age, physical and mental disability, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information (including characteristics and testing), military and veteran status, and any other characteristic protected by applicable law. AI Fund believes that diversity and inclusion among our employees is critical to our success as a company, and we seek to recruit, develop and retain the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool. Selection for employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need.

Descripción: Acerca del empleo Remote, Colombia  Hi, I'm Erika Plazas, your Recruiter. At CSG, we choose to see beyond a resume paper. We put your story, perspective, background, and what you have to offer first. While the traditional approach works for some, many miss out on fantastic talent like yourself, and we refuse to make that mistake. Instead, we believe that by channeling the power of all, we make ordinary customer and employee experience extraordinary.  Channel the power of YOU as the next Full-Time,) Senior operational Engineer - Cloud Platforms at CSG.  Who will love this job  A hybrid – you excel when you can choose your work style - remote, in-office, or a combination of both A grower – you learn new skills and expose yourself to experiences that you can apply quickly to enhance results A thinker – you take advantage of resources and implement ideas in new ways to find solutions An empath – you know how to connect and communicate with different audiences worldwide A collaborator – you love to work on projects that have functional workflows  What you'll do  You will report to the Senior Manager Software Developer to contribute toward supporting cloud platforms and the services that run on them (AWS/Azure/Google Cloud), CI/CD, and production support. You will provide support to customers to assist in the resolution of issues raised following their SLAs You will allocate tasks between development staff you will work with the TechOps Team, DevOps Team, and QA Team You will support the Development Teams in their daily usage of our cloud platform Take an on-call shift for production support out of business hours with a normal rotation  You should have  Research shows that candidates from underrepresented backgrounds often don't apply for roles if they don't meet all the criteria – unlike majority candidates meeting fewer requirements. Channel the power of YOU and apply to discover if we're a match.  Associate or Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, IT, related field, or equivalent experience 5 years of experience working to support a SaaS/PaaS platform. 5 years of experience working in a cloud environment (AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud) 5 years of experience working experience with support ticket and development task applications 1 year of experience with Docker 3 years of experience in PSQL & MySQL Experience in Python, Powershell & Bash Experience working in an Agile development environment 3 years of experience working, on virtual network layouts and network load balancers Proficient in English in a business environment  Perks & Benefits  Work from Home, in-office, or hybrid Medical & Dental Coverage Life Insurance Emotional and Mental Well-being Initiatives Volunteer Time Off Birthday Day Off Meal Allowance Education Reimbursement  Our Story  For over 40 years, we've serviced the world's most recognizable brands with future-ready solutions in customer engagement, revenue management, and payments that make ordinary customer experiences extraordinary. As a trusted technology provider in telecommunications, retail, financial services, and healthcare, our solutions impact over 900 customers in over 120 countries. Over 5,000 customer-obsessed CSGers in more than 20 countries made it possible and helped reach our $1 billion in revenue milestone.  Our Way of Life  Our people power a culture of integrity, innovation, and impact. In return, we power our people with the choice to work from home, in-office, or a hybrid work combination that integrates well with their lifestyle. You'll find CSGers exercising this choice at most of our locations worldwide.  We are committed to building and nurturing a diverse, supportive, and inclusive work environment where individuality is valued, and our people can flourish. We believe our workforce should reflect the world we live in and that we are stronger because of our differences. By embracing different backgrounds, attributes, experiences, and perspectives, we will help our employees, customers, and communities excel while, together, we work toward making social equality a reality.  We are committed to making a bigger community impact by creating new opportunities and access for underrepresented communities, protecting the environment, and developing technology solutions that foster digital inclusivity. That's just who we are. If not us, then who?  Follow us! LinkedIn | Facebook | Twitter  Location(s):

Descripción: Acerca del empleo *Non-bilingual candidates won't be considered for this position (English B2 intermediate - C1)*  About the company Lean Staffing is a company dedicated to providing staffing services for various companies in the United States. Our main market is the Logistics and Transportation Industry; however, we do tailor to other Industries as well. We currently have over 7.000 staffers and 6 branches. Our main goal is to connect local talent with international companies. We are looking for top-notch talent out there!  About the position The Cash Application Analyst will perform all functions related to customer payments, bank information, management of excel, fees, credits and receipts with Collections Department.  Responsibilities Works in Netsuite ERP environment to apply a high volume of customer payments Downloads bank info daily from bank websites Customer payments will be applied to 5 different bank accounts for various subsidiaries (3 USD, 1 EUR, 1 GBP) Knowledge of exchange rates to accurately post payments in different currency Ability to convert PDF or email remittance into excel. Use excel import template to populate remittance info (invoice number and amount) then import final csv file into Netsuite Post bank fees deducted from customer payments Customer payments are received via lockbox, branch deposits (once a week), credit cards, ACH/EFT/wire transfers Contact customers to request remittance detail or how to apply their credit memos Use either YAYPAY or Netsuite AR reports to identify unapplied cash receipts. Work with Collections Department and/or customers regarding same Handle requests from Collection team to reconcile customer accounts and/or reallocate application between multiple customer accounts Other ad-hoc requests from Collection team Become knowledgeable of payee names provided via the bank detail as many do not match our customer name in Netsuite Post non-customer payments through the deposit function. Reach out to AP or other department as needed to properly code (which GL account) Reconcile cash daily comparing bank data and Netsuite. Main report used is the MNX customer payments and deposits report along with other info within an excel file  Education Accounting background, experience or studies  Skills required Basic knowledge of Accounts Receivable Microsoft office applications including excel formulas (Ex. Pivot tables, SUMIF, VLOOKUP) Knowledge of Netsuite ERP a plus  Benefits 40 working hours per week Schedule from Monday to Friday. Weekends Off! Great work enviroment Competitive Salary Growth Opportunities

Descripción: Acerca del empleo En Sonda de Colombia nos encontramos en la búsqueda de un Operador de Data Center 1C. FORMACION: Técnico o Tecnólogo electrónico, electromecánica o afines. EXPERIENCIA: Con mínimo 1 años de experiencia en: Monitorear la infraestructura de todo el facility para asegurar la continuidad operacional. Custodiar los activos del facility. FUNCIONES: Operar en base a los instructivos de cada área del facility. Operar en base a los procedimientos de acceso al área del facility. Apoyo en la instalación de equipos TI en las salas blancas. Mantener actualizada la documentación de su responsabilidad. Desempeñar sus labores bajo el marco de normas y buenas prácticas de la empresa.  Trabajar en turnos rotativos 24x7  ¡Si cumples con este perfil, postúlate ahora!  Envíanos tu hoja de vida al correo: martha.mosquera@sonda.com-Maria.pacheco@est.sonda.com Asunto : Operador de Data Center 1C.
Descripción (inglés): [{'translation_text': 'In Sonda de Colombia we find ourselves in search of a Data Center 1C Operator. TRAINING: Technician or Electronic, electromechanical or related technologist. EXPERIENCE: With at least 1 years of experience in: Monitor the infrastructure of the entire facility to ensure operational continuity. Guard the assets of the facility. FUNCTIONS: Operate on the basis of the instructions of each area of the facility. Operate on the basis of the procedures of access to the area of the facility. Support in the installation of IT equipment in the white rooms. Keep up to date the documentation of your responsibility. Perform your work under the framework of norms and good practices of the company. Work in rotating shifts 24x7 If you fulfill this profile, post now! Send us your resume to mail: martha.mosquera@sonda.com-Maria.pacheco@est.sonda.com Subject: Data Center 1C Data Center Operator.'}]

Descripción: Acerca del empleo  Posición Titulo posición: ELC ANALYST Ubicación: Bogotá, Colombia Tipo de trabajo: Full time Acerca del rol  Nuestro equipo:  El ELC Analista garantizará que los procedimientos enumerados a continuación, se ejecuten dentro del marco legal B Bogota y políticas corporativas de Sanofi, que se realice y entregue la información bajo un ambiente adecuado de control y segregación de funciones, permitiendo minimizar los riesgos asociados al proceso.  Principales Responsabilidades:  On/Off boarding: Actualización de las políticas cuando sea necesario, comunicación de estas, asegurar su cumplimiento y aplicación de los controles internos mandatorios. De personal directo y tercerizado. Administración de beneficios: Auxilios y préstamos. Implementación de la política de beneficios, socialización y administración de esta siguiendo los debidos lineamientos y regulaciones legales. Asegurar la conciliación de préstamos mensual vs contabilidad y nómina. Solicitudes varias de empleados: certificaciones, afiliaciones, etc. Hacer la supervisión de la correcta prestación del servicio a empleados y ex empleados por parte del outsourcing. Facturación de servicios de HR: Asegurar la correcta y oportuna facturación de los beneficios como Medicina Prepagada, seguro de vida, club social. Garantizar las conciliaciones de esta facturación vs contabilidad y el proveedor de manera mensual. Archivo de personal: Asegurar el correcto mantenimiento del archivo de data de personal no solo en organización sino también en calidad de la información. Global Mobility: Asegurar la correcta implementación de los lineamientos de la política global garantizando una experiencia best in class para los extranjeros que llegan al país y aquellos colombianos que son promovidos a posiciones en el exterior. Gestión de cuota regulada SENA COL: Administración de la plataforma, vigilancia del pago de monetización, vigilancia de la cuota regulada por entidad legal. Administración de cajas de compensación familiar COL: Beneficios, comunicación y atención de requerimientos. Reporte a nómina de novedades que afectan la nómina de manera oportuna. Soporte y asesoría al empleado en temas core de HRS del B Bogota Coordinación con todas las áreas involucradas para la entrega oportuna y asertiva de solicitudes de información de Entidades Gubernamentales o Externas. Cumplimiento de Acuerdo de nivel de servicios con los diferentes interlocutores internos. Seguimiento mensual de recobro de incapacidades. Recibir incapacidades que se cargan en WD y recobor de las incapacidades con la EPS. COL Validación y aprobación de facturación de los servicios de outsourcing de administración de personal. Validación, aprobación y Compliance de los contratos con terceros. Establecimiento de SLA con el outsourcing de administración de personal COL y seguimiento mensual al cumplimiento de estos. Seguimiento de protocolos de seguridad de la información: back up permanente de los equipos del área, back up al cierre de año, uso de las herramientas de encriptación de la Compañía para el manejo de información, actualización permanente del Share Point del área. Informes varios derivados del modelo core de HRS. Cumplimiento, seguimiento y documentación trimestral de los controles internos mandatorios globales de la Compañía. Administración de sistemas propios de sanofi como son Crew, WD, ETC. Acerca de tí  Experiencia: Experiencia en HR Services  Compentencias técnicas: Workday  Educación: Profesional en carreras administrativas o similares  Idiomas: Inglés Intermedio  Persigue el progreso, descubre lo extraordinario  Lo mejor está ahí afuera. Mejores medicamentos, mejores resultados, mejor ciencia. Pero el progreso no sucede sin las personas - personas de diferentes orígenes, en diferentes lugares, haciendo diferentes roles, todos unidos por una cosa: un deseo de hacer que los milagros sucedan. Así que, seamos esas personas. En Sanofi, brindamos igualdad de oportunidades a todos independientemente de su raza, color, ascendencia, religión, sexo, origen nacional, orientación sexual, edad, ciudadanía, estado civil, capacidad, identidad de género o estado de veterano. ¡Ve nuestro video ALL IN y nuestras acciones de Equidad e Inclusión en sanofi.com!  At Sanofi diversity and inclusion is foundational to how we operate and embedded in our Core Values. We recognize to truly tap into the richness diversity brings we must lead with inclusion and have a workplace where those differences can thrive and be leveraged to empower the lives of our colleagues, patients and customers. We respect and celebrate the diversity of our people, their backgrounds and experiences and provide equal opportunity for all.

Título: Spanish speaking AI Community Surfer (formerly known as Search Engine Evaluator)
Descripción: Acerca del empleo The Role - Search Engine Evaluator Do you spend a lot of time on the internet and would like to get paid for helping improve the experience? Do you want a flexible work from home role that allows you to choose your own hours? Would you like to work in a job that gives you the opportunity to have fun working on a variety of different task types?  If you answered yes to any of the above, this job is for you! Join our AI Community where you can earn a fixed amount for each quality task completed.  In this role, you will be evaluating different task types to research which is better or analyzing a query and selecting the most relevant response to the query.  The Requirements Fluency in English & Spanish is essential. A keen interest in the internet is a must. Good attention to detail as all tasks will contain guidelines to follow. Ability to work on your own initiative and work independently is essential. The hours are flexible, you choose your own schedule. You have the opportunity to qualify on multiple task types to maximize your income. You can earn additional income working from the comfort of your own home. All guidelines and practice tasks will be in English. Access to a high speed internet connection and your own laptop / desktop with the latest version of Windows, all provided at your own expense. Working on other OS or mobile devices is not supported currently. A Windows Live ID is essential.  This is a freelance, independent contractor position.
Descripción (inglés): The Role - Search Engine Evaluator Do you spend a lot of time on the internet and would like to get paid for helping improve the experience? Do you want a flexible work from home role that allows you to choose your own hours? Would you like to work in a job that gives you the opportunity to have fun working on a variety of different task types?  If you answered yes to any of the above, this job is for you! Join our AI Community where you can earn a fixed amount for each quality task completed.  In this role, you will be evaluating different task types to research which is better or analyzing a query and selecting the most relevant response to the query.  The Requirements Fluency in English & Spanish is essential. A keen interest in the internet is a must. Good attention to detail as all tasks will contain guidelines to follow. Ability to work on your own initiative and work independently is essential. The hours are flexible, you choose your own schedule. You have the opportunity to qualify on multiple task types to maximize your income. You can earn additional income working from the comfort of your own home. All guidelines and practice tasks will be in English. Access to a high speed internet connection and your own laptop / desktop with the latest version of Windows, all provided at your own expense. Working on other OS or mobile devices is not supported currently. A Windows Live ID is essential.  This is a freelance, independent contractor position.

Descripción: Acerca del empleo A US-based travel company harnessing cutting-edge technologies to provide users with excellent travel and tourism services is looking for a Python/Django Developer. The selected candidate will be collaborating actively with cross-functional teams to build and deliver the core product. The company is helping users to always get the most comfortable seat on the best plane and the nicest suite in the most luxurious hotel. This is a great opportunity for developers who enjoy taking ownership of key projects and tackling challenging problems.  Job Responsibilities:  Work within the team to ship projects on time and meet stringent deadlines Boost the performance and responsiveness of the platform Comprehend the workflow and formulate plans to achieve targets Build and deliver testable solutions to various software processes  Job Requirements:  Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science (or equivalent experience) At least 3+ years of relevant experience as a software engineer A minimum of 3+ years of experience with Python (Django), ElasticSearch, and PostgreSQL Problem-solving and critical thinking ability Fluent in verbal and written English

Descripción: Acerca del empleo Funciones Del Cargo Buscamos Coordinador de Data Mining, responsable de la migración de los formatos normativos a GCP, Creación y generación de KPIs de la gerencia de Operaciones, Garantizar la generación recurrente de datos comprometidas con las áreas usuarias, Migración de procesos del área a PWC. Implementar y dar continuidad a los procesos con metodologías ágiles. Garantizar la mejora continua en las entregas y el feedback continuo con el equipo y retrospectiva para la mejora continua. Requisitos Profesional o Estudiante de últimos semestres ing. de sistemas o afines, experiencia mínima 2 años Conocimiento en BigQuery, powerBI, Tableau (preferible), Oracle, GCP (preferible); Agile. Experiencia en generación de estructuras de datos, construcción de ETLs e indicadores y reportes.  Únete a nuestro grupo y forma parte de nuestra familia gennials Contrato a término indefinido más los beneficios de la compañía. Modalidad de trabajo hibrida.
Descripción (inglés): [{'translation_text': 'Functions of the Cargo We seek Coordinator of Data Mining, responsible for the migration of the normative formats to GCP, Creation and generation of KPIs of the Operations management, Guarantee the recurrent generation of data committed to the user areas, Migration of processes from the area to PWC. Implement and give continuity to the processes with agile methodologies. Guarantee continuous improvement in deliveries and continuous feedback with the team and retrospective for continuous improvement. Professional requirements or Student of last semesters ing. of systems or related, minimum experience 2 years Knowledge in BigQuery, powerBI, Tableau (preferred), Oracle, GCP (preferred); Agile. Experience in generating data structures, construction of ETLs and indicators and reports. Join our group and form part of our gennial family Contract to indefinite term plus the benefits of the company. Modality of hybrid work.'}]

Descripción: Acerca del empleo Buena tarde estimada Red #Trabajoencasa Estamos en búsqueda de Desarrollador APX En Grupo CMC-CGI continuamos seleccionando el mejor #talento !!! ✨ Buscamos 🕵️‍♀️ #Java #Rest #Spring #Docker #Git #trabajosihay 👨‍💻 👩‍💻 Requisitos:  🚨 Ingeniería de sistemas o a fin 🚨 2 años de experiencia 🚨Experiencia en servicios rest, java, spring, Soringboot 🚨 Conocimientos en test unitarios y herramientas de integración continua  Si consideras que encajas en este perfil no dudes en enviarme tu CV!! 🏃‍♀️💨 👇👇  📩 leidyjohanna.naranjo@cgi.com o escríbeme un mensaje interno y estaré contestando tus dudas de la vacante.  Por favor confirmar aspiración salarial  Condiciones laborales:  🧾Contrato Indefinido ⌚ Horario de lunes a viernes 👌 Excelente remuneración 🏓 Beneficios y planes de bienestar 📚 Cursos virtuales  No eres tú ❓ #Comparte esta publicación o #etiqueta a tus #referidos me pondré en contacto con ellos

Please confirm wage aspiration Working conditions: Undefined contract  Schedule Monday to Friday  Excellent remuneration  Benefits and wellness plans  Virtual courses You are not '}]

Descripción: Acerca del empleo Job Description  Responsible for partnering with sales and manufacturers to provide technical expertise regarding applications of products/services. Answer questions and demonstrate how product offerings and services can solve customer problems and create sales opportunities to promote and reinforce the business image as a total solutions provider. Quote and manage orders for equipment and services sold for key manufacturers. Provides technical expertise as a specialist for product solutions to existing vertical customers, Outside and Inside Sales Representatives. Conducts detailed product demonstrations and supports pre-sale activities. Targets new retrofit customers and projects utilizing product solutions benefits and contractor/turnkey partnerships. Specifies products to meet customer requirements and needs, recommends inventory of products, and provides quotations working through existing manufacturers and in support of branch representatives. Provides quotes to customers including public bid documentation, bid and performance bond documentation and management of orders through delivery and collection. Partners with Purchasing and Regional Management to suggest inventory and manage price levels for all retrofit projects based on category objectives and supplier preference. Develops and maintains relationships with vendors and customers, focusing on key agents and serving as liaison for technical product manufacturers to the field. Trains and assists sales staff with product familiarity, new product development, related product technology, and sales skills. Manages customer cases on product installation, configuration and troubleshooting. Performs equipment commissioning/testing, project engineering/design and engineering product assembly. Provides on-going training and support regarding purchased controls, application and equipment, prior to and after installation has been completed. Conducts presentations for customers, consultant, fellow associates, conferences and meetings on product-related topics. Provides customer support to include answering customer questions and addressing concerns. Ensures all cases are resolved or escalated to appropriate resources. Lead and participate in presentation of Anixter products, services and capabilities at industry trade shows and conferences. Experience 5+ years of contract negotiation 3+ years working in the electrical utility industry for a manufacturer, distributor, utility, contractor, or engineering firm. Demonstrated skill in data analysis techniques by resolving missing/incomplete information and inconsistencies/anomalies in more complex research/data. Nature of work requires increasing independence; receives guidance only on unusual, complex problems or issues. Work review typically involves periodic review of output by a supervisor and/or direct "customers" of the process. May provide general guidance/direction to or train junior level support personnel or professional personnel. Education Bachelors Degree - Engineering degree, preferably in Electrical or Mechanical Engineering is required. Travel 25% - 50% WESCO International, Inc., including its subsidiaries and affiliates ("WESCO"), is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. It is the policy of WESCO to not discriminate against any job applicant or employee based on age, race, religion, color, handicap, sex, physical condition, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status or any other protected status. This policy includes but is not limited to the following: recruitment and employment, promotion, demotion, transfer, compensation, selection for training including apprenticeship, layoff, or termination.

Descripción: Acerca del empleo We are excited to announce that Camino Financial is growing! We are looking for some energetic and excited individuals looking to join our community! We are seeking a Frontend Developer - React.   We’re a financial technology start-up seeking a Frontend Engineer responsible for implementing a web application. The front-end must combine the art of design with the science of programming. Responsible for the translation of UI/UX design wireframes to actual code. There are times you will be expected to work independently to meet tight deadlines following design guidelines.   The ideal candidate will be a team player who is extremely hard-working and responsible; someone who is digitally savvy, self-motivated, resourceful, culturally aware, and shows enthusiasm for the business. To be consider for this position you should meet most of the next requirements:   At least four (4) years as Frontend Developer. English B2 or superior! At least one year of experience working with React. Experience with Typescript, JavaScript, HTML and CSS. Experience following TDD with tools like Jest. Experience writing components and pages in isolation with Storybook or Figma.   Responsibilities  Drive feature development end-to-end and work on large and innovative projects on a regular basis. Actively partner with product, design and engineering peers on scope management and iteration on innovative product features built for our users. Create presentation layers integrating with APIs and graphQL endpoints. Support reusable content and component libraries at scale. Optimize the speed, performance, and web experience on the current website improving web vitals.   Why Join Camino Financial? There are MANY reasons but here are just four:  Mission-driven company serving underbanked communities High-tech firm well-positioned to exponentially grow and disrupt the financial service sector The passionate, young and experienced management team and board of advisors Venture-backed start-up incubated at Harvard Business School   Don’t take our word for it, check out what the press says about us:   CNN Money: This Startup Helps Latino Businesses Get Funding (http://money.cnn.com/2016/03/16/smallbusiness/camino-financial-latino-business/index.html?iid=hp-grid-dom) NBC: What I've Learned: Growing Latino Businesses When Banks Won't (http://www.nbcnews.com/news/latino/what-i-ve-learned-growing-latino-businesses-when-banks-won-n504541) Univision: Los Gemelos Salas, Exitosos Empresarios Hispanos (http://www.univision.com/los-angeles/kmex/los-gemelos-salas-exitosos-empresarios-hispanos-video)   Looking forward to receive your application.   Camino Financial is an online finance company offering business loans and solutions to help small businesses grow. The company primarily lends to Latino-owned small businesses with unmet credit demand of $ 6.8 billion. As a tech-driven company, Camino Financial has created an online credit and educational experience that helps businesses improve their financial performance and graduate into cheaper and longer-term loans. Check out Camino Financial in the news! CNNMoney This startup helps underserved Latino businesses get funding Twin brothers Sean and Kenny Salas see a billion-dollar opportunity in a market that most traditional banks and lenders have long ignored: Latino small businesses. (99 kB) http://money.cnn.com/2016/03/16/smallbusiness/camino-financial-latino-business/index.html?iid=hp-grid-dom NBC News What I've Learned: Growing Latino Businesses When Banks Won't After his mother's restaurants closed, venture capitalist Sean Salas is helping Hispanic businesses grow when they lack financial resources. (51 kB) http://www.nbcnews.com/news/latino/what-i-ve-learned-growing-latino-businesses-when-banks-won-n504541 Univision Los gemelos Salas, exitosos empresarios hispanos Después de estudiar en prestigiosas universidades estos gemelos fundaron una empresa dedicada a ayudar a pequeños emprendedores latinos. (62 kB) http://www.univision.com/los-angeles/kmex/los-gemelos-salas-exitosos-empresarios-hispanos-video

Título: Científico/Científica de datos de gestión del fraude
Descripción: Acerca del empleo Nequi es una plataforma financiera 100% digital, que busca que tengas una mejor relación con tu plata para que logres lo que quieres con ella.  ¡Te necesitamos! 💪 Buscamos #TalentoNequi para crecer junt@s 💜 Te invitamos a ser parte del equipo Nequi y ayudarnos a mejorar la relación de las personas con la plata.  En tu rol como Científico/Científica de datos tendrás la oportunidad de ser el responsable de implementar proyectos de analítica de datos, para aplicar modelos sobre los mismos, que permitan usarlos en encontrar conocimiento de valor parar la organización, de tal forma que los tomadores de decisiones puedan guiar sus acciones a partir la información sobre el rendimiento de los negocios y la predicción de comportamientos futuros.  ¿Qué harías?  Definir e implementar modelos retrospectivos, prospectivos, descriptivos y predictivos, que permitan analizar la información disponible de las transacciones de los usuarios de Nequi, con el objetivo de identificar y mitigar los riesgos a los que se encuentra expuesta la organización.  Acceder y analizar la información confidencial de los usuarios de Nequi, con el fin encontrar relaciones entre variables o eventos que permitan identificar riesgos de fraudes.  Diseñar y administrar indicadores descriptivos y/o prospectivos de las alertas y modelos generados, que evidencien los niveles de detección de fraude, con el fin de ajustar y corregir oportunamente las posibles vulnerabilidades.  Interactuar con las diferentes áreas de analítica de Nequi, o áreas que puedan ser estratégicas para el desarrollo de modelos y proyectos de analítica de Gestión del Fraude, con el fin de generar sinergias, compartir fuentes de información e implementar mejores prácticas.  Explotar y potencializar herramientas que hagan uso de la información interna y externa, estructurada y no estructurada, a la que tiene acceso la organización.  Participar con el líder de la gerencia, en la preparación de proyectos e información estratégica para toma de decisiones que impacten la seguridad de Nequi.  Coordinar, elegir y construir las metodologías de mitigación del riesgo adecuadas, haciendo uso de analítica avanzada o minería de datos, teniendo en cuenta llevar a cabo el seguimiento de los cronogramas y garantizando la realización de pruebas y entrega de documentación pertinentes para la implementación de dichos modelos.  ¿Qué te hará exitoso en este rol?  Nivel académico: Profesional graduado/a de Ingeniería de Ciencia de Datos, Ingeniería informática, Ingeniería de Sistemas, estadística, matemáticas, economía. Contar con un buen manejo de herrramientas ofimaticas. Contar con conocimiento en análisis de información. Tener conocimiento alto en programación Contar con conocimiento en modelación Tener una especializacion en en estadística o afines. Contar con un nivel de ingles B1.  ¿Por qué trabajar en Nequi?  👛 Todo lo que hagas en Nequi tiene eco en los bolsillos de los usuarios. Haremos la vida más fácil a los colombianos, cambiando la manera de manejar la plata. 🔎 Cada día aprenderás cosas nuevas que te llenarán de emoción, pues juntos definimos el futuro de la industria financiera. 😎 Es todo un parche trabajar en Nequi, todos tenemos un grado de locura diferente, somos empáticos, cercanos, nos gusta trabajar en equipo, ante todo somos humanos. 🥊 En nuestra dinámica de trabajo, nos gustan las personas que vienen a proponer, que nos hacen preguntarnos cómo algo puede ser mejor y que se ponen manos a la obra para hacerlo. 🛣️ Nos encanta explorar nuevos caminos y tomar riesgos que lleven a la marca a otro nivel.  ¿Cuáles serían tus condiciones laborales?  Tipo de contrato: término indefinido. Jornada: diurna, tiempo completo. Modalidad de trabaja: hibrido.  Haz clic en solicitud sencilla, y ayúdanos a mejorar la relación de las personas con la plata 💪.

Descripción: Acerca del empleo Acerca de Abbott  Abbott es líder mundial en cuidado de la salud, que crea ciencia innovadora para mejorar la salud de las personas. Siempre estamos mirando hacia el futuro, anticipando cambios en la ciencia y la tecnología médica.  Trabajando en Abbott  En Abbott, Puedes Hacer Un Trabajo Que Importa, Crecer y Aprender, Cuidar De Sí Mismo y De Tu Familia, Ser Verdaderamente Quien Es y Vivir Una Vida Plena. Tendrás Acceso a  Desarrollo profesional con una empresa internacional donde podrás hacer crecer la carrera que sueñas. Una compañía reconocida como mejor lugar para trabajar en docenas de países alrededor del mundo y nombrada una de las empresas más admiradas del mundo por Fortune. Una compañía que es reconocida como una de las mejores compañías grandes para trabajar, así como un mejor lugar para trabajar para la diversidad, las madres trabajadoras, mujeres ejecutivas y científicas.  La Oportunidad  Esta posición está ubicada en Bogotá en la division de Diagnóstico Rápido.  Estamos potenciando la toma de decisiones médicas y económicas más inteligentes para ayudar a transformar la manera en que las personas manejan su salud en todas las etapas de la vida. Cada día, se realizan más de 10 millones de pruebas con los instrumentos de diagnóstico de Abbott, proporcionando resultados de laboratorio para millones de personas.  Nuestras soluciones de diagnóstico rápido están ayudando a abordar algunos de los mayores desafíos de atención médica del mundo.  Como LATAM NGO Sales Channel KAM es responsable de garantizar la asignación adecuada de recursos para negociar, desarrollar e implementar contratos multiproducto la división de diagnóstico rápido altamente rentables con financiadores globales, ONG y partes interesadas.  Que harás  Analizar las tendencias del mercado en relación con los objetivos de ventas y las actividades competitivas en cuentas estratégicas y clientes clave. Establecer y mantener relaciones con tomadores de decisiones clave e influenciadores dentro de las cuentas estratégicas de las ONG de LATAM, incluidos diplomáticos, Ministerios de Salud, partes interesadas globales, entre otros. Lidera el equipo de ventas multifuncionales en la negociación, desarrollo e implementación de contratos multiproducto con partes interesadas, financiadores, NGOs, OPS. Desarrollar e implementar planes de negocios para cuentas específicas. Trabajar con el personal de la organización de ventas global para garantizar que los planes estratégicos y operativos de ARDx se implementen y cumplan completamente para las cuentas objetivo. Responsable de entregar propuestas de negocios / soluciones y presentaciones de marca / posicionamiento a clientes clave y tomadores de decisiones.  Cualificaciones requeridas  Se requiere profesional, maestría o MBA  Cualificaciones preferidas  Más de 5 años de experiencia en relaciones de ventas senior. Nivel avanzado de inglés y español, portugués intermedio preferido. Experiencia en compañías multinacionales de atención médica o relacionadas, preferidas de La industria farmacéutica, de dispositivos médicos o de diagnóstico Debe tener una mentalidad estratégica para comprender las necesidades del país / mercado y vincularse a las soluciones IDEM, asegurando la financiación y la implementación de los programas propuestos. Conocimiento comprobado en economía de la salud, ya que los programas propuestos deberán demostrar el ROI y las necesidades futuras de inversión de los países a las iniciativas lanzadas.  Aplicar ahora  Siga tus aspiraciones profesionales con Abbott para obtener diversas oportunidades con una empresa que puede ayudarte a construir tu futuro y vivir tu mejor vida. Abbott es un empleador de igualdad de oportunidades, comprometido con la diversidad de los empleados.
