Descripción: Acerca del empleo MISIÓN GENERAL DEL CARGO Desarrollar estrategias de marketing que generen nuevas oportunidades de negocio a través de la recolección, análisis, extracción e interpretación de datos e información que permitan identificar segmentos de clientes, comportamiento del consumidor, propuestas de valor de competidores y tendencias del mercado. RESPONSABILIDADES DEL CARGO · Identificar segmentos de consumidores e información relevante que permita la construcción de buyers’ persona y la creación de estrategias de marketing y comunicación para cada uno de ellos, facilitando argumentos de venta y materiales para que los equipos comerciales tengan diferentes herramientas que mejores su efectividad en el cierre de ventas. · Analizar los resultados de investigaciones de mercado realizadas internamente o a través de terceros, con el objetivo de identificar tendencias del consumidor, clústeres de mercado, haciendo recomendaciones sobre oportunidades de negocio que mejoren la obtención de ingresos y el posicionamiento de marca de nuestros hoteles en sus compset. · Localizar y proponer planes de acción resultantes de los informes de marca realizados por el equipo de Marketing Corporativo, así como de Quality Focus de cara a potencializar las ventajas competitivas y/o diferenciales de la propuesta de valor de nuestros hoteles en la región y con ello incrementar el reconocimiento de marca y recompra. · Identificar feeder markets y audiencias de clientes a través del análisis de la información de diferentes herramientas (google analytics, e-commerce, redes sociales, metabuscadores etc.) como apalancamiento para aumentar la efectividad de las estrategias de publicidad pagas y orgánicas. · A partir de los lineamientos de filosofía corporativa (visión, beliefs, promesas operativas, descriptores de marca etc) diseñar los story telling y traducirlos en comportamientos o accionables (story doing) de tal suerte que las operaciones puedan ejecutar los estándares y promesa de valor a los clientes de forma consistente, brindando siempre experiencias memorables. · Apoyar la comprensión de qué drivers reputacionales a nivel de premios, reconocimientos y certificaciones sectoriales, podrían convertirse en argumentos de venta o elementos diferenciales que mejoren el posicionamiento de marca o el perfil de empresa socialmente responsable/sostenible. PERFIL Profesional en Marketing, Ciencias Puras, Administrativas o Económicas, Ingenierías y/o Ciencias Humanas, con estudios de post grado (o experiencia equivalente de 3 años) en Investigación de Mercados, Comportamiento del Consumidor, Marketing Estratégico y/o Marketing Digital. Mínimo tres (3) años de experiencia en cargos de relacionados. Dominio de inglés en nivel B2, según el marco común europeo; se valora habilidad lecto-escrita y oral de otros idiomas. Deseable conocimiento de paquetes ofimáticos en ambiente office, Power BI, Stata, Pyton, R, SQL, IBM Marketing Cloud y/o ERP-SAP, así como de herramientas avanzadas de presentación (suite adobe Canvas, Miro, Beatuful.ai) y/o Google Marketing Platform (DataStudio, Analytics 360, Surveys 360) HABILIDADES REQUERIDAS Orientación al servicio y foco en el cliente. Trabajo en equipo y preferencia en desempeñarse en ambientes incluyentes, diversos y de altos niveles de equidad. Pensamiento estratégico, creatividad y foco en innovación. Habilidades de comunicación verbal a nivel escrito y oral. Habilidades de análisis y síntesis de grandes volúmenes de información. Habilidades en análisis de alto volumen de información numérica, así como conocimientos en modelos estadísticos, softwares analíticos, modelos predictivos, etc. que faciliten el análisis y generación de informes. Facilidad de adaptación a ambientes cambiantes y/o de alta incertidumbre.

Descripción: Acerca del empleo Interested in working in a global environment with different cultures? If you think you'll enjoy challenging projects, learning new things and achieving best results, this may be the next step in your career!  What The Day Will Look Like You will carry out funding and accounting actuarial valuations You will work with and communicate with global teams and collaborate on global projects You will ask questions and learn new competencies You will focus on the quality of your assignment You will be expected to follow clear guidelines and have the opportunity to learn from experienced colleagues You will need to be detailed oriented You will be able to clearly communicate your work You will need to document your own work daily You will need to prioritize your tasks You will have project management responsibility  Skills That Will Lead To Success Makes learning own responsibility Requests feedback Ability to work independently and within a team environment on a variety of projects Receive instructions from global team and meet project deadlines Accuracy and attention to detail Self-motivated and results oriented Strong communication skills Solid quantitative and analytical skills Proficient in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word) Relevant proven track record (pensions or similar) will be an advantage Advanced English  Education  Educated to university degree level, preferably in Mathematics, Statistics, or Actuarial Science.  Proficient English is required  We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment.

Título: Ingeniero/a Procesos Sistemas Auxiliares e Industriales
Descripción: Acerca del empleo Tienes ganas de desarrollarte en una compañía en la que puedes llegar a ser socio/a? Nuestros valores esenciales son el Cliente, la Persona y el Desarrollo Profesional. Si te sientes identificado/a, ¡sigue leyendo!  SOBRE LA OPORTUNIDAD  Queremos incorporar Especialista en Ingeniería Procesos Sistemas Auxiliares e Industriales para nuestro equipo de Colombia en las oficinas de Medellín.  Desde IDOM te ofrecemos la oportunidad de desarrollar tu carrera profesional participando activamente en proyectos nacionales e internacionales que te harán superarte cada día, en un entorno de colaboración y trabajo en equipo. Te integrarás en un grupo multidisciplinar donde serás una pieza clave en el desarrollo de los proyectos. Tendrás una visión global de distintos negocios y tecnologías en un ambiente de trabajo flexible y de confianza.  Si te unes a IDOM encontrarás: Flexibilidad horaria Teletrabajo 1 día a la semana Seguro de vida y accidentes Conciliación vida familiar y profesional Apuesta por carrera profesional a largo plazo Acceso a la propiedad para todas las personas Ambiente joven, multicultural y multidisciplinar Actitud favorable a la delegación, más allá de lo habitual Compromiso mutuo Relaciones interpersonales que favorecen la unidad  SOBRE TÍ  No dudes en aplicar si...  Has estudiado Ingeniería Industrial, Mecánica o similar. Tienes experiencia de 3 a 12 años en disciplina procesos en desarrollo de proyectos de diseño/ingeniería de plantas industriales y de energía (plantas de generación eléctrica, oil&gas, acerías, minería.) en lo relativo a sistemas auxiliares (refrigeración, aire comprimido, vapor, condensado). Conocimientos de proceso (balances de masa y energía, cálculos hidráulicos, preparación P&IDs, dimensionamiento de líneas...). Experiencia en preparación de especificaciones y hojas de datos de equipos estáticos y dinámicos. Capacidad de trabajo en equipo y rigor técnico. Autonomía y mentalidad innovadora. Inglés avanzado. Y sobre todo... muchas ganas de aprender en una empresa internacional como IDOM.  SOBRE NOSOTROS  IDOM es una Asociación de Profesionales cuya actividad se enfoca en la realización de proyectos de Ingeniería, Arquitectura y Consultoría, que contribuyen a un mundo más sostenible. Las personas de IDOM estamos relacionadas por nuestro trabajo y por la propiedad de la Firma y cooperamos para lograr nuestro mayor desarrollo profesional y humano y el mejor servicio al Cliente.  Es por ello que el patrimonio básico de IDOM es la valía y la experiencia de sus personas. Profesionales de alta cualificación y calidad humana, profundamente unidos, que trabajan en un marco de respeto a su identidad y libertad profesionales, con fuerte ambición de progreso, desarrollo, servicio e innovación.  Desde nuestra fundación en 1957, el crecimiento ha sido continuo, constituyendo en la actualidad una organización multidisciplinar e integrada, de ámbito internacional, con presencia en 130 países en los que ejercemos nuestra actividad profesional más de 4.300 personas.  ¿Estas preparado/a para dar el siguiente paso?  Si te unes a nuestro EQUIPO podrás desarrollar tu carrera al más alto nivel, dentro de un entorno de profunda confianza y respeto profesional. Si compartes nuestra filosofía y quieres ser parte de nuestra compañía envíanos tu CV. ¡Queremos conocerte!

Descripción: Acerca del empleo WE HAVE SEVERAL POSITIONS TO FILL IN LATIN AMERICA - YOU CAN WORK REMOTELY FROM THE COMFORT OF YOUR HOME!  The Microsoft 365 team is looking for software developers. Are you interested in working on a product that ships new features every week?  Would you like to design and develop new components that solve complex distributed systems and search optimization problems?  If the answer to these questions is yes, then Microsoft 365 team would like to hear from you! We write software from the ground-up, running across thousands of servers. We are currently building a new system for searching data in an enterprise.  The goal of the system is to efficiently search all entity types such as emails, calendar items, contacts, documents, and so on with latency in milliseconds. To design the new system, we are applying a combination of approaches from the fields of API design, Machine Learning, Distributed Computing, Workflow engines, Algorithm Optimization, and many more. Come to define, design and deliver the next state of enterprise search system.  Responsibilities  Your responsibilities will include some or all the below: Designing and developing search platform related features and solutions Collaborate with the team on building a highly scalable and high performance search stack Collaborate with customers and partners to understand user requirements and design features to enable rich search experiences Working on distributed infrastructure, released and managing live service in production. Qualifications  Required Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in CS or equivalent experience At least 3 years’ experience in designing, developing and shipping software Solid C++/C#/Java skills with at least 5 years of C++/C#/Java programming experience 2+ years of experience in distributed systems and agile development environment Prior experience with development in large low-latency high-volume services, experience with service-oriented development and cloud-based systems. Experience in writing efficient multi-threaded and concurrent code Strong verbal and written communication skills in English with excellent interpersonal communication and collaboration skills Demonstrated commitment to the success of others. Preferred Qualifications Passion for delivering high quality software on a rapid ship cycle Enjoy learning and ramping up on new technologies quickly. Requirements  These requirements include, but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings  Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role.  Microsoft Cloud Background Check: This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud Background Check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter.  Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.  Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

Descripción: Acerca del empleo Position  System Engineer – Azure Cloud (Colombia – Cartagena)  Location  Colombia  Contract type  Permanent  General Description  As a global logistics service provider, Katoen Natie combines engineering, technology and port operations to offer worldwide, tailor-made solutions to the chemical and automotive industries, and to the consumer goods, electronics & retail sector. Katoen Natie has 181 logistic platforms and is active in 40 countries all over Europe, North America, South America and the Far East with a staff of more than 18.000 people.  Our Business Units Petrochemicals, Specialty Chemicals, Warehousing & Commodities and Food & Feed offer total solutions based on integrated logistics and engineering. To support these fast growing businesses, Katoen Natie is looking for a Competence Lead Testing.  Job Description  The System Engineer at Katoen Natie is responsible for the System environments, from design through implementation and support. Next to this, the System engineer performs investigation, diagnostics testing, repair and troubleshooting.  As a New System Engineer Working In a Regional Team At Katoen Natie You Are Familiar With At Least One, But Preferably More, Of The Following Technologies (order Of Appearance Is Irrelevant)  Hyper converged server systems (Nutanix) Multiple hypervisors (Vmware ESXi, Nutanix AHV) Microsoft Windows Server Operating System: roles and features Microsoft System Center Configuration Manager Microsoft SQL Server Microsoft Azure public cloud Microsoft Exchange on premise & online Microsoft Active Directory Citrix XenApp & Citrix netscaler Rubrik backup Enterprise DDI Enterprise PKI Enterprise Application Delivery Controller Scripting  Your profile  Required Experience  5+ years  You work within the infrastructure development team and focus on long-term projects. You are able to write technical documentations such as operational procedures, as-built documentation, logical- and physical designs. You are flexible in the sense you do not mind the rare occasional firefighting as a third line support engineer. You coordinate your activities with your peers in other regions (EMEA, AMER, and APAC). You collaborate to ensure standardized deployments across all regions as much as possible, given the local constraints. You stay in close contact with your peers through regular conference calls, meetings and travel. For that reason, and because of the international activities of Katoen Natie, you are willing to travel abroad for about 6 weeks per year.  In terms of personality, we are looking for a team player, someone who has strong technical, analytical and organizational skills. You should be able to communicate fluently in English, in a polite and friendly manner, both in writing and in speech.  Required Experience  5 years  We offer  An exciting job in a leading dynamic company with no-nonsense culture A job with high responsibility and lots of variety An attractive salary package

Descripción: Acerca del empleo Job Overview  Job Description  Are you a seasoned Sr. Cloud Developer- Full Stack .NET with AWS and/Azure Cloud experience? Do you have passion for building awesome customer experiences leveraging .NET and Angular/REACT for clients? Do you have experience helping customers modernize and bring their legacy .NET applications in the Cloud? Does working in an environment where customer focus meets global scale? If yes, this role could be a good fit for you.  Datavail is seeking a highly skilled, self-motivated and passionate Sr. Cloud Developer- Full Stack .NET to join our Application Development and Management (ADM) Global Practice. As a Sr. Cloud Developer- Full Stack .NET, you will be working on either designing beautiful and modern portal experiences for our clients or helping modernizing legacy .NET applications to bring them into the AWS/Azure cloud. This position is based out of our brand-new global delivery in Bogota, Columbia.  Datavail is one of the largest data-focused services company in North America and provides both professional and managed services and expertise in Database Management, Application Development and Management, Cloud & Infrastructure Management, Packaged Applications and BI/Analytics.  What you will do at Datavail: Design and Develop complex integrated web applications leveraging .NET technology stack including MVC, ASP.NET, .NET Core Web APIs, SQL Server Modernize legacy .NET applications to help retire technical debt by re-platforming and/or re-factoring them onto the AWS/Azure clouds using Containers/Kubernetes/Serverless Technologies, etc. Experience working with AWS and Azure DevOps including setup and support. Delivering a complete application with performance and security in mind Support, maintain, and debug existing applications Develop, code, and document additional modules and interfaces to existing applications Ensuring high performance on mobile and desktop Write unit test plans and provide coordination and support of testing using different tools Complete technical documentation and training material Help identify and solve frontend web development issues experienced by customers Lead a cross functional team of developers, designers and testers including 3rd party vendors in designing and building complex web applications Collaborate closely with team members in an agile environment (we like Scrum, Kanban) Identify problem areas in code and suggest solutions on how to tackle them Assist in evaluating technology choices and rapidly test solutions Participate in defect triage meetings Provide project and technical leadership to a geographically distributed QA & Testing team Provide technical direction to testing team members to adherence to coding, quality, functionality, performance, scalability and on-time delivery standards Billable Expectation for this role is 100%  What Will You Bring To Datavail University degree in the field of computer science, information systems, or software engineering, with greater than * years of relevant work experience. Web development experience, including Angular OR REACT, HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript (frontend and backend), REST/SOAP, AJAX, .NET MVC, .NET Core Web API, JSON/XML. Object oriented programming (C#). Experience with development of Single Page Applications Experience with building/modernizing .NET based applications in either AWS or Azure Cloud Strong experience with Containers (both Windows/Linux) as well as Kubernetes Experience with Microservices Architecture, Serverless Architecture, Cloud-Native .NET based solutions In-depth technical knowledge of operating systems, including primarily Windows (Linux is a nice to have). Experience following the iterative and agile SDLC and working in a DevOps/Agile environment (Azure DevOps, AWS DevOps tools such as Code Commit, Code Deploy, etc. Jenkins, GIT). Development techniques, such as debugging, testing, coding, use of productivity tools. Excellent understanding of coding methods and best practices including security considerations. Working with relational databases (mostly on MS SQL). Experience developing test cases and test plans, unit-testing. Experience managing complex clients in the past Proven track record of establishing strong customer relationships High level of emotional intelligence and ability to manage fuzzy situations Hands on experience with cloud environments is highly preffered. Cloud Certification preferred- Azure Developer or AWS DevOps Associate (or Professional) Certification

Do you have passion for building awesome customer experiences leveraging .NET and Angular/REACT for clients? Do you have experience helping customers modernize and bring their legacy .NET applications in the Cloud? Does working in an environment where customer focus meets global scale? If yes, this role could be a good fit for you.  Datavail is seeking a highly skilled, self-motivated and passionate Sr. Cloud Developer- Full Stack .NET to join our Application Development and Management (ADM) Global Practice. As a Sr. Cloud Developer- Full Stack .NET, you will be working on either designing beautiful and modern portal experiences for our clients or helping modernizing legacy .NET applications to bring them into the AWS/Azure cloud. This position is based out of our brand-new global delivery in Bogota, Columbia. Descripción: Acerca del empleo Id de solicitud de puesto:  54543  Nombre del cargo: Desarrollador de SW  Requisitos académicos: Profesional en sistemas y/o carreras afines.  Conocimientos en programación sobre plataforma .NET, Lenguajes C# y Pl-Sql Oracle  DESEABLE: Conocimientos en lenguaje Javascript, Windows Communication Foundation, experiencia en uso de herramientas de control de código fuente tal como TeamFoundationServer o TeamFoundationServices.  Requisitos de experiencia: Experiencia comprobable de mínimo tres años en actividades de programación de sistemas de softwaren .Net y Oracle  Funciones:  Comprender el requerimiento de software. Modelar y refinar especificaciones a fin de determinar un diseño detallado para implantar la funcionalidad requerida. Construir o adaptar clases, módulos u otras piezas de software. Reutilizar componentes existentes integrándolos con código propio. Verificar los programas producidos probándolos en forma unitaria. Revisar el código para resolver defectos o mejorarlo. Documentar los programas de acuerdo a estándares. Tanto con documentos funcionales y de arquitectura, como con comentarios en el propio código. Mantener las aplicaciones productivas, corregir errores e implementar nuevas funcionalidades. Cumplir con las entregas según las estimaciones de tiempo realizadas. Trabajar en estrecha colaboración con otros desarrolladores. Optimizar el rendimiento de las aplicaciones.
Descripción (inglés): [{'translation_text': 'Job application ID: 54543 Function Name: SW Developer Academic Requirements: System Professional and/or related careers. Knowledge in programming on .NET platform, C# languages and Pl-Sql Oracle DESEABLE: Knowledge in Javascript language, Windows Communication Foundation, experience in using source code control tools such as TeamFoundationServer or TeamFoundationServices. Experience Requirements: Checkable experience of at least three years in programming activities of software systemsn .Net and Oracle Functions: Understand the software requirement. Model and refine specifications to determine a detailed design to implement the required functionality. Build or adapt classes, modules or other software parts. Reusing existing components by integrating them with your own code. Verify the programs produced by testing them in unit form. Review the code to solve defects or improve it. Document programs according to standards. Both with functional and architectural documents, as with comments in the code itself. Maintain productive applications, correct errors and implement new functionalities. Complicate with deliveries according to the time estimates made.'}]

Descripción: Acerca del empleo Job Summary  This role will work within a team whose main focus will be to interpret the regulatory data received across different geographies, functions, divisions and ensuring key activities and regulatory systems updates are completed whilst adhering to all policies, practices and procedures. Timeliness/ accuracy in the data entry and removal of workload associated with data entry from Regulatory Strategy teams will be key performance indicators for this role. These activities ensure data integrity to enable the organization to have visibility across all functions within a products lifecycle. It is essential that all systems are clearly and accurately updated within the timelines specified in the Standard Operating Procedures (SOP) or business process documentation to ensure regulatory compliance.  Job Responsibilities  Review and interpret the data provided by the PCO to establish the system / tools required to be populated in line with current standard operating procedures or business process documentation, including systems and SOPs associated with the regulatory data scope. Perform data entry and quality control tasks associated in all global regulatory systems impacted, including systems associated with the regulatory data scope. Review audit reports from the systems and resolve errors to ensure integrity of data Identifies issues and provides input into solutions Accountable for remediation efforts associated with their scope as part of SCC global rollout. Perform monthly PEARL compliance report review and complete remediation activities in close partnership with Regulatory strategist teams Adhering to quality control procedures and standards related to the systems or tools ensuring Regulatory Compliance Support global/local team members with data management workload when necessary to provide flexible support for the portfolio. Adhere to Pfizer compliance standards Act as Regulatory Data SME in regions supported Produce country/regional reports as required Support audit as part of regulatory data / system scope Contributes to the completion of moderately complex projects as needed Has strong knowledge/understanding of the principles and concepts of the discipline. Makes decisions within guidelines and policies to resolve moderately complex problems Can support Manager and CDM leadership in the design or modification standard methods and techniques. May teach or mentor other more junior staff and review work completed by other colleagues when acting in mentor role. May be required to communicate and explain difficult issues and works to establish consensus May take responsibility for a portion of the work team’s milestones/ deliverables. May be performing the appropriate QC of analyst activities within the systems Coordinate the development of guidelines and keeping them updated holding key information on how to perform system update considering each market specifics.  Qualifications / Skills  Computer literacy in MS Word/Outlook/Excel/Adobe Acrobat. Proven technical aptitude and ability to quickly learn and use new software, regulations and quality standards Functional and technical knowledge and skills to do the job at a high level of accomplishment Proven technical aptitude Quick learner with ability to multi-task Ability to work with accuracy and attention to detail Ability to work with autonomy and/or part of a team in a busy environment Demonstrated ability to work in a highly regulated environment Quality focus Customer orientation Analysis and solution of problems Effective communication English intermediate to advance (written and spoken) Proven ability to coach and mentor others Proven ability to oversee and QC others work Ability to effectively communication with Regulatory professionals in other countries Academic Degree: Professional in Pharmaceutical Chemistry or equivalent Regulatory knowledge and experience (at least 4-5 years) Demonstrated ability to work in a highly regulated environment Project Management Experience  Pfizer is an equal opportunity employer and complies with all applicable equal employment opportunity legislation in each jurisdiction in which it operates.  Regulatory Affairs

Descripción: Acerca del empleo FullStack Labs is the fastest-growing software consultancy in the Americas. We help organizations like Uber, GoDaddy, MGM, Siemens, Stanford University, and the State of California, build distributed software development teams, and deliver transformational digital solutions. As an employee-first company, we focus on hiring the most talented software designers and developers in the western hemisphere, by creating a positive, respectful, and supportive work environment where they can achieve their greatest potential.  We’re most proud of: Offering life-changing career opportunities to talented software professionals across the Americas. Building highly-skilled software development teams for hundreds of the world’s greatest companies. Having delivered hundreds of successful custom software solutions, which have positively impacted the lives and careers of millions of users. Our 4.7-star rating on GlassDoor. Our client Net Promoter Score of 64, twice the industry average. Sustained growth of 100% - 200% per year.  The Position:  We're looking to hire several mid-level and senior Data Scientists to join our team. You'll work with our incredible clients in one of two ways: Team Augmentation / Staffing: You will integrate yourself directly into our client's team and work alongside their existing designers and engineers on a daily basis. Design & Build: You will work on a FullStack Labs product team to build and deliver a product to our clients.  What We're Looking For:  As a Data Scientist, you'll be working in a team responsible for Reports and Analytics for the highly loaded system and helping the team to achieve extraordinary results to impact the product and deliver the best solution to the market. 3 years of experience in databases in SQL Server or Oracle and ETL development. 3 years of experience in OOP and/or Functional Programming fundamentals, Design principles. Track record of anticipating technical problems that will fall out of major projects and designing solutions to overcome those problems. Experience in working with RESTful APIs. Experience in production support and troubleshooting. Self-organized and responsible person with experience in a distributed team. Good level of speaking and written English.  Nice to have: Experience in Ruby. Experience in AWS/Azure. Experience with Azure Logic Apps, SQL Server, ETL. JavaScript experience (React is preferred). Experience with web tooling (Webpack, Jest, NPM, Babel, etc). Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, a related field, or comparable work experience.  Benefits: Competitive Salary. Paid Time Off (vacation, sick leave, maternity and paternity leave, holidays). 100% remote work. The ability to work with leading startups and Fortune 500 companies. Health policy with Sura 100% for you and up to 4 primary family members. English Classes. Sodexo food card. 2 additional extra-legal bonuses per year worth up to 10% of salary. Virtual company events each month. Ample opportunity for career advancement. Continuing education opportunities.  FullStack Labs is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form, which can be provided upon request during our hiring and interview process.  Learn more about our Applicants Privacy Notice .

Descripción: Acerca del empleo Are you looking to broaden your professional experience? Would you like to join a dynamic and inclusive team? This opportunity is waiting for you!  Aon is in the business of making the best decisions  At Aon, we shape decisions for the better to protect and enrich the lives of people around the world.  As an organization, we are united through trust as an inclusive and diverse team, and we are passionate about helping our colleagues and clients succeed.  What will a typical day be like? Work in partnership with the Architecture team to approve, define, and refine IT solutions for LatAm, always aligned with Aon Global IT standards and the Global/LatAm IT strategy. Analyze solution definitions and solutions feasibility in order to support business teams and IT teams. Define solutions using existing platforms, integrating Aon standard platforms, aligned with Aon Global IT standards and the Global/LatAm IT strategy. To lead/guide strategic projects by defining/implementing solutions and managing ad-hoc teams. (E.g. DevOps, Talend, QA Automation, DASP (Reg. Data Lake), among others.) Provide technical guidance to AD local teams if required. To support regional tasks/needs such as vendors negotiation, regional KPIs definitions, tech candidate's interviews, development teams evaluations, among others.  Skills And Experience That Will Lead To Success Experience: 3 years Technical Knowledge: Frameworks: Java / .Net / PHP Web Containers: Apache Tomcat / IIS / WildFly Database: SQL / Oracle Web Services technology Integration tools (Eg. Talend or others) DevOps / Bitbucket SDLC Methodologies (Agile/Kanban/Scrum/Waterfall/among others). Studies and/or specialties: Systems Engineer Languages: Spoken/Written Languages: Spanish (Desirable) / English (Required) / Portuguese (Desirable)  How We Support Our Colleagues  In addition to our comprehensive benefits package, we encourage a diverse workforce. Plus, our agile and inclusive environment allows you to manage your well-being and work-life balance, ensuring you can be your best Aon self. In addition, all our colleagues enjoy two "Global Wellbeing Days" each year, encouraging you to take time to focus on yourself. We offer a variety of work style solutions, but we also recognize that flexibility goes beyond the workplace…and we're all for it. We call it Smart Working!  Our culture of continuous learning inspires and equips you to learn, share and grow, helping you reach your full potential. As a result, at Aon, you are more relevant, more connected, and more valued.  Aon values an innovative and diverse workplace where all colleagues feel empowered to be authentic. Aon prides itself on being an equal opportunity workplace.  “AON is a company that values people and everyone is important. We are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and diverse work environment in which all employees are treated with dignity and respect. At AON, discrimination and harassment against any employee or applicant on the basis of race, ethnicity, color, religion, national origin, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, or any other status protected by law. Here we comply with all applicable national and local laws and regulations regarding non-discrimination and employment.”

Descripción: Acerca del empleo En Ariadna Communications Group, buscamos Business Developer para una de nuestras unidades de negocio. Experiencia mínima de 3 años en ventas y desarrollo de propuestas para B2B, dentro de las industrias de marketing digital, performance, tecnología o consultoría. Con habilidad comercial para detectar oportunidades, capacidad para integrar equipos multidisciplinarios en la ejecución de las propuestas, y cumplir con una meta de cierre de negocios mensual.  Importante contar con nivel de inglés mínimo B2  Si cumples con el perfil, no dudes en aplicar.
Descripción (inglés): [{'translation_text': 'At Ariadna Communications Group, we look for Business Developer for one of our business units. Minimum 3 years experience in sales and development of B2B proposals, within the digital marketing, performance, technology or consulting industries. With business ability to detect opportunities, ability to integrate multidisciplinary teams in the execution of proposals, and meet a monthly business closure goal. Important to have minimum B2 English level If you meet the profile, feel free to apply.'}]

Descripción: Acerca del empleo Description  Sobre ADDI  Somos una empresa de tecnología que trabaja para transformar el crédito y la banca en América Latina comenzando con el financiamiento en el punto de venta. Nuestro objetivo es crear servicios financieros justos, simples y asequibles que empoderen a nuestros clientes, tratándolos con dignidad y generando libertad financiera. Empezamos en febrero de 2019 y ya hemos atendido a miles de clientes y desembolsado millones de dólares.  Operamos como una startup full stack. Hemos construido nuestros sistemas y procesos centrales desde cero, y creemos que nuestra plataforma de tecnología y análisis impulsará nuestro progreso en los próximos años. Llegamos a esto con una profunda experiencia en la creación y el crecimiento de equipos de tecnología y productos financieros. Tan importante como lo que hacemos es cómo lo hacemos. Somos una empresa consciente y estamos profundamente comprometidos con trabajar y vivir nuestros cinco valores fundamentales: una empresa de propietarios que inspiran a los colegas, hacemos de lo imposible, posible, nos preocupamos y confiamos, actuamos con integridad, ganamos hoy y todos los días y escalamos exponencialmente.  Estamos respaldados por Andreessen Horowitz, Monashees, Village Global y un destacado equipo de ángeles individuales, incluidos Kevin Ryan, Josh Abramowitz y Scott Weiss.  Descripción del cargo  El área de collections tiene como objetivo fidelizar a nuestros clientes a través del proceso de cobranza, instruir y apoyar el hábito de pago en nuestros clientes, somos una ficha clave en el crecimiento de la compañia a la que pertenecemos y trabajamos con altos indices de calidad. En la ejecución, la clave es la actitud de servicio, la venta de soluciones y el seguimiento de instrucciones y procesos.  El Analista de cobranza será el encargado de brindar de forma permanente servicio a nuestros clientes, apoyar su proceso de pago y crear un hábito, Atenderá al usuario satisfaciendo sus necesidades y expectativas, con base en los requerimientos del área, cumpliendo los estándares de calidad, productividad, servicio, metas de recuperacion establecidas por el área y obligaciones establecidas por la Compañía.  Requirements  Requisitos Experiencia mínima de 6 meses como Analistas de Cobranzas. Experiencia trabajando en cobranzas para una institución financiera. Bachiller, Técnico, Tecnólogo o Estudiante Universitario de cualquier carrera. Nivel de Ingles A1. Competencias Manejo de herramientas ofimáticas Conocimientos en Contact center Creatividad E Innovación Ética y confidencialidad Orientación a resultados Adaptabilidad al cambio Cualidades comerciales Trabajo en Equipo Benefits  Beneficios Trabajar junto a un gran y diverso equipo que se preocupa por lo que estamos haciendo y cómo lo estamos haciendo. Medicina prepagada con cobertura al 100% (50% para beneficiarios). Gran oportunidad de mercado por delante; estamos creciendo más rápido que cualquier otro prestamista fintech en nuestra etapa.

Empezamos en febrero de 2019 y ya hemos atendido a miles de clientes y desembolsado millones de dólares.  Operamos como una startup full stack. Hemos construido nuestros sistemas y procesos centrales desde cero, y creemos que nuestra plataforma de tecnología y análisis impulsará nuestro progreso en los próximos años. Llegamos a esto con una profunda experiencia en la creación y el crecimiento de equipos de tecnología y productos financieros. Tan importante como lo que hacemos es cómo lo hacemos. Somos una empresa consciente y estamos profundamente comprometidos con trabajar y vivir nuestros cinco valores fundamentales: una empresa de propietarios que inspiran a los colegas, hacemos de lo imposible, posible, nos preocupamos y confiamos, actuamos con integridad, ganamos hoy y todos los días y escalamos exponencialmente.  Estamos respaldados por Andreessen Horowitz, Monashees, Village Global y un destacado equipo de ángeles individuales, incluidos Kevin Ryan, Josh Abramowitz y Scott Weiss.  Descripción del cargo  El área de collections tiene como objetivo fidelizar a nuestros clientes a través del proceso de cobranza, instruir y apoyar el hábito de pago en nuestros clientes, somos una ficha clave en el crecimiento de la compañia a la que pertenecemos y trabajamos con altos indices de calidad. En la ejecución, la clave es la actitud de servicio, la venta de soluciones y el seguimiento de instrucciones y procesos.  El Analista de cobranza será el encargado de brindar de forma permanente servicio a nuestros clientes, apoyar su proceso de pago y crear un hábito, Atenderá al usuario satisfaciendo sus necesidades y expectativas, con base en los requerimientos del área, cumpliendo los estándares de calidad, productividad, servicio, metas de recuperacion establecidas por el área y obligaciones establecidas por la Compañía.  Requirements  Requisitos Experiencia mínima de 6 meses como Analistas de Cobranzas. Experiencia trabajando en cobranzas para una institución financiera. Bachiller, Técnico, Tecnólogo o Estudiante Universitario de cualquier carrera. Nivel de Ingles A1. Competencias Manejo de herramientas ofimáticas Conocimientos en Contact center Creatividad E Innovación Ética y confidencialidad Orientación a resultados Adaptabilidad al cambio Cualidades comerciales Trabajo en Equipo Benefits  Beneficios Trabajar junto a un gran y diverso equipo que se preocupa por lo que estamos haciendo y cómo lo estamos haciendo. Medicina prepagada con cobertura al 100% (50% para beneficiarios). Gran oportunidad de mercado por delante; estamos creciendo más rápido que cualquier otro prestamista fintech en nuestra etapa.

Descripción: Acerca del empleo Con una excepcional trayectoria, iuvity entrega soluciones innovadoras y seguras a través de canales digitales a entidades financieras en América Latina que desean transformar positivamente la vida de sus clientes. En iuvity buscamos humanizar la relación entre las personas y su mundo financiero entregando soluciones de canales digitales a las entidades financieras que quieran llegar a sus usuarios con una propuesta diseñada para facilitar su uso y adopción.  Con una fuerte presencia regional, más de 10.000.000 de usuarios y 4000 millones de transacciones en el último año cubrimos todo el espectro de las necesidades de canales digitales que tienen las instituciones financieras.  Actualmente estamos buscando integrar en nuestro equipo de trabajo a un Analista de Soporte Técnico con 2 años de experiencia, quien será el responsable de apoyar y atender los requerimientos de los usuarios internos de iuvity, a través de los procedimientos y principios de actitud de servicio establecidos en el área, con el fin de garantizar que todos los empleados de la compañía cuenten con el soporte tecnológico adecuado para realizar sus funciones.  Conocimientos técnicos requeridos: Mantenimiento y soporte de primer nivel para computadores. Redes. Inglés Intermedio
Descripción (inglés): [{'translation_text': 'With an exceptional trajectory, iuvity delivers innovative and secure solutions through digital channels to financial institutions in Latin America that want to positively transform the lives of their clients. At iuvity we seek to humanize the relationship between people and their financial world by delivering digital channel solutions to financial institutions that want to reach their users with a proposal designed to facilitate their use and adoption. With a strong regional presence, more than 10,000,000 users and 4000 million transactions in the last year we cover the full spectrum of digital channel needs that financial institutions have. We are currently looking to integrate into our work team a Technical Support Analyst with 2 years of experience, who will be responsible for supporting and meeting the requirements of internal users of iuvity, through the procedures and principles of service attitude established in the area, in order to ensure that all employees of the company have the appropriate technological support to perform their functions. Required technical knowledge: Maintenance and support of first level for computers. Networks. English Intermediate English'}]

Título: Analyst, Global Advisory Solutions | IMPACT Career Acceleration Program, Middle East and Africa (MEA), Asia and LATAM Regions
Descripción: Acerca del empleo About Global Advisory Solutions (GLAS): We are a diverse and close-knit global team with one common social purpose: building a financially inclusive world for small businesses and low-income households. We are passionate about what we do — working with a wide range of financial service providers and other partners across the world to build sustainable businesses that open opportunity for those that have been underserved by the financial system for too long. We enjoy solving problems, being exposed to new ideas, sharing information, and asking, “what if?”.  About our IMPACT Career Acceleration Program: The Global Advisory Solutions IMPACT Program is a 2-year career acceleration program that offers aspiring leaders the opportunity to develop knowledge and deepen their understanding of inclusive finance. This global program is geared toward individuals who have waded into development or finance through completing a graduate program or taking on an entry level role and are interested in a career focused on consulting services in the impact space.  The IMPACT program is a starting point for a career in the consulting space and a unique opportunity for curious and innovative individuals who have a passion for social change to make an IMPACT. In this program you will:  Imagine the possibilities for inclusive finance in a digital world. Make a tangible difference both local and global. Plug into different technical areas and get hands on experience. Access targeted trainings and webinars related to your focus area. Create viable solutions with a team of experts. Test ideas and share learnings.  Position Responsibilities: This Analyst position will support three components of GLAS work: Project Assignments, Proposals & Business Development, and Internal Business Practices. During the first year of the IMPACT program the Analyst will have the opportunity to gain exposure and experience in different technical (capability) areas. Each Analyst will have the opportunity to obtain hands-on project experience that will include a learning agenda tailored for that individual. Our standards of excellence are grounded in 1) our values of respect, excellence, and passion for social change and 2) our commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion.  Project Assignments: Participate in project assignments designed to identify and define issues, review, and analyze evidence, and document business processes. Prepare working papers to support results of engagements. Contribute to the development of project plans including but not limited to the following: supporting the development of fieldwork task schedules, scheduling and preparing for workshops and interviews, gathering documentation, and liaising with client staff. Learn more about client business conditions by supporting interviews with client management to gain an understanding of client business conditions. Conduct market scans and analyze key trends (regulation, technological changes, competition, etc.) to identify market opportunities or risks and threats. Compile findings in country dossiers and presentations. Provide support to the team in the coordination and communication of the results of consulting projects via written reports and oral presentations to management. Participate in the drafting of reports and the presentation of the reports to senior advisor(s) for review. Other related projects and learning opportunities as assigned.  Proposals & Business Development: Learn about and support end to end the proposal development and submission process. Engage in networking events related to GLAS service offerings.  Internal Business Practices: Support internal innovation through active engagement in the identification and recommendation of innovative solutions to improve internal work processes. Other work duties as assigned.  First year IMPACT agenda will include: The opportunity to meet with regional heads to discuss business trends and current projects. Participate in a Problem/Solution Challenge. Be introduced to and have the ability obtain learning opportunities in each GLAS capability area. Learn about different areas within Accion including the Center for Financial Inclusion, Venture Lab, and Global Investments. Mentee/Mentor opportunity.  Position Qualifications: Passion for the social sector and keenness toward technology-enabled business models. Experience of 2+ years in a reputed consulting organization or fintech or financial services provider. MBA or equivalent with a background in or inclination toward infotech, financial services, or social sector is preferred. Innovative mind-set and fresh perspective to the design and development of new and existing business models to support clients in achieving break-through results. Ability to study and quickly understand business processes, team dynamics and customer needs. Ability to structure and scope complex problems and apply a range of analytical tools to develop solutions. Curious mindset & demonstrated initiative to learn the developments in fintech and financial inclusion domain, an entrepreneurial spirit. Excellent people skills, experience with multi-cultural environments is preferred. Proven multi-tasking skills with a positive, can-do attitude and an approach of “every job is important.” Team player who enjoys working in a semi/un-structured environment. Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English; French or Spanish is a bonus. Proven project management skills. Demonstrated fluency in financial modelling tools such as Excel. Ability to create visually appealing presentations. Willingness to travel (30-40%). Interest in our mission and working globally. Willingness to embody our values of excellence, respect and passion for social change. Excellence: Accion staff should always put forth their best effort in all activities, strive for high quality of collective and individual performance; and demonstrate honesty and integrity at all times while in the workplace and while working on behalf of the organization. Respect: Accion staff should value one another’s roles and responsibilities as much as their own, be encouraging, and value the diverse and unique perspectives of colleagues. They should honor obligations and commitments to each other and to external partners. Passion for Social Change: Accion staff should be committed to making a difference in the lives of those less fortunate, value the greater good of the organization over personal gain, and promote a productive workplace by acknowledging the accomplishments of others.  These positions will be based in Asian, African and LATAM countries.

Descripción: Acerca del empleo Job Description  Intern - Associate Solution Consultant  JOB SUMMARY:  We are looking for a dynamic, energetic interns who are eager to learn about and contribute to payments industry. Supports the demo applications creation to enhance the services provided by the Solution Consulting department on the ACI Worldwide solutions portfolio, throughout the pre-sale and marketing process.  JOB ACCOUNTABILITIES: Code sample applications that act as front end to our core payment engines. Assist on the development of various sample front end apps, such mobile payments wallets, merchant and biller portals. Develop and consume new APIs for payments services. Use your imagination to develop new use cases around the exciting electronic payments ecosystem. Assist Senior Consultants on the setup of Demo and PoC environments to showcase our product features to customers and prospects. Understand and Adhere to all Corporate Policies, including but not limited to ACI Code of Ethics and Global Information Security. Communicate effectively with the site supervisor, and other staff within the organization; accept and apply critiques and suggestions to daily work in an effort to become more productive and/or efficient. Work on assignments requested by the university or the company. Present progress report to site supervisor and University.  Qualifications -  MINIMUM JOB REQUIREMENTS: Student in minimum eight semester, in education in areas such as: system or electronic engineering. The internship must be a requirement to obtain the bachelor’s degree studies. Excellent handling of office automation tools, particularly Microsoft Office. English proficiency. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Culture of proper handling and confidentiality of information. Knowledge in Java/Android or Angular/NodeJS is desirable .  Dimensions: Standard Office Equipment Majority time spent on PC (Phys. Req.)  Benefits: In return for your expertise, we offer growth opportunity, competitive stipend, and opportunity to work in world class environment.

Descripción: Acerca del empleo Qualifications Bachelor's degree; Advanced graduate degree (e.g., MBA, PhD, etc.) or equivalent (typically 5+ years) work experience preferred; Requirements may vary by country or practice Ability to work collaboratively in a team and create an inclusive environment with people at all levels of an organization Capability to drive an independent workstream in the context of a broader team project Comfort with ambiguous, ever-changing situations Ability to break down and solve problems through quantitative thinking and analysis Ability to communicate effectively, both verbally and in writing, in English and local office language(s)  What You'll Do  You'll work in teams of typically 3 - 5 consultants to identify, and oftentimes implement, potential solutions for a specific client problem or challenge. Together, you will help clients make lasting improvements to their performance and realize their most important goals.  Over the course of each project, you will gather and analyze information, formulate and test hypotheses, and develop and communicate recommendations. You'll also present results to client management and implement recommendations in collaboration with client team members. In some cases, you will be asked to travel to your client site.  When you join McKinsey, you are joining a firm whose culture is distinctive and inclusive. We will accelerate your development as a leader to create positive, enduring change in the world. As an associate, you will receive training and coaching on how to better Structure ambiguous problems and take action to solve them Synthesize clear takeaways from complex information into clear takeaways and recommendations using both qualitative and quantitative methods Work effectively with diverse teams to come up with the best solution and move people and organizations to act Establish trust-based relationships with clients to better serve their organizations Communicate effectively with all audiences, including senior leaders, in a structured manner Develop your leadership style, leveraging your own passions, strengths, and personal values McKinsey believes in strengths-based development and coaching, and you’ll receive frequent mentoring from colleagues. This will include a senior colleague from your office or practice who will help you grow and achieve your career goals. Additionally, you will have a professional development manager who manages staffing to help you choose projects based on your priorities as well as the needs of client service teams.  While all consultants develop specialized knowledge as they progress with McKinsey, most are initially broad in their focus, meaning they do not need specific industry or functional expertise to be successful. For consultants who join McKinsey as experienced professionals, this can mean building on previous knowledge or developing experience in an area that is completely new.  Who You'll Work With  You will join one of our offices around the world to work in teams and directly with our clients. In addition to these locations, this job opportunity is also available in Ho Chi Minh City.  In this role you will help our clients in the private, public, and social sectors solve their most pressing problems. You will also work with many experts, from data scientists and researchers to software and app designers.

Descripción: Acerca del empleo Acerca de usted:  Si tiene ambiciones de clase mundial para alcanzar las estrellas mientras mantiene los pies en la tierra, somos el equipo para usted. Hemos creado una nueva generación de empresas, centradas en el futuro con una ambición reinventada en todas las disciplinas del sector energético.  Amamos a las personas que conocen su propio potencial y no tienen miedo de usarlo. Sabemos que juntos, somos mucho más que la suma de nuestras partes. Por lo tanto, celebramos a las personas que quieren crecer y desarrollarse a medida que trabajemos juntos en algunos de los proyectos más grandes en el escenario mundial de la energía.  Nuestro propósito y creencias:  En Kent, estamos abordando el mayor desafío de nuestro tiempo: llevar a nuestro mundo la energía que necesita de la manera más responsable jamás imaginada.  Es la energía de cada miembro de nuestro equipo impulsada por nuestras creencias lo que está haciendo que esto suceda. Cualquiera que sea nuestra habilidad, nuestro idioma o nuestra cultura. Estas creencias nos definen y nos dirigen todos los días para ser los mejores, para nosotros, nuestros clientes, nuestras partes interesadas clave, las comunidades en las que operamos y el planeta:  JUGAMOS A LO GRANDE  Prosperamos en AGILIDAD EMOCIONAL  Somos FANÁTICOS DEL RENDIMIENTO  Estamos construidos sobre el PENSAMIENTO INFINITO  Lea más sobre el Propósito, las Creencias y los Principios Rectores que nos impulsan: https://kentplc.com/who-we-are/purpose-beliefs  Nuestra visión para la Diversidad, la Inclusión y la Pertenencia:  Reconocemos que la diversidad y la inclusión son catalizadores del éxito. Estamos aumentando la conciencia sobre los beneficios de la diversidad de las personas, la diversidad de experiencias y la diversidad de nuestras perspectivas. Crear una cultura de inclusión donde todos los empleados sientan un sentido de pertenencia.  La combinación de nuestra energía es alimentada por diferentes nacionalidades, en 6 continentes y 24 países. Nuestro compromiso es celebrar el carácter, sin importar el origen étnico, el género, la edad, la religión, la identidad o la discapacidad.  Sobre el trabajo:  Kent está buscando un Ingeniero Junior Automatización para apoyar a los proyectos en curso. Esta posición se encuentra en nuestra oficina de Bogotá, Colombia.  Sus responsabilidades:  Elaborar diseños (documentos y planos) e incorporar comentarios, de acuerdo con solicitudes puntuales del área de Ingeniería y de los Proyectos, utilizando el software y paquete office y normas, con el fin de dar cumplimiento a los requerimientos de cada disciplina. Registrar el consumo de Horas – Hombre de cada entregable. Gestión de Calidad Técnica en entregables. Sus conocimientos/habilidades, educación y experiencia:  Calificación / Certificación:  Profesional en Ingeniería Eléctrónica No se requiere experiencia previa Requisito de habilidades:  Conocimiento teórico a nivel profesional acordes a la especialidad. Conocimientos básicos en sistemas de control, seguridad e instrumentación. Manejo básico de Autocad. Comunicación:  Deseable inglés intermedio. Excelentes habilidades de comunicación: verbal y escrita, Usted piensa que una carrera en nuestro equipo podría coincidir con su perfil, ¡envíe su solicitud en línea ahora!

Excelentes habilidades de comunicación: verbal y escrita, Usted piensa que una carrera en nuestro equipo podría coincidir con su perfil, ¡envíe su solicitud en línea ahora!

Descripción: Acerca del empleo WE HAVE SEVERAL POSITIONS TO FILL IN LATIN AMERICA - YOU CAN WORK REMOTELY FROM THE COMFORT OF YOUR HOME!  The Microsoft 365 team is looking for software developers. Are you interested in working on a product that ships new features every week?  Would you like to design and develop new components that solve complex distributed systems and search optimization problems?  If the answer to these questions is yes, then Microsoft 365 team would like to hear from you! We write software from the ground-up, running across thousands of servers. We are currently building a new system for searching data in an enterprise.  The goal of the system is to efficiently search all entity types such as emails, calendar items, contacts, documents, and so on with latency in milliseconds. To design the new system, we are applying a combination of approaches from the fields of API design, Machine Learning, Distributed Computing, Workflow engines, Algorithm Optimization, and many more. Come to define, design and deliver the next state of enterprise search system.  Responsibilities  Your responsibilities will include some or all the below: Designing and developing search platform related features and solutions Collaborate with the team on building a highly scalable and high performance search stack Collaborate with customers and partners to understand user requirements and design features to enable rich search experiences Working on distributed infrastructure, released and managing live service in production. Qualifications  Required Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in CS or equivalent experience At least 3 years’ experience in designing, developing and shipping software Solid C++/C#/Java skills with at least 5 years of C++/C#/Java programming experience 2+ years of experience in distributed systems and agile development environment Prior experience with development in large low-latency high-volume services, experience with service-oriented development and cloud-based systems. Experience in writing efficient multi-threaded and concurrent code Strong verbal and written communication skills in English with excellent interpersonal communication and collaboration skills Demonstrated commitment to the success of others. Preferred Qualifications Passion for delivering high quality software on a rapid ship cycle Enjoy learning and ramping up on new technologies quickly. Requirements  These requirements include, but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings  Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role.  Microsoft Cloud Background Check: This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud Background Check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter.  Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.  Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

Descripción: Acerca del empleo FullStack Labs is the fastest-growing software consultancy in the Americas. We help organizations like Uber, GoDaddy, MGM, Siemens, Stanford University, and the State of California, build distributed software development teams, and deliver transformational digital solutions. As an employee-first company, we focus on hiring the most talented software designers and developers in the western hemisphere, by creating a positive, respectful, and supportive work environment where they can achieve their greatest potential.  We’re most proud of: Offering life-changing career opportunities to talented software professionals across the Americas. Building highly-skilled software development teams for hundreds of the world’s greatest companies. Having delivered hundreds of successful custom software solutions, which have positively impacted the lives and careers of millions of users. Our 4.7-star rating on GlassDoor. Our client Net Promoter Score of 64, twice the industry average. Sustained growth of 100% - 200% per year.  The Position:  We're looking to hire several mid-level and senior Data Scientists to join our team. You'll work with our incredible clients in one of two ways: Team Augmentation / Staffing: You will integrate yourself directly into our client's team and work alongside their existing designers and engineers on a daily basis. Design & Build: You will work on a FullStack Labs product team to build and deliver a product to our clients.  What We're Looking For:  As a Data Scientist, you'll be working in a team responsible for Reports and Analytics for the highly loaded system and helping the team to achieve extraordinary results to impact the product and deliver the best solution to the market. 3 years of experience in databases in SQL Server or Oracle and ETL development. 3 years of experience in OOP and/or Functional Programming fundamentals, Design principles. Track record of anticipating technical problems that will fall out of major projects and designing solutions to overcome those problems. Experience in working with RESTful APIs. Experience in production support and troubleshooting. Self-organized and responsible person with experience in a distributed team. Good level of speaking and written English.  Nice to have: Experience in Ruby. Experience in AWS/Azure. Experience with Azure Logic Apps, SQL Server, ETL. JavaScript experience (React is preferred). Experience with web tooling (Webpack, Jest, NPM, Babel, etc). Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, a related field, or comparable work experience.  Benefits: Competitive Salary. Paid Time Off (vacation, sick leave, maternity and paternity leave, holidays). 100% remote work. The ability to work with leading startups and Fortune 500 companies. Health policy with Sura 100% for you and up to 4 primary family members. English Classes. Sodexo food card. 2 additional extra-legal bonuses per year worth up to 10% of salary. Virtual company events each month. Ample opportunity for career advancement. Continuing education opportunities.  FullStack Labs is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form, which can be provided upon request during our hiring and interview process.  Learn more about our Applicants Privacy Notice .

Descripción: Acerca del empleo We're enhancing the way we live and work by intelligently connecting energy systems, buildings and industries! At Smart infrastructure from Siemens we offer a broad portfolio of grid control and automation; low- and medium-voltage power distribution, switching and control; and building automation, fire safety and security, HVAC control and energy solutions.  This Is Your next Challenge  Act as trusted parter for the sales teams, regarding to financial, assurance, and contracts items involve with sales proposals. Do the business Analysis for Product business, proposals and analyzing the variances/deviations. Act as co leader (in this role you will be work with the Bid Manager) for identify, treat and avoid potential risks and mistake into the proposal process Support Sales team for financial contact management topics both pre – post order booking Support in preparing data for business reviews. What should yo need for this challenge?  We are seeking for a Graduate in Business Administration, Economy, Finance, or similar profession with almost+ 4 years of experience in financial roles English and Spanish intermediate (for work closely with colleagues around the world) Proactive and problem solving capabilities Excellent interpersonal skills, and a teammate.  This role is based in Tenjo, and you’ll get the chance to work with teams impacting entire cities, – and the shape of things to come.  We’ve got quite a lot to offer. How about you?  We’re Siemens. A collection of over 379,000 minds building the future, one day at a time in over 200 countries. We're dedicated to equality, and we encourage applications that reflect the diversity of the communities we work in. All employment decisions at Siemens are based on qualifications, merit and business need. Bring your curiosity and creativity and help us shape tomorrow.  At Siemens Colombia since day 1, you have access to +1000 programs to learn every day. We provide a home work model for integrate the personal and work life, and offer to our people a benefits program according the life moment and style.  Do you have any questions? Feel free to write us via WhatsApp to +573108508349  Organization: Smart Infrastructure  Company: Siemens S.A.S.  Experience Level: Experienced Professional  Full / Part time: Full-time

Descripción: Acerca del empleo Who We Are  Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.  To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures—and business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.  BCG Platinion  As a seamlessly integrated part of the BCG network, we provide consulting services focused on the development and implementation of business-critical IT architecture and digital solutions. We create technology platforms and deliver exceptionally customized solutions of the future for our clients, from data strategies to next-generation customer journey solutions and transformational business models. We solve the most daunting challenges that companies face today and envision for tomorrow. Our style is entrepreneurial – nimble and innovative, with multifaceted, cross-functional teams and completely vendor-independent. Our unique selling proposition is technology expertise and delivery excellence.  Platinion was founded in 2000. Since then, we have grown continuously and successfully. Today we have offices in Europe, North and South America, Asia Pacific and Africa.  Practice Area Profile  Digital BCG  BCG has a long history of driving growth by embracing innovation and new ways of thinking. Through Digital BCG, we bring together a diverse mix of consultants and digital specialists to ensure that we are supporting our clients throughout their digital transformation journeys. We work with our clients to fully understand the impact of digital on their business and set priorities that will transform their vision into value. Whether it be developing new technologies to support their core business, making better use of their data, or pursuing entirely new sources of revenue, our aim is to achieve radical improvements in productivity, flexibility, and speed. We are innovating how our clients are using artificial intelligence, robotic process automation, internet of things, personalization, blockchain technologies, and more to gain competitive advantage.  Digital BCG encompasses a broad set of data, digital, and technology capabilities from BCG consulting teams and practices, along with our business units such as BCG Digital Ventures, BCG Platinion, and BCG GAMMA  What You'll Do  We need you - a talented Software Engineer across several disciplines – to join us in building transformative digital solutions for our clients using the latest emerging technology. You’ll lead the design, development, and implementation of Minimum Viable Products (MVPs) , data pipelines, and full-stack customer journeys.  As a Software Engineer, you will work closely with case team members to assess our clients' digital teams, contribute to technical strategies, architecture & engineering solutions and apply your technical know-how and understanding of business contexts. You will conduct research into emerging technologies, build proof of concepts as well as build digital apps, APIs and data solutions to drive digital transformation projects. As you acquire experience, you will be responsible for owning the delivery of specific software modules and help architect technical solutions.  As part of our BCG Platinion consulting team, you will work on a variety of technology topics, collaborating closely with other Platinion disciplines, particularly with our Design and Architecture teams, applying your engineering consulting skills to strategic technology challenges. You’ll be supported by an extensive training curriculum (the same programme as all BCG consultants), plus technology-specific training and mentoring to build your skills.  What You'll Bring (Experience & Qualifications)  YOU’RE GOOD AT  Iterating: You are excited to prototype at all levels of fidelity—and have the humility to walk away from ideas when they fail. Collaborating: You have the ability and enthusiasm to work with researchers, engineers, business consultants, and other designers who will all challenge and support each other. Working with ambiguity: You know projects and businesses move fast. That means the path forward isn’t always well-defined. You are comfortable and collaborative through our process.  What You’ll Bring (experience & Qualifications)  [2+] years’ experience in software development, ideally in digital delivery or technology consulting. Good experience with software engineering standards & unit testing Development skills in front-end or back-end programming languages (e.g. Java, PHP, Python, Golang, JavaScript, CSS, HTML) Experience working in Agile development environments working in collaboration with design and / or architecture teams Ability to deliver on user stories, fix bugs and reuse code and platforms Solid understanding of how web and mobile applications work including security and best practices Some knowledge of database systems and programming patterns & standards - especially related to web development Demonstrated personal ownership of tasks and tenacious approach to finding and fixing the root cause of issues  Ability to bring unique tech perspectives from outside the consulting industry into BCG's typical engagements, requiring:  v Consulting experience (desirable)  v Strategic mindset (hypothesis driven, 80:20 mindset, iterative approach, activist stance)  v Self-management  Leadership potential to transform the consulting industry in particular around interaction with designers, architects and product owners  v Progressing thought leadership in deep tech  v New (but proven) methodologies or ways of working  Experience working with both technical and non-technical colleagues in a cross-functional, interdisciplinary environment, including strong written and verbal communication skills  University degree with above-average academic performance in a mathematical-scientific field, information technology, or business administration  Passion and interest in researching new technologies and developing prototypes, POCs, and MVPs  Who You’ll Work With  BCG Managing Directors and Partners (MDP’s) PLA Managing Directors (MD’s) BCG Consultants at all levels PLA Consultants at all levels Clients, vendors, partners  YOU’LL BE BASED IN  Bogota, Colombia

Descripción: Acerca del empleo Job Title  Sales Representative  Job Description  Kaplan International is looking for motivated native Spanish speakers to leverage their language skills into a professional career opportunity by joining our dynamic and growing sales team! Your role will be to advise potential customers in the Americas, by phone and email, and help them to choose a Kaplan International Languages program abroad - whether that’s helping them to choose between New York and London or helping them choose between us and one of our competitors.  We will provide you with product and skills training, so you can sell successfully. You will also benefit from working alongside some of the best consultants in the English language sector, who will be there to coach you in your development and celebrate your ongoing success!  Responsibilities Providing advice and support to potential students and their inquiries (No cold calling) making sure their needs are matched by our products Tracking sales and customers through our most advanced CRM system (Salesforce) and other business systems Meeting and exceeding individual and territory targets and Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) Requirements Requires a minimum of 2 years of Sales experience Native Spanish level and fluent in English Bachelor’s degree or equivalent Living Abroad experienced. Passion about traveling, education or language learning Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills To be sales-oriented and target driven. Ability to work under pressure when required Compensation And Benefits Monthly income is uncapped 3-weeks training of induction at our main office and on-going coaching and training to support you in your sales Upon completion of the first 3 months on the role we offer an automatic progression into the Sales Executive level 15 days’ vacation About Us  Kaplan International Languages (www.kaplaninternational.com), a division of Kaplan Inc. (a subsidiary of Graham Holdings Company), is an exciting company in the world of international education. With 44 language schools in the UK, Ireland, USA, Canada, Australia, New Zealand, France, and Germany, we are a leading provider of English language courses and other study abroad programs for students from more than 160 countries around the world.  Location  Bogotá, COL  Employee Type  Employee  Job Functional Area  Sales & Customer Services  Kaplan lnternational is an equal opportunities employer and positively encourages applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, religion or belief, marital status, or pregnancy and maternity. If you require any adjustments or additional support within the recruitment process, please contact us directly.
