Descripción: Acerca del empleo Job Title:  Agents Concentrix - Español  Job Description  The Advisor I, Customer Service position interfaces with customers via inbound calls, outbound calls, or through the Internet depending upon client requirements. This position provides customer service support and resolution of routine problems regarding client's product or services.  Job Type: Full-Time Location:  WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?  A diverse, global organization full of intelligent, friendly people to bounce ideas off, learn from and grow with Endless career opportunities and clear paths for career development A competitive salary Inclusive perks and benefits Opportunity for monthly performance incentives Schedule flexibility (part times)  What You Want Matters To Us  Think about making a check list with all of the things that would make you feel good at work. Does your check list have meeting a diverse group of like-minded new people on it? How about being recognized and rewarded for doing great things? Maybe you pictured a place where you could have all of these things while making a positive difference in people’s day. If so, Concentrix is a great place for you. Every day we spread positivity in others' lives through compassionate customer interactions and genuine problem solving with a human touch. Doing right by people is in our DNA because we believe a desire to be treated with care and respect is a universal part of the human experience. This philosophy drives everything we do and creates the framework for how we treat our customers and our staff.  No matter your background or your years of experience, getting started or establishing your career path might seem challenging, but often the answer is much simpler than you think. We are looking for customer service experts  This role is the perfect opportunity for someone considering a career in customer services in the finance/ banking sector.  WHAT WOULD YOU BRING TO OUR TEAM?  Your passion for doing good for other people will help you bond with your customers and your team. You will actively listen and troubleshoot to provide a great customer experience. Your attention to detail, ability to think outside the box, excellent communication, and passion will help you excel in this role.  TO BECOME A PART OF OUR TEAM:  High school diploma Schedule availability 18 years or older  CALL US HOME:  If you find yourself smiling right now and this feels like the perfect next step in your career, we want to hear from you! Apply today and find out why 290,000+ people around the globe choose to call Concentrix home.  Concentrix is an award-winning global CX solutions company who creates amazing experiences for the world’s best brands and their customers.  We’re an ambitious team of innovators, risk-takers, and game-changers: the kind of folks who thrive on solving complex problems.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran. Descripción (inglés): Job Title:  Agents Concentrix - Español  Job Description  The Advisor I, Customer Service position interfaces with customers via inbound calls, outbound calls, or through the Internet depending upon client requirements. This position provides customer service support and resolution of routine problems regarding client's product or services.  Job Type: Full-Time Location:  WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?  A diverse, global organization full of intelligent, friendly people to bounce ideas off, learn from and grow with Endless career opportunities and clear paths for career development A competitive salary Inclusive perks and benefits Opportunity for monthly performance incentives Schedule flexibility (part times)  What You Want Matters To Us  Think about making a check list with all of the things that would make you feel good at work. Does your check list have meeting a diverse group of like-minded new people on it? How about being recognized and rewarded for doing great things? Maybe you pictured a place where you could have all of these things while making a positive difference in people’s day. If so, Concentrix is a great place for you. Every day we spread positivity in others' lives through compassionate customer interactions and genuine problem solving with a human touch. Doing right by people is in our DNA because we believe a desire to be treated with care and respect is a universal part of the human experience. This philosophy drives everything we do and creates the framework for how we treat our customers and our staff.  No matter your background or your years of experience, getting started or establishing your career path might seem challenging, but often the answer is much simpler than you think. We are looking for customer service experts  This role is the perfect opportunity for someone considering a career in customer services in the finance/ banking sector.  WHAT WOULD YOU BRING TO OUR TEAM?  Your passion for doing good for other people will help you bond with your customers and your team. You will actively listen and troubleshoot to provide a great customer experience. Your attention to detail, ability to think outside the box, excellent communication, and passion will help you excel in this role. Descripción: Acerca del empleo At Kin + Carta, we’ve got opportunities to offer you — for growth, for leadership, for big, world-changing impact and for, dare we say it, fun. We are a global workforce that is committed to building a world that works better for everyone. And that starts with our Kin. That’s why we’re proud of:  The life we create within our virtual walls, every day Being B Corp certified Our honor as a “Best Company to Work For” by Women's Choice Award  The role  Ideal candidates will have strong quantitative backgrounds and analytical discipline. While they will have some demonstrated ability to write code, they will not have learned programming languages for the sake of building their resume, but rather as a means to express their intellectual curiosity and analytical voice. Kin + Carta will provide a platform and training to help them reach their full potential.  Kin + Carta is looking to hire Data Engineers with all levels of experience; junior to senior-level. to join our growing capabilities team. If you are innovative, passionate about data and AI technologies, and look to continually learn and enjoy sharing expertise, read on!  Role responsibilities  Analyze a collection of raw data sets to create meaningful impact to large enterprise clients while maintaining a high degree of scientific rigor and discipline. Engineer data pipelines and products to help stakeholders make and execute data driven decisions. Communicate analytical findings in an intuitive and visually compelling way. Creating highly visual and interactive dashboards via Tableau, PowerBI, or custom web applications Conducting deep dive analysis and designing KPIs to help guide business decisions and measure success Engineering data infrastructure, software libraries, and APIs supporting BI and ML data pipelines Architecting cloud data platform components enabling the above Building and tracking project timelines, dependences, and risks Gathering stakeholder requirements and conducting technical due diligence toward designing pragmatic data-driven business solutions  Minimum Qualifications  We want all new hires to succeed in their roles at Kin + Carta. That's why we've outlined the job requirements below. To be considered for this role, it's important that you meet all Minimum Qualifications. If you do not meet all of the Preferred Qualifications, we still encourage you to apply.  Proven industry experience executing data engineering, analytics and/or data science projects or Bachelors/Masters degree in quantitative studies including Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science or computation-intensive Sciences and Humanities. Proficiency (can execute data ingestion to insight) in programmatic languages such as SQL, Python, R  Preferred Qualifications  Proficiency in visualization/reporting tools such as Tableau and PowerBI or programmatic visualization library such as R ggplot2, Python matplotlib/seaborn/bokeh, Javascript D3. Proficiency scripting in UNIX environment Proficiency in big data environments and tools such as Spark, Hive, Impala, Pig, etc. Proficiency with cloud architecture components (AWS, Azure, Google) Proficiency with data pipeline software such as Airflow, Luigi, or Prefect Ability to turn raw data and ambiguous business questions into distilled findings and recommendations for action Experience with statistical and machine learning libraries along with the ability to apply them appropriately to business problems Proficiency in front and back-end web application development stacks and frameworks (Javascript, HTML, CSS, React/Vue/AngularJS) including API design (REST/GraphQL) and library development Experience leading and managing technical data/analytics/machine learning projects  About Kin + Carta  Kin + Carta is a global digital transformation consultancy committed to working alongside our clients to build a world that works better #ForEveryone. Our 2,000 curious minds make creative connections between people, data and technology to create connected outcomes across the full lifecycle of the product and platform ecosystems.  We’re makers, builders and creators by nature, and we come to work every day to build experiences for some of the world’s most influential companies. We help businesses accelerate their digital roadmap, rapidly innovate, modernize their systems, enable their teams and optimize for continued growth.  We are a technology business with trust and human connection at its heart. As a Certified B Corp, our triple bottom line focus on people, the planet and profit is at the core of everything we do.  We welcome our Kin to show up as their authentic selves every day. Because this is so important to us, Kin + Carta is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. To read further about our commitment to Inclusion, Diversity, Equity and Awareness, check out the IDEA page on our website.  If you need accommodations at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.

Descripción: Acerca del empleo TALENT ACQUISITION ANALYST The Talent Acquisition Analyst will conduct multi-faceted research to uncover and identify the best talent for various job functions across geographies. This person will be self-directed to employ traditional and creative sourcing strategies and play a critical role in ensuring the company’s first stage recruiting efforts are expedited and efficient.  RESPONSIBILITIES ·Manage the full life cycle of recruitment: Sourcing, screening, qualifying candidates, coordinating and managing interviews, maintaining consistent communication with hiring managers & candidates, and developing a strong talent pipeline. · Partner with hiring managers and interview teams to ensure job requirements and expectations are clearly understood and candidates are assessed against appropriate criteria; create job descriptions as necessary for newly created roles. · Source top passive talent through sourcing, cold calling, personal networking, and social media. · Determine applicant qualifications by interviewing applicants, analyzing responses, verifying references, comparing qualifications to job requirements, and working closely with hiring managers to maximize effectiveness of recruiting process. · Arrange management interviews by coordinating schedules, arranging travel, escorting applicant to interviews as necessary, or ensuring local teams are equipped to greet candidates. ·Track maintain and report key metrics. · Maintain all pertinent application and interview data in the Applicant Tracking System (Jobvite). REQUIREMENTS · 1-2 years of recruiting experience, agency or corporate. · Bachelor’s degree in Psychology, Administration, or related discipline. · Fluent English is a must. · Proven track record of successfully recruiting for high volume positions. · Clear understanding of the end-to-end recruitment lifecycle process; proven ability to partner with multiple hiring managers concurrently. · Self-directed; ability to work independently toward recruiting objectives with a sense of urgency. · Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to establish credibility and respect with a broad range of business partners. · Excellent communication and presentation skills. · Highly proficient with MS Office software. · Entrepreneurial minded with an internal drive to continuously hit goals and succeed. · Experience excelling within fast paced, high energy environments

Descripción: Acerca del empleo Avant makes premier financial solutions accessible to everyday consumers by blending cutting-edge technology, creative analytics, and superior customer service. Since 2012, we've connected over 1.5 million customers to over $7.5 billion in loans and 1 million credit cards, and we’ve cultivated a work culture that we’re incredibly proud of. As we’ve evolved, we’ve maintained our ability to be nimble, to help each other work smarter, and to keep learning and trying new things. A high growth financial technology company, Avant has been featured in The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times, TechCrunch, Fortune, and Bloomberg, and we've raised over $600 million of equity capital.  We are looking for a team player who wants to make a positive impact on our ability to deliver on a best in class in technical support. Our ideal candidate must be eager, detail-oriented, a quick-learner and possess a can-do attitude with strong interpersonal and communication skills.  What you do at Avant:  Installation and troubleshooting of hardware & software Day to day help desk support (desk-side & remote a like) Document & Update support policies and procedures Asset tagging and management of inventory software Re-imaging of laptops and desktops hardware Software deployment Hardware deployment Desk-side support when needed Execute projects to improve systems and operations within the department Other IT Support tasks as directed by Manager Must be available to work a flexible schedule, ability to work overtime is a must for this role.  Why you are a fit for Avant:  English reading, writing, and all communication is a required skill for this role 2+ years of hands on technical support experience Basic network knowledge Great communication skills Ability to work without direct supervision Ability to lift and carry up to 50 lbs Ability to handle on-call work on a rotating basis Extensive knowledge of troubleshooting hardware and software Knowledge of Windows, Android and iOS Knowledge of IT inventory management methods and organization Experience with Google Admin & GSuite app administration is a plus Knowledge of Mac OSX Knowledge of JAMF  We kindly request applications be submitted in English if possible  Why Avant is a fit for you:  At Avant, we believe our values make a difference:  Authenticity. We show up to work as our whole selves and make sure others can too.  Collaboration. We can only succeed when we do so as a team.  Problem-Solving. The harder the problem, the more satisfying the solution.  Customer. We are all owners of the customer experience.  Initiative. Plan. Adapt. Get Sh!t Done.  We believe that ideas are more important than titles, everything is more fun together, everyone drives change, and everyone is an owner. While we believe the perks and benefits that we offer are terrific, nothing excites us more than having the ability to collaborate with intelligent, highly-motivated and talented people on challenging problems as we work to change the face of online lending.

Descripción: Acerca del empleo Description We are looking for a Success Factor Admin to be part of our Operations team. Duties and Responsibilities: Provides internal application support & training to SuccessFactors users Prepare releases for rollout Collaborate cross departmentally to gather and document operational and functional requirements and translate into operational solutions Design process and change controls to maintain data integrity Maintain documentation of processes, procedures, and integrations in our company handbook Interfaces with SuccessFactors software support on behalf of Optimizely users Understands how SuccessFactors objects work, and how to make changes to the modules and systems Support the developers and SMEs in testing and deploy customizations, custom objects, third party application integrations, and new SuccessFactors functionality tying technology together with HR and IT processes and operations Provides controls for the protection of personal data in compliance with GDPR and other PII compliance & security best practices and regulations Monitors & administers account management, roles and access, profile creation, security administration, in compliance with legal and operational requirements Manages external and internal resources to fulfill the above responsibilities Ready to apply? First check if you have: 3 to 5 years of experience with SuccessFactors HCM administration, configuration, and development in complex business environments Knowledge of MS environment: integration between SAP SuccessFactors and AD; SAP to MS Teams Writing user stories; gathering requirements Successful project execution Nice to Have: Beginner level REST/SOAP API experience Understanding of CSV file intergrations This person is probably SAP certified Have a SuccessFactors Certification Why working at Cafeto: We value diversity, respect for the individual and integrity Everyone's empowered to work autonomously You will have a direction, an individual career path for you More than work, we are passionate about growing. More than colleagues, we are friends We have some great Perks & Benefits for you! Flexible work hours—structure your work schedule, so it works for you, keeping your team and partner needs in mind. Health insurance. Your mental health is essential to us. You will have access to personalized therapy and counseling for your emotional well-being. Semi-personalized English classes, according to your level. Days off on your birthday and in case of moving. Excellent salary and paid vacations. Interested? We'd love to hear from you — apply below!

Título: Profesional Especialista de Engineering Methods and Systems I
Descripción: Acerca del empleo Job Description  Sobre nosotros  En Technip Energies, creemos en un mañana mejor y creemos que podemos hacer que el mañana sea mejor. Con aproximadamente 15.000 mujeres y hombres talentosos, somos una empresa de ingeniería y tecnología global y líder, con una visión clara para acelerar la transición energética. Diseñar y entregar soluciones energéticas de valor agregado, es lo que hacemos.  Si comparte nuestra determinación de impulsar la transición hacia un futuro bajo en carbono, este podría ser el trabajo para usted. Actualmente estamos buscando un Especialista de Engineering Methods and Systems, que reportará directamente al Jefe de Departamento de EMS, para unirse a nuestro equipo con sede en Bogotá, Colombia.  Acerca del trabajo  El Especialista de Engineering Methods and Systems es responsable de configurar y administrar desde el punto de vista operacional las herramientas de ingeniería en lo relativo a: procedimientos de uso, creación, acceso y estructura del proyecto, configuración de la jerarquía en unidades, áreas, sistemas, configuración y mantenimiento de las bases de datos de referencia, elaboración de reportes, programa del proyecto, mecanismos de control y seguimiento cumpliendo con los requerimientos técnicos, contractuales y corporativos, dentro del programa y marco de calidad establecido.  Le ofrecemos no solo un trabajo, sino también un viaje inspirador en un entorno verdaderamente global donde nos unimos, para romper fronteras gracias a la innovación, la creatividad y el espíritu pionero que impulsa a nuestra gente.  Acerca de ti  Nos encantaría saber de usted si su perfil cumple con los siguientes requisitos esenciales:  Profesional en Ingeniería Mecánica, Sistemas, Electrónica, Eléctrica o Mecatrónica y carreras afines con la función. Conocimiento en bases de datos y SQL, sistemas de información orientados a objetos e informática. Conocimiento en programas de diseño CAD, SP3D y/o AVEVA everithing 3D. Conocimiento avanzado del programa Excel y demás herramientas de Microsoft Office. Conocimiento y aplicación de especificaciones de diseño y estándares de la industria. Nivel intermedio de inglés (hablado y escrito).  Estándares de inclusión  En nuestro viaje continuo para desarrollar y construir una cultura de inclusión, nos adherimos a cuatro estándares de oro de inclusión. ¿Y usted?  Desafiamos nuestros prejuicios y adoptamos la diversidad de pensamiento. Nadie tiene todos los conocimientos y soluciones, colectivamente los tenemos. Fomentamos un ambiente solidario donde las personas son respetadas, cómodas para compartir y ser escuchadas. Promovemos la escucha activa para la toma de decisiones y acciones efectivas.  ¿Qué sigue?  Fecha de inicio: lo antes posible  Una vez que reciba su solicitud de sistema, el equipo de reclutamiento evaluará y comparará sus habilidades, experiencia y equipo potencial con los requisitos del puesto. Le pedimos paciencia mientras el equipo completa el volumen de solicitudes en un plazo razonable. Verifique el progreso de su solicitud periódicamente a través de la cuenta personal del perfil de candidato creado durante su solicitud.  Lo invitamos a conocer más sobre nuestra empresa visitando www.technipenergies.com y síganos en LinkedIn , Instagram , Facebook , Twitter , Youtube para obtener actualizaciones de la empresa .

Fecha de inicio: lo antes posible  Una vez que reciba su solicitud de sistema, el equipo de reclutamiento evaluará y comparará sus habilidades, experiencia y equipo potencial con los requisitos del puesto. Le pedimos paciencia mientras el equipo completa el volumen de solicitudes en un plazo razonable. Verifique el progreso de su solicitud periódicamente a través de la cuenta personal del perfil de candidato creado durante su solicitud.  Lo invitamos a conocer más sobre nuestra empresa visitando www.technipenergies.com y síganos en LinkedIn , Instagram , Facebook , Twitter , Youtube para obtener actualizaciones de la empresa .

Descripción: Acerca del empleo Descripción de la empresa  About NielsenIQ  NielsenIQ is a global measurement and data analytics company that provides the most complete and trusted view available of consumers and markets worldwide. We provide consumer packaged goods manufacturers/fast-moving consumer goods and retailers with accurate, actionable information and insights and a complete picture of the complex and changing marketplace that companies need to innovate and grow. Our approach marries proprietary NielsenIQ data with other data sources to help clients around the world understand what’s happening now, what’s happening next, and how to best act on this knowledge. We like to be in the middle of the action. That’s why you can find us at work in over 90 countries, covering more than 90% of the world’s population. For more information, visit www.niq.com.  NielsenIQ is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class.  Descripción del empleo  Acerca del rol  Buscamos una persona que proporcione soporte técnico amable y respetuoso a los usuarios, que se sienta parte de la compañía, que tenga empatía hacia los problemas y necesidades que los usuarios reporten.  Responsabilidades  Responder los correos y mensajes de teams enviados por los usuarios de la compañía Atención y resolución de los tiquetes asignados por la mesa de ayuda en los tiempos establecidos Preparación, configuración y asignación de equipos a los nuevos ingresos y los empleados a los que les corresponde renovación del equipo asignado Mantener el inventario actualizado de los equipos de cómputo y equipos celulares asignados a los empleados de la compañía y los que se encuentran disponibles para asignar y los que se deben dar de baja Administración, asignación e instalación de extensiones VOIP a los usuarios de la compañía que lo requieran  Acerca de ti  Atención a los detalles y habilidad para poder comunicarse efectivamente.  Requerimientos  Ser técnico, tecnólogo, profesional o estudiante de sistemas, electrónica o carreras a fin Trabajar con anticipación, resolver problemas, administrar su tiempo, priorizar el trabajo, trabajar bajo presión y en equipo. Mantener al día sus conocimientos de hardware y software Personalidad amable, respetuosa, con buena disposición, responsable y puntual Deseable inglés básico Conocimiento en Windows 10 y 11, Office. Deseable, conocimientos generales en redes  Información adicional  What's in it for you?  Comprehensive compensation package Flexible work environment Hybrid work model Career development tailored to NielsenIQ roles Access to on-demand learning content and NIQ social communities Mentor programs and more!!  REF20000E  Our Benefits  Flexible working environment Health insurance Parental leave Life assurance  About NielsenIQ  NielsenIQ is a global measurement and data analytics company providing the most complete and trusted view of consumers and markets in 90 countries covering 90% of the world’s population. Focusing on consumer-packaged goods manufacturers and FMCG and retailers, we enable customers to defy what’s possible. How? We combine unparalleled datasets, pioneering technology, and the industry’s top talent to create insights that unlock innovation. Join us and change the landscape.  Learn more at: www.niq.com  Want to keep up with our latest updates? Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook  Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion  NielsenIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us.  We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide.  Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NielsenIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion/

Descripción: Acerca del empleo Job Title:  Associate, Real Time Management  Job Description  The Associate , Real Time Management is responsible for managing the intraday performance of one program or line of business within a Call Center environment. This position will utilize monitoring systems to ensure appropriate staffing levels and agent availability to meet client expectations and Concentrix scheduling standards.  Essential Functions/Core Responsibilities  Distributes accurate and timely agent schedules Inputs intraday corrections and exceptions into systems for agent time off and absences Monitors inbound volume for unusual activity to ensure staffing needs are met Recognize abnormal scheduling issues and escalate as necessary Initiates and coordinates trouble tickets and escalate issues as required Prepares standard and ad hoc reports for agent availability effectiveness Monitors and resolves agent availability concerns via face-to-face communications, phones, and messaging applications with agent(s) and command center.  Requirements  Associate's degree related in a field with two to four years of relevant experience preferred. Advance in Excel and other Microsoft office. Proficient in resource scheduling/ intraday management applications preferred. Work well under pressure and follow through on items to completion. Strong communications skills. both written and verbal. Ability to lead team in multi-tasking, prioritization, and meeting timelines on deliverable. Detail oriented. Willingness to work a flexible schedule. Proficient in English, B2 English level is a Must.  Internal Applicants also must comply with:  Tenure of minimum 1 year within the company and 6 months in the current position. No Disciplinary actions (DA) issued in the past 3 months. 3 Estart Points or less (or perfect attendance in the past 3 months) Meeting KPIs for the past 3 months  #LATAMCNX  Location:  COL Bogota - Oficinas y terrazas de  Language Requirements:  Time Type:  Full time R1347969

Descripción: Acerca del empleo Job Description Are you a seasoned MySQL/MariaDB Database Administrator? Does working in a multi customer, multi domain environment on global scale motivates you? If yes, this role could be a good fit for you. Datavail is seeking a highly skilled, self-motivated, and passionate MySQL and MariaDB DBA to join our MySQL and MariaDB Global Practice. As a DBA, you will be working on the latest Opensource technologies in the industry. This position is based out of our global delivery centers in Bogota in Columbia. This role requires excellent technical DBA skills, but also requires and develops leadership and managerial skills. Datavail is one of the largest data-focused services company in North America and provides both professional and managed services and expertise in Database Management, Application Development and Management, Cloud & Infrastructure Management, Packaged Applications and BI/Analytics. Education: Bachelor Degreed or equivalent Experience: 5+ Years Key Skills: MySQL, Percona, MariaDB, InnoDB Cluster, XtraDB cluster, Galera cluster, AWS RDS and Aurora, Azure, OCI and GCP Required Skills: 5+ years on MySQL and MariaDB Product Suite. 3+ years of experience working in a global environment Experience in MySQL 5.7/8.X and MariaDB 10.x both on-premises and Cloud Worked in Clustered architecture like InnoDB cluster, Galera Cluster,etc. Experience in MySQL and MariaDB Backup, Restores Experience in Database Monitoring Solutions Experience in Database migrations to the cloud Experienced in HA and Replication solutions with MySQL, MariaDB and Percona. Experienced in RDS and Aurora MySQL support Experience in Performance tuning in opensource databases Database Security best practice implementations Experienced in Installation, Configuration and Administration of MySQL and MariaDB on Linux and Windows Working knowledge of Database solutions like ProxySQL, Orchestrator,Max Scale etc. Experience in data modeling, schema design and optimization 24 X 7 production support experience Knowledge of Linux and Windows Servers Clear Communication Desired Skills: Strong knowledge of DevOps technologies Strong troubleshooting skills with the ability to identify issues before they become problems Experience building and supporting cloud data solutions Possess working knowledge of agile development methodologies including DevOps concepts Proficient in a relevant programming language for cloud platforms (e.g., Python, Shell, Java, etc) Experience with management, upgrades, backup and restore of large MySQL and MariaDB database systems Experience tuning the databases for performance, high availability, and scalability Ability to work with others collectivity, as a Team Scripting in Bash/Perl/JavaScript/Python Certifications in MySQL/MariaDB or in any Cloud Associate level is a plus Role and Responsibilities: Review and propose database technologies, deployment topologies and stabilize Ops. Lead efforts to develop and improve procedures for automated monitoring and proactive intervention, reducing any need downtime. Ensure adherence to process, regulations, security and compliance. Responding to database related alerts and escalations and working with Technical Operations team to come up with solutions to recurring problems Develop Stored Procedures and Database Triggers in support of application development. Participate in application development projects and be responsible for the database architecture and design Participate in the creation of development, staging, and production database instances, and the migration from one environment to another Responsible for developing SQL code review to ensure queries are optimized and tuned to perform efficiently prior to production release. Responsible for regular backups and recovery of databases. Responsible for regular maintenance on databases (e.g., Re-indexing, Archiving). Responsible for pro-active remediation of database operational problems Responsible for Query tuning and preventative maintenance Participate in a 24×7 Operational Support Support complex web-based applications. Responsible for the monitoring and uptime of all production databases. Due to the geographically dispersed nature of the company and IT teams it may require a degree of out of hours working including attending team meetings and interactive with other IT Operations team members

Título: QA (Quality Assurance) Automation Engineer with Cypress - Remote - Colombia
Descripción: Acerca del empleo FullStack Labs is the fastest-growing software consultancy in the Americas. We help organizations like Uber, GoDaddy, MGM, Siemens, Stanford University, and the State of California, build distributed software development teams, and deliver transformational digital solutions. As an employee-first company, we focus on hiring the most talented software designers and developers in the western hemisphere, by creating a positive, respectful, and supportive work environment where they can achieve their greatest potential.  We’re most proud of: Offering life-changing career opportunities to talented software professionals across the Americas. Building highly-skilled software development teams for hundreds of the world’s greatest companies. Having delivered hundreds of successful custom software solutions, which have positively impacted the lives and careers of millions of users. Our 4.7-star rating on GlassDoor. Our client Net Promoter Score of 64, twice the industry average. Sustained growth of 100% - 200% per year.  The Position:  As a QA Automation Engineer at FullStack Labs, your primary responsibilities will be to design automated tests to validate the applications we build for clients. Each day at FSL, you will be collaborating with other members of the engineering team to solve problems with the application. You will develop automated tests and configure testing automation environments. You will ensure proper test coverage and will test features to ensure they are properly built, function as they are designed to function, and correctly solve clients' problems. To do this you will gain a deep understanding of our client's business and the problems that the software is designed to solve. The automated test coverage that you will create will ensure that the products we create maintain their level of excellence and do not regress. You'll work with our incredible clients in one of two ways: Team Augmentation / Staffing: You will integrate yourself directly into our client's team and work alongside their existing designers and engineers on a daily basis. Design & Build: You will work on a FullStack Labs product team to build and deliver a product to our clients.  What We're Looking For: 3+ years of Quality Assurance experience. Advanced English is required. A thorough understanding of the Software Development Life Cycle. Well-versed with STLC and defect life cycle. Ability to work well with team members within an agile development team. Identifies defects and creates informative bug reports and effectively follows up on bug closure. Advises the team on major issues to product quality. Deep understanding of testing philosophies like TDD, BDD, etc. Knowledge of how to create and execute test plans Experience working on more than one time-sensitive project at a time. Proactively tests, provides test coverage, and resolves issues. Works closely with team members to emphasize quality throughout the entire SDLC. You must have an extremely high, forensic attention to detail. A natural orientation to detail is the most important skill set for this position. You naturally notice small imperfections in seemingly high-quality work. You care deeply about building flawless user experiences and have a visceral reaction to low-quality work. You DO sweat the small stuff. You must have strong computer / technical skills...using technology comes naturally to you. Strong work ethic and the ability to focus on multi-task throughout the day. A positive, optimistic, can-do attitude. Excellent oral and written communication and interpersonal skills. Excellent customer service skills, placing customer outcomes as a focal point for all actions and decisions.  Technologies: Experience with some (not all) of these technologies is required: SauceLabs / BrowserStack / Kobiton. Postman. Jira. Slack. GitHub. Toggl. Mac OS. Terminal. XCode/Android Studio. Figma/Invision.  Benefits: Competitive Salary. Paid Time Off (vacation, sick leave, maternity and paternity leave, holidays). 100% remote work. The ability to work with leading startups and Fortune 500 companies. Health policy with Sura 100% for you and up to 4 primary family members. English Classes. Sodexo food card. 2 additional extra-legal bonuses per year worth up to 10% of salary. Virtual company events each month. Ample opportunity for career advancement. Continuing education opportunities.  FullStack Labs is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form, which can be provided upon request during our hiring and interview process.  Learn more about our Applicants Privacy Notice .

Descripción: Acerca del empleo Most companies try to meet expectations, dunnhumby exists to defy them. Using big data, deep expertise and AI-driven platforms to decode the 21st century human experience – then redefine it in meaningful and surprising ways that put customers first. Across digital, mobile and retail. For brands like Tesco, Coca-Cola, Procter & Gamble and PepsiCo.  We’re looking for a talented Risk Third Party Analyst who expect more from their career and undertake third party information security and governance risk reviews of dunnhumby's vendors and identify key risk areas and managing remediation of control gaps. And work closely with business owners and other key internal stakeholders, and assist in enhacing the information security controls in place at third parties for the protection of dunnhumby information assets.  Your main responsibilities Manage and assess a portfolio of third parties in-line with dunnnhumby’s Third Party Assurance framework and dunnhumby information security standards, ensuring each step is completed within SLA Work with third parties to review technical and governance controls and identify weaknesses/non-compliance as control gaps Track and manage gaps and risks both internal and at third parties through to remediation Maintain an up-to-date record of all third parties that access, store, process and provide services to dunnhumby Manage any risk mitigations associated with third parties, both internally and with the third parties themselves. Provide high quality risk reports, with guidance and recommendations, to enable senior business owners to make the most appropriate risk decisions relating to the use of suppliers Provide an assurance and advisory role to dunnhumby internal teams on the implications of IT and data security for dunnhumby Be involved in regular metric reporting to senior management and other key stakeholders Maintain all required skills & complete necessary training and act in line with our values and Code of Business  What we expect from you Experience working with third parties to review technical and governance controls and identify weaknesses/non-compliance as control gaps. CISSP, CISA, CISM , Master’s degree or equivalent in Information Security. Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in any subject, Risk Management qualification. Experience with information security standards and risk frameworks such as ISO27000/ISO31000/PCI-DSS  What you can expect from us We won’t just meet your expectations. We’ll defy them. So you’ll enjoy the comprehensive rewards package you’d expect from a leading technology company. But also, a degree of personal flexibility you might not expect. Plus, thoughtful perks, like flexible working hours and your birthday off. You’ll also benefit from an investment in cutting-edge technology that reflects our global ambition. But with a nimble, small-business feel that gives you the freedom to play, experiment and learn. And we don’t just talk about diversity and inclusion. We live it every day – with thriving networks including dh Gender Equality Network, dh Proud, dh Family, dh One and dh Thrive as the living proof. Everyone’s invited.  Our approach to Flexible Working At dunnhumby, we value and respect difference and are committed to building an inclusive culture by creating an environment where you can balance a successful career with your commitments and interests outside of work. We believe that you will do your best at work if you have a work / life balance. Some roles lend themselves to flexible options more than others, so if this is important to you please raise this with your recruiter, as we are open to discussing agile working opportunities during the hiring process.
Descripción (inglés): Most companies try to meet expectations, dunnhumby exists to defy them. Using big data, deep expertise and AI-driven platforms to decode the 21st century human experience – then redefine it in meaningful and surprising ways that put customers first. Across digital, mobile and retail. For brands like Tesco, Coca-Cola, Procter & Gamble and PepsiCo.  We’re looking for a talented Risk Third Party Analyst who expect more from their career and undertake third party information security and governance risk reviews of dunnhumby's vendors and identify key risk areas and managing remediation of control gaps. And work closely with business owners and other key internal stakeholders, and assist in enhacing the information security controls in place at third parties for the protection of dunnhumby information assets.  Your main responsibilities Manage and assess a portfolio of third parties in-line with dunnnhumby’s Third Party Assurance framework and dunnhumby information security standards, ensuring each step is completed within SLA Work with third parties to review technical and governance controls and identify weaknesses/non-compliance as control gaps Track and manage gaps and risks both internal and at third parties through to remediation Maintain an up-to-date record of all third parties that access, store, process and provide services to dunnhumby Manage any risk mitigations associated with third parties, both internally and with the third parties themselves. Provide high quality risk reports, with guidance and recommendations, to enable senior business owners to make the most appropriate risk decisions relating to the use of suppliers Provide an assurance and advisory role to dunnhumby internal teams on the implications of IT and data security for dunnhumby Be involved in regular metric reporting to senior management and other key stakeholders Maintain all required skills & complete necessary training and act in line with our values and Code of Business  What we expect from you Experience working with third parties to review technical and governance controls and identify weaknesses/non-compliance as control gaps. CISSP, CISA, CISM , Master’s degree or equivalent in Information Security. Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in any subject, Risk Management qualification. Experience with information security standards and risk frameworks such as ISO27000/ISO31000/PCI-DSS  What you can expect from us We won’t just meet your expectations. We’ll defy them. So you’ll enjoy the comprehensive rewards package you’d expect from a leading technology company. But also, a degree of personal flexibility you might not expect. Plus, thoughtful perks, like flexible working hours and your birthday off. You’ll also benefit from an investment in cutting-edge technology that reflects our global ambition. But with a nimble, small-business feel that gives you the freedom to play, experiment and learn. And we don’t just talk about diversity and inclusion. We live it every day – with thriving networks including dh Gender Equality Network, dh Proud, dh Family, dh One and dh Thrive as the living proof. Everyone’s invited.  Our approach to Flexible Working At dunnhumby, we value and respect difference and are committed to building an inclusive culture by creating an environment where you can balance a successful career with your commitments and interests outside of work. We believe that you will do your best at work if you have a work / life balance. Some roles lend themselves to flexible options more than others, so if this is important to you please raise this with your recruiter, as we are open to discussing agile working opportunities during the hiring process.

Descripción: Acerca del empleo  Coupa Software (NASDAQ: COUP), a leader in business spend management (BSM), has been certified as a “Great Place to Work” by the Great Place to Work organization. We deliver “Value as a Service” by helping our customers maximize their spend under management, achieve significant cost savings and drive profitability. Coupa provides a unified, cloud-based spend management platform that connects hundreds of organizations representing the Americas, EMEA, and APAC with millions of suppliers globally. The Coupa platform provides greater visibility into and control over how companies spend money. Customers – small, medium and large – have used the Coupa platform to bring billions of dollars in cumulative spend under management. Learn more at www.coupa.com. Read more on the Coupa Blog or follow @Coupa on Twitter.  Do you want to work for Coupa Software, the world's leading provider of cloud-based spend management solutions? We’re a company that had a successful IPO in October 2016 (NASDAQ: COUP) to fuel our innovation and growth. At Coupa, we’re building a great company that is laser focused on three core values:  1. Ensure Customer Success – Obsessive and unwavering commitment to making customers successful. 2. Focus On Results – Relentless focus on delivering results through innovation and a bias for action. 3. Strive For Excellence – Commitment to a collaborative environment infused with professionalism, integrity, passion, and accountability.  As an Associate Solution Architect within the Supply Chain Support team, you will be primarily responsible for resolving incidents arising from customer's usage of our product offerings - (Includes both desktop and cloud products). This will include assisting delivery teams resolve questions that arising during project delivery. You will provide expertise in troubleshooting and reviewing of issues prior to escalation to software development and cloud operations teams to ensure technical accuracy. You will be expected to process and resolve incidents within agreed service level targets (SLTs) by providing quick and detailed responses.  Responsibilities: Provide customer-focused supply chain design or modeling solutions, in a professional and timely manner, that are in line with company procedures/standards via telephone or emails. Candidate should demonstrate strong knowledge of the different supply chain technologies such as network, inventory, transportation optimization, and simulation Candidate should have experience in data mining/processing, statistical modeling and analysis using database management system, such as SQL server Coach user to design/build model based on trend analysis, supply value chain analysis, and familiarity with operation management/research fields of production planning, forecasting, transportation, inventory management, and strategic sourcing Diagnose user’s supply chain questions thoroughly and present structured and comprehensive mathematical solutions in a timely matter Achieve set targets and goals to maximize the customer experience and service provided by the Company Be able to conduct supply chain risk and sensitivity analysis Candidate should have experience in data analysis, and be able to transform data in ETL tools and present them in dashboard, such as Tableau Be able to understand and troubleshoot mathematical optimization models: supply chain problems that require Linear Programming, Mixed Integer Programming, Branch and Bound methods to solve Assist in coordinating with operations and engineering teams in order to identify errors and anomalies Understand key client performance levers (on-time delivery, cost, feasibility, etc.) and seek solutions to improve these metrics in the most effective and efficient way Review and evaluate product defects and requests in order to resolve the issue or provide direction on the best path to resolution Review and validate issues and enhancements that are reported from users and communicate to product and development team in a clear and easy to follow format To voice and define customer feedback to Applied research and Product teams; Review and assist/approve in product features/designs and bug prioritization Monitoring and supporting the company's production systems and applications Stay on top of company product status and provide just-in-time update internally and externally when appropriate Communicate with internal and customer-facing teams in support of status updates regarding open issues, and implement actions in support of root cause analysis and problem remediation At Coupa, we have a strong and innovative team dedicated to improving the spend management processes of today’s dynamic businesses. It’s our people who make it happen, and we strive to attract and retain the best in every discipline.  We take care of our employees every way we can, with competitive compensation packages, as well as restricted stock units, an Employee Stock Purchase Program (ESPP), comprehensive health benefits for employees and their families, retirement and savings plans with employer match, a flexible work environment, no limit vacations for exempt employees, accrued vacation days for non-exempt employees, catered in-office lunches… And much more!  As part of our dedication to the diversity of our workforce, Coupa is committed to Equal Employment Opportunity without regard for race, ethnicity, gender, protected veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or religion.  Please be advised, inquiries or resumes from recruiters will not be accepted.

Descripción: Acerca del empleo Avant (entonces conocido como AvantCredit®) se fundó en 2012 con el objetivo de mejorar la experiencia de préstamos financieros para los consumidores de ingresos medios, y rápidamente se ha ganado una gran reputación como plataforma efectiva de préstamos en línea, reputación que continúa hasta el día de hoy.  A lo largo de los años, Avant ha continuado optimizando el proceso de préstamo en línea. Con el respaldo de algunos de los inversores más respetados en el espacio fintech, ha ayudado a más de 2 millones de personas a obtener el financiamiento que se merecen. Avant sigue comprometida con su visión fundacional, trabajando todos los días para crear nuevas soluciones que ayuden a impulsar la vida financiera de sus clientes.  A medida que continuamos creando herramientas e integraciones más sólidas dentro de nuestras aplicaciones financieras, nuestros equipos de ingeniería están contratando profesionales talentosos para que nos ayuden a crear soluciones innovadoras para nuestra plataforma. ¡Avant está buscando contratar a un Ingeniero de Software Fullstack para apoyar estas iniciativas!  Esta posición es elegible para realizarse de manera remota por los actuales residentes de Colombia que califican para el empleo. Los empleados que residen en Colombia serán empleados oficialmente con Remote.com (para fines de nómina, impuestos y beneficios), pero se reportarán y producirán trabajo en nombre de Avant, LLC.  ***Los candidatos deben dominar el idioma inglés. Según el MCER, buscamos un nivel B2 o superior.***  ¿Que harás en Avant?  Trabaje con otros ingenieros y gerentes técnicos de productos para escribir, probar e implementar su código de manera segura en producción. Contribuya a los proyectos de principio a fin: estamos trabajando en una gran integración de nuestro producto de préstamos/créditos en nuestra aplicación bancaria. ¡El objetivo es crear una plataforma multiproducto con una experiencia de cliente unificada! Trabajamos principalmente en Python, pero muchos empleados provienen de una variedad de entornos diferentes. Diseñamos, implementamos y administramos nuestra propia infraestructura Creamos marcos y herramientas de big data y aprendizaje automático Sea parte de una sólida cultura de propiedad, pragmatismo y evaluación Desarrollar y mantener herramientas centradas en el desarrollador que empoderen a la organización a través de una mayor facilidad y eficiencia. Asuma un rol de arquitectura de plataforma en las sesiones de recopilación, alcance y diseño de requisitos Tenemos una cultura que trata a los ingenieros como profesores y estudiantes, y fomentamos esto presentando almuerzos y aprendizajes semanales, organizando hackatones y asistiendo a conferencias. Somos el núcleo de los solucionadores de problemas técnicos y la fuerza de reserva para todas las tareas y problemas técnicos en Avant.  ¿Como calificas para Avant?  5 años o más de experiencia previa en codificación en Python y/o Ruby es una gran ventaja en este puesto Estás familiarizado con las tecnologías en la nube, generalmente usamos AWS junto con algunos GCP Tienes una comprensión fundamental del diseño, desarrollo y mantenimiento de servicios de alta disponibilidad. Eres un programador generalista pragmático que no solo ayudará a ejecutar, sino que también brindará una voz fuerte para la dirección tecnológica de los sistemas en Avant. Disfrutas la refactorización y el diseño del sistema a medida que migramos a una arquitectura basada en servicios y nos preparamos para escalar y aumentar el flujo de datos. Eres emprendedor, autónomo y te enorgulleces de mejorar las experiencias de nuestros clientes. Posees un conocimiento base de los fundamentos de la informática y las mejores prácticas de codificación/prueba Prosperas en un entorno de colaboración que involucra a diferentes equipos y expertos en la materia al mismo tiempo que disfrutas trabajar con un grupo diverso de personas con diferentes niveles de coniocimiento conocimiento. Te gusta comunicarte directamente con las unidades de negocios de toda la empresa para asegurarte que entiendes y puedes manejar mejor los puntos débiles y la amplia gama de necesidades de las partes interesadas.  ¡Echa un vistazo a nuestro Blog Avant!  Creemos que un conjunto diverso de antecedentes y experiencias nos ayuda a crear las soluciones más innovadoras para nuestros clientes. Te invitamos a postularte a nuestras posiciones abiertas incluso si no cumples con el 100% de los requisitos enumerados en la descripción. Si te apasiona nuestra misión y estás alineado con nuestros valores, esperamos que vengas a contribuir a nuestra increíble cultura.  ¿Por qué Avant es el lugar para ti? En Avant, creemos que nuestros valores marcan la diferencia: Autenticidad. Nos presentamos a trabajar como nosotros mismos y nos aseguramos de que otros también puedan hacerlo. Colaboración. Solo podemos tener éxito cuando lo hacemos como un equipo. Solucion de problemas. Cuanto más difícil es el problema, más satisfactoria es la solución. Cliente. Todos somos dueños de la experiencia del cliente. Iniciativa. Planeacion. Adaptacion. ¡Sacar el trabajo!

Descripción: Acerca del empleo Descripción De La Empresa  At Infobip we dream big. We value creativity, persistence and innovation, passionately believing that it is through teamwork that we can all reach greater heights. Since 2006, we have been innovating at the edge of technological possibilities and are now shaping global communications of the future. Through 60+ offices on six continents, Infobip’s platform is used by almost 70% of the population, making it the largest network of its kind and the only full-stack cloud communication platform (cPaaS) globally. Join us on our mission to create life-changing interactions between humans and online services with new and unseen solutions.  Descripción Del Empleo  We are in the process of developing a new finance operating model which includes consolidation and standardization of our accounting operations from all countries in the region into Bogota. We are looking for someone who wants to start by doing operative tasks with the purpose to support the finance team, someone who has accountable knowledge.  Also, the role requires some soft skills like negotiation, outstanding communication, proactivity and an attitude for continuous improvement; always asking for help and assistance, requiring feedback and developing a notable character.  In other words, It is a very dynamic role that requires open-mindedness and passion for process development.  Requisitos  You have 1+ years of experience in general accounting, more in registering mostly processes, from invoices, bills, payments, among other related You have experience in general accounting, taxes, reconciliations, consolidation, fixed assets, period-end closing, reporting, etc. Degree in Accounting, economics and or other management related. Proficiency in MS Office, especially in Excel Experience in centralized accounting departments is desirable Advanced English level. Able to work effectively within a fast-paced, deadline driven environment  Información Adicional  Why our employees choose us (and stay)? :  Awesome clients – We serve and partner with the majority of the leading mobile operators, OTTs, brands, banks, social networks, aggregators and many more. You can look forward to working with the likes of Viber, Zendesk, O2 and… Seriously, our clients are really cool. Work with the world’s leading companies and impact how they communicate with their users! Learn as you grow – Starting from the Infobip Pangea Campus and 2 months onboarding program in the HQ of our company, to internal education, education resources, e-learning to external educations, we invest heavily in employee learning and development. Never a dull moment – We work with powerful companies with great impact, which pushes us to work on the highest possible level. Work on uncharted challenges and push boundaries on a daily basis. Amazing Perks – Competitive salary, health benefits, covered travel expenses, wellness spending accounts, employer paid benefits, above average vacation time, flexible work environment… Talk about a balanced lifestyle! Never a dull moment – We work with powerful companies with great impact, which pushes us to work on the highest possible level. Work on uncharted challenges and push boundaries on a daily basis. Amazing Perks – Competitive salary, health benefits, covered travel expenses, wellness spending accounts, employer paid benefits, above average vacation time, flexible work environment… Talk about a balanced lifestyle!  We are in the process of developing a new finance operating model which includes consolidation and standardization of our accounting operations from all countries in the region into Bogota. We are looking for someone who wants to start by doing operative tasks with the purpose to support the finance team, someone who has accountable knowledge.  Also, the role requires some soft skills like negotiation, outstanding communication, proactivity and an attitude for continuous improvement; always asking for help and assistance, requiring feedback and developing a notable character.  In other words, It is a very dynamic role that requires open-mindedness and passion for process development.  Descripción de la empresa  At Infobip we dream big. We value creativity, persistence and innovation, passionately believing that it is through teamwork that we can all reach greater heights. Since 2006, we have been innovating at the edge of technological possibilities and are now shaping global communications of the future. Through 60+ offices on six continents, Infobip’s platform is used by almost 70% of the population, making it the largest network of its kind and the only full-stack cloud communication platform (cPaaS) globally. Join us on our mission to create life-changing interactions between humans and online services with new and unseen solutions.  Descripción del empleo  We are in the process of developing a new finance operating model which includes consolidation and standardization of our accounting operations from all countries in the region into Bogota. We are looking for someone who wants to start by doing operative tasks with the purpose to support the finance team, someone who has accountable knowledge.  Also, the role requires some soft skills like negotiation, outstanding communication, proactivity and an attitude for continuous improvement; always asking for help and assistance, requiring feedback and developing a notable character.  In other words, It is a very dynamic role that requires open-mindedness and passion for process development.  Requisitos  You have 1+ years of experience in general accounting, more in registering mostly processes, from invoices, bills, payments, among other related You have experience in general accounting, taxes, reconciliations, consolidation, fixed assets, period-end closing, reporting, etc. Degree in Accounting, economics and other management related. Proficiency in MS Office, especially in Excel Experience in centralized accounting departments is desirable Advanced English level. Able to work effectively within a fast-paced, deadline driven environment  Información adicional  Why our employees choose us (and stay)?  Awesome clients – We serve and partner with the majority of the leading mobile operators, OTTs, brands, banks, social networks, aggregators and many more. You can look forward to working with the likes of Viber, Zendesk, O2 and… Seriously, our clients are really cool. Work with the world’s leading companies and impact how they communicate with their users! Learn as you grow – Starting from the Infobip Pangea Campus and 2 months onboarding program in the HQ of our company, to internal education, education resources, e-learning to external educations, we invest heavily in employee learning and development. Never a dull moment – We work with powerful companies with great impact, which pushes us to work on the highest possible level. Work on uncharted challenges and push boundaries on a daily basis. Amazing Perks – Competitive salary, health benefits, covered travel expenses, wellness spending accounts, employer paid benefits, above average vacation time, flexible work environment… Talk about a balanced lifestyle!

Descripción: Acerca del empleo Creatio is one of the fastest growing enterprise SaaS companies offering a leading low-code platform for process management and CRM. The company has been highly recognized by key industry analysts being included into seven Forrester Waves and five Gartner Magic Quadrants, and recognized as a Leader in two of them. Creatio’s intelligent products accelerate sales, marketing, service and operations for mid-size and large enterprises. With a global team of 600+ dedicated professionals and hundreds of partners Creatio operates in 110 countries worldwide.  The Opportunity:  We are aggressively growing our LATAM sales team and currently look for the Pre-Sales Solutions Engineer who will support the development of the LATAM region providing technical expertise and experience to the team, customers and partners. He / she will also provide Enterprise level Pre-Sales support and deal management to the region’s key opportunities of strategic and significant commercial value and execute the Regional growth strategy aiding the team to achieve the defined targets and team KPIs.  The role can be based in any location in LATAM and will report to the Head of Pre-Sales Americas based in the US.  Customer Oriented Responsibilities Conduct key customer meetings with Sales Executives to provide technical expertise and support in current state and vision of product development (roadmap). Create vision and strategies for CRM and BPM opportunities and design/configure custom demos, presentations, training, and other supportive materials. Deliver product demonstrations to key accounts configured to match customer expectations and needs.  Partner Oriented Responsibilities Deliver company vision to key prospect partners supporting delivery and understanding of our product roadmap. Help partners defining best approaches in sales strategies based on product specifics and capabilities  Company and Team Oriented Responsibilities Conduct competitor analysis and feedback to R&D and Product teams on product development and Sales Enablement on competitors’ strategic position Participate in defining deal win strategies Participate in defining strategies for region development  Role measurements of success: Overall regional performance to plan Growth in existing customer revenue Growth in net new accounts Win rate in Enterprise partner deals  We offer: Powerful enterprise-grade product Limitless opportunities for career development Team of motivated and accountable people working with you Culture focused on agility and innovation Flat organization structure and easy access to C and VP level executives  If you are interested, please submit your CV at a.rudyk@creatio.com or apply online  Info about the company: https://www.creatio.com/

Descripción: Acerca del empleo Description  We are a technology company working to transform credit and banking in Latin America starting with point of sale finance. We aim to build fair, simple and affordable financial services that empower our clients, treating them with dignity, and building financial freedom. We launched in February 2019 and have already served thousands of clients and disbursed millions of dollars.  We operate as a full stack startup. We have built our core systems and processes from scratch, and we believe our technology and analytics platform will drive our progress into the years to come. We come at this with deep experience building and growing technology teams and financial products. As important as what we do is how we do it. We are a conscious company, and are deeply committed to working and living our five core values - A company of owners inspiring colleagues, we pull rabbits out of hats, we care and we trust, act with integrity, win today every day, and scale exponentially  We are backed by Andreessen Horowitz, Monashees, Village Global, and an outstanding team of individual angels, including Kevin Ryan, Josh Abramowitz, and Scott Weiss.  What you will do Take e2e ownership and operate the software that you design, develop, test and release into production. Work closely with designers, engineers, and product owners to build great products and experiences for our clients and allies. Architect and develop world-class user interfaces which combines usability, maintainability, and performance. Develop software on a daily basis using our frontend technical stack based on Typescript, Storybook, React, and React Native. Review pull requests on a daily basis transferring your knowledge with your team. Receive mentorship from everyone on the team, from more experienced members to people who are just starting. Deploy new features to production on a daily basis using our CI/CD pipeline. Be on-call occasionally. We rotate to distribute our knowledge and experience. Contribute to our Architecture Decision Records where you will be able to propose new techniques, patterns, and tools for our evolving platform. Requirements You have 3+ years of full-time technical work experience as a software engineer. We will adjust the seniority of the role accordingly. Great communication abilities with technical and non-technical stakeholders. Willingness to work with a distributed team. Good foundations in UX/UI design. Strong expertise building user interfaces using well-structured HTML and CSS code. Experience with modern JavaScript libraries and tools. Awareness of web performance optimization techniques. Benefits Work on a problem that matters and help change customers’ lives. Build a lasting company from the very beginning, helping define every aspect of it. Massive market opportunity ahead of us; we are growing faster than pretty much any other fintech lender was at our stage. Work alongside a great and diverse team that cares about what we are doing and how we are doing it. Generous compensation, including equity, 100% health insurance (and 50% for dependents), flexible time-off, learning budget, fitness allowance and visa sponsorship for foreigners. How The Hiring Process Looks Like Meet with our recruiter for a 30-minute video chat. We will get to know you better, understand what you’re looking for, and answer any questions you might have about ADDI. Meet with one Frontend software engineer for a 45-minute video chat interview. Here, we will ask you questions about your technical background and basic computer science concepts. You will be able to ask any questions about the culture and how we work at ADDI. Complete a simple take-home challenge within a 1-week window. With this technical challenge, we want to see your technical expertise solving a real-world problem. We expect that you invest 5 hours or less in developing a working solution. Meet with a Frontend software engineer and the engineering manager for a 45-minute chat to talk about your take-home exercise submission and any questions you might have. Meet onsite with one of our founders for a 30-minute chat to talk about the vision of the company, what we are building and how you will contribute to our product.

Título: Talento Unilever: Digital Marketing, Media & DCommerce
Descripción: Acerca del empleo Digital Marketing & Media Planning  ¿Qué tal construir un mundo mejor mientras haces parte de una de las compañías de consumo masivo más grandes del mundo, donde puedes transformar tus ideas en realidades, siendo tu mismo? Te invitamos a ser parte de nuestro equipo y #VeaUnilever.  Pero primero, un mensaje importante.  La diversidad es uno de nuestros pilares más relevantes y nuestro principal objetivo es desarrollar un entorno interno abierto a la multiplicidad de pensamientos, a través de la inclusión sin estereotipos. Esto nos permite valorar a los mejores profesionales, juntando diversos perfiles y estilos, y afrontando mejor los retos actuales y futuros de la compaña.  En Unilever, más del 50% de los puestos de liderazgo están ocupados por mujeres. Y queremos más diversidad en nuestra compañía. De esta manera, consideramos a todos los candidatos / candidatos para nuestras vacantes, independientemente de su discapacidad, raza, color, religión, género e identidad de género, nacionalidad, orientación sexual, ascendencia, edad o cualquier otra diversidad.  ¿Es esta una vacante para mí?  En esta vacante, como parte del área de marketing digital y planificación de medios, trabajarás en estrecha colaboración con la empresa para comprender las necesidades locales e impulsar las campañas de marca. Serás el campeón de la estrategia digital y de medios.  ¿Cómo vas a construir un mundo mejor?  Serás Responsable De Dirigir y entregar los mejores planes de medios holísticos de su clase (funnel completo fuera de línea y en línea) que aprovechen al máximo los datos y las perspectivas para orientar los medios de manera efectiva y satisfacer las necesidades de comunicación de marketing. Colaborar con el equipo de Data, Audience & Digital commerce, para proponer y acordar con las partes interesadas los planes clave relevantes para campañas de marketing de precisión y rendimiento. Serás responsable de impulsar la ejecución de medios digitales y fuera de línea con el equipo interno de marketing basado en datos, el equipo de comercio digital y la agencia de medios. Liderar los mejores planes de medios digitales de su clase con socios de medios como Google, Meta, Twitter... Aplicar el rigor para brindar eficiencia en los medios y ayudar a los equipos de marketing a alcanzar los objetivos comerciales. Comprometerse directamente con socios de medios externos para desbloquear la innovación pionera. Medirás y rastrearás la efectividad de los medios. ¿Qué no te puede faltar para venir a este equipo?  Los Requisitos Son Más de 3 años de experiencia en el trabajo en Digital Media. Capacidad para asesorar sobre todos los medios y el marketing basado en datos para las partes interesadas internas a través de la profundidad de los medios pagados y el conocimiento digital, brindando experiencia en canales y oportunidades tradicionales y digitales, estrategias basadas en datos, incluido el comercio electrónico, y explicando información compleja en un fácilmente digerible camino. Planificación de medios offline y online Habilidades de colaboración que fomentan el desarrollo de proyectos de múltiples partes interesadas Un espíritu pionero para impulsar e incorporar la innovación en nuestros planes de medios. Mentalidad de resolución de problemas, capaz de trabajar con agilidad y adaptarse a las condiciones cambiantes de los medios y el mercado. Sólidas habilidades analíticas para definir, interpretar y responder a las perspectivas de datos. Comprensión de vanguardia de los medios y el panorama de la comunicación de marca. Conocimiento de las agencias de medios wow, capacidad para gestionar la relación con agencias externas ¿Qué puedes esperar a cambio?  Nuestros Beneficios Son Contrato Indefinido. Trabajar en una compañía con un propósito poderoso que es hacer de la sostenibilidad algo cotidiano Descuentos en productos Unilever. Beneficios extralegales y salario competitivo. Trabajarás en una de las multinacionales más grandes del mundo con presencia en más de 190 países y con más de 300 marcas. ¿Por qué ser #Unilever?  Ser parte de Unilever es unirte a transformar la vida de millones de personas, a través de nuestras marcas, donde tu manera única de ver el mundo será el punto de partida para cambiarlo. Estamos convencidos que disfrutar es la manera de hacer las cosas, y eso sólo es posible siendo tú mismo.  Ser parte de Unilever es trabajar con la libertad para transformar ideas en realidades y con tu propio estilo construir un futuro mejor.  Somos una compañía global de consumo masivo que ha estado construyendo un mundo mejor en Colombia. Nuestro propósito es hacer de la sostenibilidad un lugar común para todas las personas a través de nuestras marcas, que están en el hogar del 100% de los Colombianos (Fruco, Maizena, Knorr, Sedal, Savital, Dove, Ponds, Fab, 3D..).  #VenaUnilever  Unilever is an organisation committed to equity, inclusion and diversity to drive our business results and create a better future, every day, for our diverse employees, global consumers, partners, and communities. We believe a diverse workforce allows us to match our growth ambitions and drive inclusion across the business. At Unilever we are interested in every individual bringing their ‘Whole Self’ to work and this includes you! Thus if you require any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of your application so that we can support you through your recruitment journey.
