Descripción: Acerca del empleo En NEORIS, acelerador digital que ayuda a las compañías a entrar en el futuro, estamos en búsqueda de Desarrollador Power Automate RPA ,  Presentación  En NEORIS continuamos creciendo y queremos que participes sumando más personas a nuestros equipos. Invítalos a ser parte de nuevos y desafiantes proyectos que abarcan múltiples geografías favoreciendo su desarrollo profesional.  Requerimientos:  Profesional en Ingenieria de Sistemas o Carreras A fines  Experiencia indispensable en: Desarrollo para automatización robótica de procesos de negocio con tecnología (RPA) Power Automate, conocimiento en desarrollo de Web Service, Store Procedure, Scripts. Experiencia en Bases de datos.  Conocimientos deseables:  Conocimiento y experiencia en desarrollo de software (Java, .Net, C#, Visual Basic, VB.net, y/o Windows Scripting), preferiblemente en proyectos de automatización y/o integración. Habilidades de orientación al logro, trabajo en equipo, solución de problemas y relacionamiento con otras áreas. Habilidades de liderazgo. Habilidades en la generación de flujos funcionales y técnicos aplicados a la herramienta de automatización Certificación Power Automate, Power Platform.  Tiempo de experiencia: mayor a 2 años en desarrollo de automatización.  Ultimo grado requerido: Pregrado en carreras afines  Ofrecemos:  NEORIS es un Acelerador Digital y Socio Tecnológico de algunas de las compañías más grandes del mundo. Hemos trabajado en Consultoría Tecnológica por más de 20 años en todos los continentes. Hemos completado más de 1200 proyectos de gran escala y nos enorgullecemos de trabajar para más de 350 clientes en todo el mundo. Proveemos un servicio de alta calidad con nuestras 27 oficinas, Delivery Centers y Laboratorios de Innovación, donde trabajan algunas de las mejores mentes de la industria para generar el futuro de los negocios.  Ofrecemos:  Crecimiento Profesional Ambiente laboral dinámimico Atractivo plan de beneficios Prestaciones de ley Oportunidades de desarrollo  Te invitamos a conocernos en http://www.neoris.com , Facebook, LinkedIn, Twitter o Instagram: @NEORIS.  FREDY ALEXANDER ARIAS VIVAS
Descripción (inglés): [{'translation_text': 'In NEORIS, digital accelerator that helps companies to enter into the future, we are looking for Developer Power Automate RPA , Presentation In NEORIS we continue to grow and we want you to participate by adding more people to our teams. Invite them to be part of new and challenging projects that span multiple geographies favoring their professional development. Requirements: Professional in Systems Engineering or Careers For purposes Indispensable experience in: Development for robotic automation of business processes with technology (RPA) Power Automate, knowledge in development of Web Service, Store Processure, Scripts. Experience in Databases. Desirable knowledge: Knowledge and experience in software development (Java, .Net, C#, Visual Basic, VB.net, and/or Windows Scripting), preferably in automation projects and/or integration. More than 2 years in automation and related relationship with other areas. Skills in the generation of functional and technical flows applied to the automation tool Power Automate, Power Platform.'}]
País: Providencia, Archipiélago de San Andrés, Providencia y Santa Catalina, Colombia

Descripción: Acerca del empleo Site Name: Bogota Samsung Tower  Posted Date: Nov 9 2022  Hola. Somos Haleon. Una nueva empresa líder mundial en salud del consumidor. Moldeado por todos los que se unen a nosotros. Juntos, estamos mejorando la salud cotidiana de miles de millones de personas. Al crecer e innovar nuestra cartera global de marcas de categoría líderes, incluidas Sensodyne, Panadol, Advil, Voltaren, Theraflu, Otrivin y Centrum, a través de una combinación única de profundo conocimiento humano y ciencia confiable. Además, estamos teniendo éxito en una empresa de la que tenemos el control. En un entorno en el que estamos co-creando. Y una cultura que es única.  El propósito de este rol es apoyar en el control y seguimiento de venta, inversiones y gastos que soportan el negocio de la multinacional Haleon. Considerando que estamos en una nueva etapa, resultado de la fusión de 2 grandes farmacéuticas líderes a nivel mundial, estamos construyendo una nueva cultura, nuevos procesos y la mejor y más grande compañía de productos de consumo masivo en Colombia. Teniendo en cuenta que el área de Finanzas es una de las bases fundamentales para el desarrollo y sostenibilidad de los objetivos a corto, mediano y largo plazo, este rol contribuye a que desarrolles un pensamiento analítico para una mejor toma de decisiones. Así mismo, esta posición te permite conocer cómo funciona la empresa a nivel general.  Tus responsabilidades:  Esta posición te da la oportunidad de liderar actividades claves para progresar TU carrera. Las principales son:  Apoyar en el mantenimiento y alimentación de información financiera en SAP (Sistema más utilizado a nivel mundial).  Dar seguimiento a la implementación y desarrollo de las herramientas de análisis, contando con tu creatividad e innovación.  Consolidar los archivos y apoyar en presentaciones en Power Point.  Elaborar y mantener los reportes de: Ventas, Advertising & Promotion, Costos y P&G en general.  Dar seguimiento y control de provisiones de Opex (Administración, Ventas, Legal, Marketing, Recursos Humanos, Comex) y Advertising & Promotion.  Participación en diferentes foros con el fin de crear interacción con las demás áreas.  Colaboración remota con los distintos Hub´s de servicios que apoyan al negocio.  Nuestra área de Finanzas se dedica a proveer información financiera a los diferentes usuarios de la compañía; así como de la elaboración y control presupuestal, ejerciendo un papel vital en el proceso de toma de decisiones de la unidad de negocio de consumo. A pesar de contar con nuevas y mejores oficinas, continuamos trabajando de forma remota manteniendo la misma calidad de servicio.  ¿Por que TU?  Tus calificaciones:  Para alcanzar nuestras metas estamos buscando estudiantes de carreras profesionales con las siguientes características:  Estudiantes de últimos semestres de Administración de Empresas, Negocios Internacionales , Contaduría, Economía, Ingeniería Industrial o afines.  Conocimientos avanzados en manejo de Office (Excel, Word, Power Point).  Buen manejo del idioma inglés  Actitud y disposición para aprender!

Descripción: Acerca del empleo  Coupa Software (NASDAQ: COUP), a leader in business spend management (BSM), has been certified as a “Great Place to Work” by the Great Place to Work organization. We deliver “Value as a Service” by helping our customers maximize their spend under management, achieve significant cost savings and drive profitability. Coupa provides a unified, cloud-based spend management platform that connects hundreds of organizations representing the Americas, EMEA, and APAC with millions of suppliers globally. The Coupa platform provides greater visibility into and control over how companies spend money. Customers – small, medium and large – have used the Coupa platform to bring billions of dollars in cumulative spend under management. Learn more at www.coupa.com. Read more on the Coupa Blog or follow @Coupa on Twitter.  Do you want to work for Coupa Software, the world's leading provider of cloud-based spend management solutions? We’re a company that had a successful IPO in October 2016 (NASDAQ: COUP) to fuel our innovation and growth. At Coupa, we’re building a great company that is laser focused on three core values:  1. Ensure Customer Success – Obsessive and unwavering commitment to making customers successful. 2. Focus On Results – Relentless focus on delivering results through innovation and a bias for action. 3. Strive For Excellence – Commitment to a collaborative environment infused with professionalism, integrity, passion, and accountability.  As a Business Operations Analyst you will be working with a global team to update, review, analyze and correct all closed / won Salesforce opportunities on a daily basis. The order management team will take ownership of all opportunities post the order form being signed to ensure all relevant fields are updated on the Salesforce record within 24 hours and in accordance with a defined runbook. The position will also be supporting the overall provisioning process, ensuing the delivery of subscription products to the customer in accordance with our documented process. This includes ensuring accurate entitlements analysis and coordination with the revenue and FP&A teams to ensure accurate revenue recognition and financial planning. The ideal candidate is someone who has a passion for ensuring an accurate and aligned process, will be able to support the CVM and Sale teams with contract and entitlement questions, and effectively maintain the accuracy of our global customer entitlement records. Responsibilities: Support and analyze acquisition / integrations for provisioning, CPQ / entitlement tracking, and overall order management process Support order management team with Salesforce operations including but not limited to opportunity auditing, contract documentation, and CPQ data management Ensure proper revenue documentation is obtained and attached for all closed / won Salesforce opportunities in a timely manner Support customer provisioning process to ensure correct products are delivered to the customer in a timely manner Partner with internal stakeholders and business application team on future improvements for back-office operations and reporting processes Support “ad-hoc” operations related projects and analysis as deemed necessary by supporting manager / operations team Maintain contract and subscriptions records for all active customer accounts ensuring accuracy and completeness Requirements: Hard Skills: Great communication skills, ability to work with employees based in the US Salesforce - Proficient user Microsoft Excel – Expert user Google Mail – Proficient user Google Drive - Proficient user English Language - Fluent (Portuguese is a huge plus) Soft Skills: Methodical – orderly or systematic in thought and behavior Investigative – ability to quickly and accurately research unknown accounts, using context clues and information available online to identify accurate account details Analytical – ability to analyze significant amounts of information with attention to detail and a high level of accuracy Perpetual – capability to work on a repetitive task for a long period of time without compromising quality of work Preferred Skills: Ability to work cross functionally to achieve a desired result or project goal Experience managing multiple projects simultaneously without compromising the quality of the deliverable Background supporting finance projects and the ability to be detail oriented on a repetitive basis Understanding of process maps and ability create process documentation to ensure cross functional training Experience using Jira and Confluence for both support management and documentation At Coupa, we have a strong and innovative team dedicated to improving the spend management processes of today’s dynamic businesses. It’s our people who make it happen, and we strive to attract and retain the best in every discipline.  We take care of our employees every way we can, with competitive compensation packages, as well as restricted stock units, an Employee Stock Purchase Program (ESPP), comprehensive health benefits for employees and their families, retirement and savings plans with employer match, a flexible work environment, no limit vacations for exempt employees, accrued vacation days for non-exempt employees, catered in-office lunches… And much more!  As part of our dedication to the diversity of our workforce, Coupa is committed to Equal Employment Opportunity without regard for race, ethnicity, gender, protected veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or religion.  Please be advised, inquiries or resumes from recruiters will not be accepted.

Coupa provides a unified, cloud-based spend management platform that connects hundreds of organizations representing the Americas, EMEA, and APAC with millions of suppliers globally. Descripción: Acerca del empleo Qualifications Undergraduate degree or master’s degree or 1+ years of work experience after completing your undergraduate degree; Requirements may vary by country or practice Ability to work collaboratively in a team and create an inclusive environment with people at all levels of an organization Capability to drive an independent workstream in the context of a broader team project Comfort with ambiguous, ever-changing situations Ability to break down and solve problems through quantitative thinking and analysis Ability to communicate effectively, both verbally and in writing, in English and local office language(s)  What You'll Do  You'll work in teams of typically 3 - 5 consultants to identify, and oftentimes implement, potential solutions for a specific client problem or challenge. Together, you will help clients make lasting improvements to their performance and realize their most important goals.  Over the course of each project, you will gather and analyze information, formulate, and test hypotheses, and develop and communicate recommendations. You'll also present results to client management and implement recommendations in collaboration with client team members. In some cases, you will be asked to travel to your client site.  When you join McKinsey, you are joining a firm whose culture is distinctive and inclusive. We will accelerate your development as a leader to create positive, enduring change in the world. As a business analyst, you will receive training and coaching on how to better Structure ambiguous problems and take action to solve them Synthesize clear takeaways from complex information into clear takeaways and recommendations using both qualitative and quantitative methods Work effectively with diverse teams to come up with the best solution and move people and organizations to act Establish trust-based relationships with clients to better serve their organizations Communicate effectively with all audiences, including senior leaders, in a structured manner Develop your leadership style, leveraging your own passions, strengths, and personal values McKinsey believes in strengths-based development and coaching, and you’ll receive frequent mentoring from colleagues. This will include a senior colleague from your office or practice who will help you grow and achieve your career goals. Additionally, you will have a professional development manager who manages staffing to help you choose projects based on your priorities as well as the needs of client service teams.  We view the business analyst position as the start of a rewarding, challenging, and highly flexible career with McKinsey. During your first few years with the firm, you will serve as a business analyst on multiple client engagements and work with a number of colleagues and clients in a range of industry and functional areas.  We encourage you to explore different content areas or geographies through a year-long rotation with one of our practices (e.g., corporate finance, social sector, healthcare, operations) or global offices; many do this after two years as a generalist business analyst. You will likely intersect with many elements of our firm’s work including digital, implementation, and tech and analytics capabilities – either by collaborating on teams or working with colleagues from these group.  Following your business analyst tenure, assuming good performance, you will move into a post-graduate school role. Some business analysts will take advantage of the opportunity to get outside experience through a secondment (externship) with a private sector or social sector client with the firm’s support. Others may choose to pursue graduate school with support from the firm.  Who You'll Work With  You will join one of our offices around the world to work in teams and directly with our clients. In addition to these locations, this job opportunity is also available in Ho Chi Minh City.  In this role you will help our clients in the private, public, and social sectors solve some their most pressing problems. You will also work with a range of experts in the firm, from data scientists to researchers to software and app designers.

Descripción: Acerca del empleo TBD  J.P. Morgan is a global leader in financial services, providing strategic advice and products to the world's most prominent corporations, governments, wealthy individuals and institutional investors. Our first-class business in a first-class way approach to serving clients drives everything we do. We strive to build trusted, long-term partnerships to help our clients achieve their business objectives.  We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. In accordance with applicable law, we make reasonable accommodations for applicants' and employees' religious practices and beliefs, as well as any mental health or physical disability needs.

Descripción: Acerca del empleo En Edelman estamos buscando un Influencer Marketing Specialist, quien será responsable de brindar visión estratégica, liderar proyectos y desarrollar campañas de influencer marketing para nuestros clientes. Si cumples con los siguientes requisitos, ¡esta oportunidad es para ti!  3-5 años de experiencia en agencias de relaciones públicas, influencer marketing, mercadeo digital (o afines), o en departamentos de comunicaciones / m ercadeo. Experiencia en el desarrollo, ejecución y consecución de estrategias de influencer marketing y relaciones públicas en Colombia. Conocimiento del negocio del influencer marketing en Colombia: talentos, categorías, referentes, plataformas, tendencias, entre otros. Es un plus si ha trabajado con otros mercados en América Latina. Capacidad de desarrollar estrategias de influencer marketing con un alto componente cuantitativo, desde el establecimiento de los KPIs hasta el reporting basado en el monitoreo y análisis de la d ata. Buen relacionamiento con creadores de contenido, líderes de opinión, representantes y figuras relevantes de la industria del influencer marketing. Habilidades de creatividad, pensamiento estratégico, manejo de crisis y negociación.  Inglés: B2  Edelman is a global communications firm that partners with businesses and organizations to evolve, promote and protect their brands and reputations. Our 6,000 people in more than 60 offices deliver communications strategies that give our clients the confidence to lead and act with certainty, earning the trust of their stakeholders. Our honors include the Cannes Lions Grand Prix for PR; Advertising Age’s 2019 A-List; the Holmes Report’s 2018 Global Digital Agency of the Year; and, five times, Glassdoor’s Best Places to Work. Since our founding in 1952, we have remained an independent, family-run business. Edelman owns specialty companies Edelman Data & Intelligence (DxI) and United Entertainment Group (entertainment, sports, lifestyle).  For more information please visit: www.edelman.com  Please follow this link (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Z7AKFCmQvtk) to view a short video about life at Edelman.

Experiencia en el desarrollo, ejecución y consecución de estrategias de influencer marketing y relaciones públicas en Colombia. Conocimiento del negocio del influencer marketing en Colombia: talentos, categorías, referentes, plataformas, tendencias, entre otros. Es un plus si ha trabajado con otros mercados en América Latina. Descripción: Acerca del empleo Job Details  Goal  OpenBlue Central Utility Plant is an innovative software product which helps central energy facility managers and operators minimize operational costs, reduce energy consumption, reduce water consumption, and shrink carbon footprints. The Project Engineer will develop detailed models that drive the optimization algorithms, assist with the commissioning and user training, and perform savings measurement and verification (M&V) analysis.  Essential Functions Communicate with site engineers or conduct site visits of central plants to analyze current plant configuration, operation, and performance Gather, cleanse, and process data from various sources and utilize data analysis tools and techniques to organize the data for use in CUP analysis Use energy modeling/simulation tools to estimate potential savings from implementing CUP and other energy conservation measures Use problem solving skills to validate simulation results and troubleshoot simulations Following integration to plant automation systems, lead the process of commissioning to ensure CUP algorithms are dispatching plant in an optimal fashion aligned with simulation models Troubleshoot through plant automation systems to identify issues during commissioning. Train and support plant managers’ and operators’ understanding of CUP software Perform savings measurement and verification (M&V) analysis after CUP has been operational Required  What we look for: Degree in Mechanical or Electromechanical Engineering 2+ years of experience in HVAC design engineering and/or developing building energy savings projects. Experience with design and operation of central plants (chilled water, hot water, steam, etc.) Understanding of building cooling and heating loads, energy calculation methods, and energy performance of building mechanical/electrical systems Understanding of HVAC equipment (e.g., hydronic systems, steam/condensate systems, chillers, boilers, cooling towers, pumps, heat exchangers, etc.) General understanding of HVAC controls and sequences of operation for central utility plants Advanced business level in English (B2+) with strong written and verbal communication skills | Must be able to meet deadlines while maintain a positive attitude. Effective and professional communication skills including the ability to effectively communicate with internal customers. Preferred Understanding of mathematical optimization and/or linear programming methods Experience with principles and practices of building energy simulation modeling Experience with inverse modeling and regression techniques Understanding of basic business case analysis and lifecycle cost analysis methods Knowledge of common global utility rate structures

Descripción: Acerca del empleo Apiux Technología⭐ is a company that accelerates and enables growth with technology, innovation and development of talent. With it, we support organisations in their digital transformation process, modernisation and implementations.  In this occasion, we would like to introduce you to our Cloud Business Internship Program in Colombia.  If you are a final year student of Commercial Engineering, International Business or Business Administration, and you are looking for an innovative, disruptive and promising internship, this opportunity is for you!  We want to prepare you to be a digital leader, to be at the vanguard of the technological revolution and to be part of the global digital growth. Our internship program lasts 6 months and is divided into two main phases that run in parallel: Phase 1: You will have access to four courses, where you will learn the basics of Cloud and prepare for Google Cloud's Cloud Digital Leader Certification. Phase 2: You will put your knowledge into practice and participate alongside our team of Cloud executives in missions to: Connect our customers' needs with Google Cloud capabilities, Develop business cases where you will explain how cloud solutions help companies achieve their goals, Clearly express to prospects and customers the capabilities of Google Cloud core products and services....  What are we are looking for? ✅ A final year student of Commercial Engineering, International Business, Business Administration or similar. ✅ English proficiency because your Training is going to be in this language. ✅ Passion for technology, digital business and continuous learning.  What benefits would you get from doing the internship with us? 🚀 Develop your career as a business executive in the IT services market, which is worth over a trillion dollars a year. 📈 Increase your salary horizons by up to 25% by being part of an industry with huge growth projections. 💪🏼 Become a Digital Native Leader, an expert in cloud services with Google Cloud (one of the most relevant Cloud providers today).  We embrace Diversity⭐ providing a positive experience and equal opportunity employer for all qualified candidates who will be considered for openings without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information or any other characteristic protected by law.  So, do you want to be a digital leader and start to impact the future with Apiux and your Talent?  We look forward to your application!

Descripción: Acerca del empleo Objetivo de la Posición:  Este rol incorporará un fuerte enfoque consultivo para ofrecer soluciones rentables y eficientes en respuesta a los requisitos comerciales que abarcan implementaciones en nuestros sistemas de procesamiento y aplicaciones relacionadas. A través del compromiso con las líneas de negocio, los proveedores, la entrega y los equipos operativos, desarrollará y entregará soluciones de proyectos holísticas alineadas con la estrategia comercial y de productos.  Requisitos indispensables de la Posición:  Bachiller universitario en administración de negocios, banca y finanzas o carreras a fin. Experiencia 3 o 4 años en el área de tarjetas, procesadores de pago o posiciones similares. Manejo intermedio de Paquetes comerciales Microsoft Office. Conocimiento intermedio del idioma inglés (lectoescritura)  Requisitos Deseables:  Experiencia con marcas Visa y Mastercard.
Descripción (inglés): [{'translation_text': 'Objective of the Position: This role will incorporate a strong consultative approach to offer cost-effective and efficient solutions in response to the commercial requirements that include implementations in our processing systems and related applications. Through commitment to business lines, suppliers, delivery and operating teams, it will develop and deliver holistic project solutions aligned with the business and product strategy. Indispensable Position Requirements: College Bachelor of Business Administration, Banking and Finance or Careers at End. Experience 3 or 4 years in the area of cards, payment processors or similar positions. Intermediate Management of Microsoft Office Business Packages. Intermediate Knowledge of the English Language (Readwrite) Deserable Requirements: Visa and Mastercard Brand Experience.'}]

Descripción: Acerca del empleo We are looking to hire in Colombia, Chile or Brasil  Are you passionate about predictive modeling? Would you like to join a Global team and be in pricing and underwriting initiatives for our personal and commercial insurance products in our various operations? This is then your next job! The Product Design and Modeling team is looking for Data Scientists to develop predictive models to be used to enhance our pricing and underwriting sophistication in our core Lines of Business in our operations in Latin America and Europe.  By joining Product Design and Modeling in Liberty Mutual, you will be part of a +190 people Global team and will have the opportunity to use insurance data to apply cutting edge techniques to make predictions about risk and demand and see how data science impacts business decisions at one of the most sophisticated property and casualty insurance companies in the region.  Responsibilities:  Build complex predictive models to be used on Pricing or Underwriting in our main Products Lead or support product related advanced modeling and pricing projects Participate in the implementation of the new pricing programs to ensure the desired level of quality Collaborate in modeling projects in the US or the Asian region as required Provide technical or non-technical guidance to colleagues Travel to local operations as necessary to support projects Job qualifications: Proven math and analytical skills, as normally acquired through the pursuit of a degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Data Science, Actuarial Science or related field 2+ years progressively responsible experience in Data Science; Property & Casualty Insurance industry experience preferred Strong background in Statistical Learning. Must be familiar with the use of statistical modeling software (R, Python, Emblem, Radar, Earnix, SAS etc.) with the ability to build models of moderate complexity. Programming and data manipulation skills and scenario testing experience is a plus Can take ownership in small to medium projects and deliver high quality work through others Ability to exercise discretion and apply independent judgment and well-developed critical thinking skills in management of assignments and projects. Aptitude for effective, innovative problem solving within and across functional groups Ability to establish and build effective relationships within and outside the organization. Knowledge of insurance operations and the procedures of Financial, Underwriting, Claims, Statistical, Information Technology, Legal, and Sales departments is preferred Ability to communicate at the right level of complexity for the audience Proficient in English. Spanish and Portuguese are nice to have.
Descripción (inglés): We are looking to hire in Colombia, Chile or Brasil  Are you passionate about predictive modeling? Would you like to join a Global team and be in pricing and underwriting initiatives for our personal and commercial insurance products in our various operations? This is then your next job! The Product Design and Modeling team is looking for Data Scientists to develop predictive models to be used to enhance our pricing and underwriting sophistication in our core Lines of Business in our operations in Latin America and Europe.  By joining Product Design and Modeling in Liberty Mutual, you will be part of a +190 people Global team and will have the opportunity to use insurance data to apply cutting edge techniques to make predictions about risk and demand and see how data science impacts business decisions at one of the most sophisticated property and casualty insurance companies in the region.  Responsibilities:  Build complex predictive models to be used on Pricing or Underwriting in our main Products Lead or support product related advanced modeling and pricing projects Participate in the implementation of the new pricing programs to ensure the desired level of quality Collaborate in modeling projects in the US or the Asian region as required Provide technical or non-technical guidance to colleagues Travel to local operations as necessary to support projects Job qualifications: Proven math and analytical skills, as normally acquired through the pursuit of a degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Data Science, Actuarial Science or related field 2+ years progressively responsible experience in Data Science; Property & Casualty Insurance industry experience preferred Strong background in Statistical Learning. Must be familiar with the use of statistical modeling software (R, Python, Emblem, Radar, Earnix, SAS etc.) with the ability to build models of moderate complexity. Programming and data manipulation skills and scenario testing experience is a plus Can take ownership in small to medium projects and deliver high quality work through others Ability to exercise discretion and apply independent judgment and well-developed critical thinking skills in management of assignments and projects. Aptitude for effective, innovative problem solving within and across functional groups Ability to establish and build effective relationships within and outside the organization. Knowledge of insurance operations and the procedures of Financial, Underwriting, Claims, Statistical, Information Technology, Legal, and Sales departments is preferred Ability to communicate at the right level of complexity for the audience Proficient in English. Spanish and Portuguese are nice to have.

Descripción: Acerca del empleo ¿Estás buscando ampliar tu experiencia profesional? ¿Te gustaría unirte a un equipo dinámico e incluyente? ¡Esta oportunidad está esperando por ti!  Aon está en el negocio de las mejores decisiones  En Aon, damos forma a las decisiones para mejoría para proteger y enriquecer las vidas de las personas alrededor del mundo.  Como organización, estamos unidos a través de la confianza como un equipo inclusivo y diverso, y nos apasiona ayudar a nuestros colegas y clientes a tener éxito.  Cómo será el día típico  El área de Data & Analytics, es un área de soporte fundamental para el core de negocio de Aon, ya que a través de ella podemos prestar servicios diferenciados y ante todo brindar un set de herramientas e información que permitan que nuestros clientes siempre estén mejor informados para que puedan tomar las mejores decisiones. Para la generación de este tipo de soluciones es necesario contar con un equipo dedicado al diseño, desarrollo e implementación de herramientas de analítica, incorporando metodologías de ciencia de datos, estadística aplicada, big data y modelación, capaces de entender las necesidades del entorno y de manera proactiva avanzar en su ejecución y entrega a equipos internos y clientes. Diseño, desarrollo e implementación de herramientas de analítica para las líneas de solución de la compañía. Generar reportes e información de valor de manera periódica para clientes internos y externos referente a análisis de riesgos y tendencias de las líneas de solución de la compañía. Garantizar el desarrollo de modelaciones estadísticas y escenarios de pronóstico a partir de información interna y externa. Optimizar y automatizar los procesos de manejo de información (desde que se recibe la data hasta que se transforma y se convierte en reporte) Articulación de proyectos de data & analytics con equipos globales y regionales para fortalecer la propuesta de valor para clientes externos, y ejecución de estos. Relacionamiento activo con compañías aseguradoras  Habilidades y experiencia que conducirán al éxito Experiencia: Mínimo 1 o 2 años (Preferiblemente en analítica) Conocimientos Técnicos: Analítica, Big Data, Análisis Estadísticos, Análisis predictivos Estudios y/o especialidades: Profesional en ciencias de ingeniería, administrativas, economía, financieras. Idiomas: Inglés Intermedio Alto. Herramientas Tecnológicas: Python o R, Power BI. Excel avanzado. Deseable conocimientos en MySQL y Herramientas de ETL  Cómo apoyamos a nuestros colegas  Además de nuestro paquete integral de beneficios, alentamos una fuerza laboral diversa. Además, nuestro entorno ágil e inclusivo le permite gestionar su bienestar y el equilibrio entre el trabajo y la vida, lo que garantiza que pueda ser su mejor ‘yo’ en Aon. Además, todos nuestros colegas disfrutan de dos “Global Wellbeing Days” cada año, animándole a tomarse un tiempo para concentrarte en si mismo. Ofrecemos una variedad de soluciones de estilo de trabajo, pero también reconocemos que la flexibilidad va más allá del lugar de trabajo... y todos estamos a favor. ¡Lo llamamos Smart Working!  Nuestra cultura de aprendizaje continuo te inspira y te equipa para aprender, compartir y crecer, ayudándole a alcanzar su máximo potencial. Como resultado, en Aon, eres más relevante, más conectado, y más valorado.  Aon valora un lugar de trabajo innovador y diverso donde todos los colegas se sienten empoderados para ser auténticos. Aon se enorgullece de ser un lugar de trabajo con igualdad de oportunidades.  “AON es una empresa que valora a las personas y todos son importantes. Estamos comprometidos a crear y mantener un entorno de trabajo inclusivo y diverso en el que todos los empleados sean tratados con dignidad y respeto. En AON, la discriminación y el acoso contra cualquier empleado o candidato por motivos de raza, etnia, color, religión, origen nacional, sexo, identidad de género, orientación sexual, o cualquier otro estado protegido por la ley. Aquí cumplimos con todas las leyes y regulaciones nacionales y locales aplicables en materia de no discriminación y empleo”.

Descripción: Acerca del empleo Esta posición es elegible para realizarse de manera remota por los actuales residentes de Colombia que califican para el empleo. Los empleados que residen en Colombia serán empleados oficialmente con Remote.com (para fines de nómina, impuestos y beneficios), pero se reportarán y producirán trabajo en nombre de Avant, LLC.  Avant (entonces conocido como AvantCredit®) se fundó en 2012 con el objetivo de mejorar la experiencia de préstamos financieros para los consumidores de ingresos medios, y rápidamente se ha ganado una gran reputación como plataforma efectiva de préstamos en línea, reputación que continúa hasta el día de hoy.  A lo largo de los años, Avant ha continuado optimizando el proceso de préstamo en línea. Con el respaldo de algunos de los inversores más respetados en el espacio fintech, ha ayudado a más de 2 millones de personas a obtener el financiamiento que se merecen. Avant sigue comprometida con su visión fundacional, trabajando todos los días para crear nuevas soluciones que ayuden a impulsar la vida financiera de sus clientes.  A medida que continuamos creando herramientas e integraciones más sólidas dentro de nuestras aplicaciones financieras, nuestros equipos de ingeniería están contratando profesionales talentosos para que nos ayuden a crear soluciones innovadoras para nuestra plataforma. ¡Avant está buscando contratar a un Ingeniero de Software Fullstack para apoyar estas iniciativas!  ***Los candidatos deben dominar el idioma inglés. Según el MCER, buscamos un nivel B2 o superior.***  ¿Que harás en Avant?  La fluidez / dominio del inglés es una habilidad requerida para el puesto, solicitamos amablemente que las solicitudes se envíen en inglés si es posible. Instalación y solución de problemas de hardware y software Soporte de mesa de ayuda día a día (del lado del escritorio y remoto) Documentar y actualizar políticas y procedimientos de soporte Etiquetado de activos y gestión de software de inventario Recreación de imágenes de hardware de computadoras portátiles y de escritorio Despliegue de software Despliegue de hardware Soporte en el escritorio cuando sea necesario Ejecutar proyectos para mejorar los sistemas y operaciones dentro del departamento. Otras tareas de soporte de TI según lo indique el Gerente Debe estar disponible para trabajar en un horario flexible, la capacidad de trabajar horas extras es imprescindible para este puesto.  ¿Como calificas para Avant?  Más de 2 años de experiencia práctica en soporte técnico Conocimientos básicos de redes. Grandes habilidades de comunicación Capacidad para trabajar sin supervisión directa. Capacidad para levantar y transportar hasta 50 libras Capacidad para manejar el trabajo de guardia de forma rotativa Amplio conocimiento en resolución de problemas de hardware y software. Conocimientos de Windows, Android e iOS Conocimiento de métodos y organización de gestión de inventario de TI. La experiencia con la administración de aplicaciones de Google Admin y GSuite es una ventaja  Solicitamos amablemente que las solicitudes se envíen en inglés si es posible.  ¡Echa un vistazo a nuestro Blog Avant!  Creemos que un conjunto diverso de antecedentes y experiencias nos ayuda a crear las soluciones más innovadoras para nuestros clientes. Te invitamos a postularte a nuestras posiciones abiertas incluso si no cumples con el 100% de los requisitos enumerados en la descripción. Si te apasiona nuestra misión y estás alineado con nuestros valores, esperamos que vengas a contribuir a nuestra increíble cultura.  ¿Por qué Avant es el lugar para ti?  En Avant, creemos que nuestros valores marcan la diferencia: Autenticidad. Nos presentamos a trabajar como nosotros mismos y nos aseguramos de que otros también puedan hacerlo. Colaboración. Solo podemos tener éxito cuando lo hacemos como un equipo. Solucion de problemas. Cuanto más difícil es el problema, más satisfactoria es la solución. Cliente. Todos somos dueños de la experiencia del cliente. Iniciativa. Planeacion. Adaptacion. ¡Sacar el trabajo!

Descripción: Acerca del empleo Company Overview  Motorola Solutions is there for our customers when everything is on the line. In extreme moments — when a hurricane lands or when a fire breaks out. And in everyday moments — when a package arrives just in time for the holiday or when a child doesn’t miss the school bus home.  We unify voice, data, video and analytics in one integrated ecosystem to enable individuals, businesses and communities to work together in more powerful ways. To help people make better decisions, act confidently and be their best in the moments that matter. Bring your passion, potential and talents to Motorola Solutions and connect with a career that matters.  Department Overview  The Latin America Marketing Team is responsible for developing and executing all marketing programs and tactics across Latin America and the Caribbean to drive demand generation and sales enablement. The team oversees all regional marketing strategy, development programs, and campaigns including digital, content generation, thought leadership initiatives, account-based marketing, customer experiences & events, and marketing analytics.  Job Description Lead the marketing activities in the region assigned, being responsible for the development and implementation of the government marketing plan in the territory, aligned with the sales team’s priorities. Work closely with the direct sales team to generate an incremental sales pipeline for existing and new products and services Manage and distribute the territory budget according to the plan Lead, develop, and follow up ABM (Account-based Marketing) programs with main accounts. Use demand generation tools, resources, and agencies for campaigns, programs, and reporting purposes Create integral programs and demand generation campaigns aligned with new product launches, co-marketing campaigns, existing product upsell and cross-sells, and new market development Adapt regional content for local use (as needed) Develop customer case studies to promote portfolio benefits to customers with the support of the solutions & product marketing team Plan, develop and track events including trade shows, conferences, anniversaries, industry events, technology days, etc. Support local system integrators with marketing programs and update training that enables sales and increases partners' loyalty. Advise other Marketing team members (i.e. Solutions & Product Marketing, Digital Campaigns Marketing, and Lead Management) on trends in the territory Study and understand legal/regulatory, economic, and any other environmental factor(s) affecting customers in the territory and/or influencing their purchasing decisions Understand the competitive landscape locally & position Motorola Solutions to compete Support Solutions & Product Marketers w/amplification of regional campaigns locally, and major product launches in the territory Own the relationship with local vendors/associations/conferences Aggregate and communicate field marketing activities and status to LACR Marketing Director Elevate the most important/relevant info to be communicated to senior leadership Look for commonalities in field marketing processes, activities, etc. to leverage best practices across territories Study and understand legal/regulatory, economic, and any other environmental factor(s) affecting customers in the territory and/or influencing their purchasing decisions Understand the competitive landscape locally & position Motorola Solutions to compete Support Customer Insights and Product Launch groups with the amplification of regional campaigns locally, and major product launches in the territory Own the relationship with local vendors/associations/conferences Elevate the most important/relevant info to be communicated to senior leadership Look for commonalities in field marketing processes, activities, etc. to leverage best practices across territories  Basic Requirements Professional in Marketing or related fields with at least 4 years of B2B field marketing experience, preferably in the technology industry Experience working with multiple countries preferred Must be self-starting and self-driven and demonstrate problem-solving skills Ability to drive strategic planning and tactical execution. Business and marketing plan development skills including the definition of objectives, tactics, time schedules, budgets, responsibilities, analytics, and measurements Strong communication and presentation skills (written and oral) Highly organized and proficient at managing multiple projects at the same time You are metric-driven and have the ability to draw insight from complex marketing data English Level: Advanced Spanish: Native A postgraduate degree or master's is a plus  Travel Requirements  10-25%  Relocation Provided  None  Position Type  Experienced  Referral Payment Plan  No

Descripción: Acerca del empleo Description  We are a technology company working to transform credit and banking in Latin America starting with point of sale finance. We aim to build fair, simple and affordable financial services that empower our clients, treating them with dignity, and building financial freedom. We launched in February 2019 and have already served thousands of clients and disbursed millions of dollars.  We operate as a full stack startup. We have built our core systems and processes from scratch, and we believe our technology and analytics platform will drive our progress into the years to come. We come at this with deep experience building and growing technology teams and financial products. As important as what we do is how we do it. We are a conscious company, and are deeply committed to working and living our five core values - A company of owners inspiring colleagues, we pull rabbits out of hats, we care and we trust, act with integrity, win today every day, and scale exponentially  We are backed by Andreessen Horowitz, Monashees, Village Global, and an outstanding team of individual angels, including Kevin Ryan, Josh Abramowitz, and Scott Weiss.  What You Will Do Take e2e ownership and operate the software that you design, develop, test and release into production. Work closely with designers, engineers, and product owners to build great products and experiences for our clients and allies. Architect resilient and scalable components leveraging our architectural styles and patterns. Develop new features using reactive programming on the JVM. Develop unit/component/integration tests that guarantees the reliability of the features that you build. Review pull requests on a daily basis transferring your knowledge with your team. Receive mentorship from everyone on the team - from more experienced members to junior folks who are just starting. Deploy new features to production on a daily basis using our CI/CD pipeline. Be on call occasionally. We rotate to distribute our knowledge and experience. Contribute to our Architecture Decision Records where you will be able to propose new techniques, patterns, and tools for our evolving platform. Requirements You have 3+ years of full time technical work experience as a software engineer. We will adjust the role accordingly. Great communication abilities with technical and non-technical stakeholders. Willingness to work with a distributed team. Good foundations in distributed systems and cloud computing. Experience with modern JVM libraries and tools. Awareness of most used design patterns and architectural styles. Benefits Work on a problem that matters and help change customers’ lives. Build a lasting company from the very beginning, helping define every aspect of it. Be at the center of it all. We are a true technology company, and engineering is at the core of what we do. Massive market opportunity ahead of us; we are growing faster than pretty much any other fintech lender was at our stage. Work alongside a great and diverse team that cares about what we are doing and how we are doing it. Generous compensation, including equity, 100% health insurance (and 50% for dependents), flexible time-off, learning budget, and visa sponsorship for foreigners. How The Hiring Process Looks Like Meet with our recruiter for a 30-minute video chat. We will get to know you better, understand what you’re looking for, and answer any questions you might have about ADDI. Meet with one backend software engineer for a 45-minute video chat interview. Here, we will ask you questions about your technical background and basic computer science concepts. You will be able to ask any questions about the culture and how we work at ADDI. Complete a simple take-home challenge within a 1-week window. With this technical challenge, we want to see your technical expertise solving a real-world problem. We expect that you invest 5 hours or less in developing a working solution. Meet with a backend software engineer and the engineering manager for a 45-minute chat to talk about your take-home exercise submission and any questions you might have. Meet onsite with one of our founders for a 30-minute chat to talk about the vision of the company, what we are building and how you will contribute to our product.
Descripción (inglés): Description  We are a technology company working to transform credit and banking in Latin America starting with point of sale finance. We aim to build fair, simple and affordable financial services that empower our clients, treating them with dignity, and building financial freedom. We launched in February 2019 and have already served thousands of clients and disbursed millions of dollars.  We operate as a full stack startup. We have built our core systems and processes from scratch, and we believe our technology and analytics platform will drive our progress into the years to come. We come at this with deep experience building and growing technology teams and financial products. As important as what we do is how we do it. We are a conscious company, and are deeply committed to working and living our five core values - A company of owners inspiring colleagues, we pull rabbits out of hats, we care and we trust, act with integrity, win today every day, and scale exponentially  We are backed by Andreessen Horowitz, Monashees, Village Global, and an outstanding team of individual angels, including Kevin Ryan, Josh Abramowitz, and Scott Weiss.  What You Will Do Take e2e ownership and operate the software that you design, develop, test and release into production. Work closely with designers, engineers, and product owners to build great products and experiences for our clients and allies. Architect resilient and scalable components leveraging our architectural styles and patterns. Develop new features using reactive programming on the JVM. Develop unit/component/integration tests that guarantees the reliability of the features that you build. Review pull requests on a daily basis transferring your knowledge with your team. Receive mentorship from everyone on the team - from more experienced members to junior folks who are just starting. Deploy new features to production on a daily basis using our CI/CD pipeline. Be on call occasionally. We rotate to distribute our knowledge and experience. Contribute to our Architecture Decision Records where you will be able to propose new techniques, patterns, and tools for our evolving platform. Requirements You have 3+ years of full time technical work experience as a software engineer. We will adjust the role accordingly. Great communication abilities with technical and non-technical stakeholders. Willingness to work with a distributed team. Good foundations in distributed systems and cloud computing. Experience with modern JVM libraries and tools. Awareness of most used design patterns and architectural styles. Benefits Work on a problem that matters and help change customers’ lives. Build a lasting company from the very beginning, helping define every aspect of it. Be at the center of it all. We are a true technology company, and engineering is at the core of what we do. Massive market opportunity ahead of us; we are growing faster than pretty much any other fintech lender was at our stage. Work alongside a great and diverse team that cares about what we are doing and how we are doing it. Generous compensation, including equity, 100% health insurance (and 50% for dependents), flexible time-off, learning budget, and visa sponsorship for foreigners. How The Hiring Process Looks Like Meet with our recruiter for a 30-minute video chat. We will get to know you better, understand what you’re looking for, and answer any questions you might have about ADDI. Meet with one backend software engineer for a 45-minute video chat interview. Here, we will ask you questions about your technical background and basic computer science concepts. You will be able to ask any questions about the culture and how we work at ADDI. Complete a simple take-home challenge within a 1-week window. With this technical challenge, we want to see your technical expertise solving a real-world problem. We expect that you invest 5 hours or less in developing a working solution. Meet with a backend software engineer and the engineering manager for a 45-minute chat to talk about your take-home exercise submission and any questions you might have. Meet onsite with one of our founders for a 30-minute chat to talk about the vision of the company, what we are building and how you will contribute to our product.

Descripción: Acerca del empleo Acerca del empleo  Acerca de usted:  Si tiene ambiciones de clase mundial para alcanzar las estrellas mientras mantiene los pies en la tierra, somos el equipo para usted. Hemos creado una nueva generación de empresas, centradas en el futuro con una ambición reinventada en todas las disciplinas del sector energético.  Amamos a las personas que conocen su propio potencial y no tienen miedo de usarlo. Sabemos que juntos, somos mucho más que la suma de nuestras partes. Por lo tanto, celebramos a las personas que quieren crecer y desarrollarse a medida que trabajemos juntos en algunos de los proyectos más grandes en el escenario mundial de la energía.  Nuestro propósito y creencias:  En Kent, estamos abordando el mayor desafío de nuestro tiempo: llevar a nuestro mundo la energía que necesita de la manera más responsable jamás imaginada.  Es la energía de cada miembro de nuestro equipo impulsada por nuestras creencias lo que está haciendo que esto suceda. Cualquiera que sea nuestra habilidad, nuestro idioma o nuestra cultura. Estas creencias nos definen y nos dirigen todos los días para ser los mejores, para nosotros, nuestros clientes, nuestras partes interesadas clave, las comunidades en las que operamos y el planeta:  JUGAMOS A LO GRANDE  Prosperamos en AGILIDAD EMOCIONAL  Somos FANÁTICOS DEL RENDIMIENTO  Estamos construidos sobre el PENSAMIENTO INFINITO  Lea más sobre el Propósito, las Creencias y los Principios Rectores que nos impulsan: https://kentplc.com/who-we-are/purpose-beliefs  Nuestra visión para la Diversidad, la Inclusión y la Pertenencia:  Reconocemos que la diversidad y la inclusión son catalizadores del éxito. Estamos aumentando la conciencia sobre los beneficios de la diversidad de las personas, la diversidad de experiencias y la diversidad de nuestras perspectivas. Crear una cultura de inclusión donde todos los empleados sientan un sentido de pertenencia.  La combinación de nuestra energía es alimentada por diferentes nacionalidades, en 6 continentes y 24 países. Nuestro compromiso es celebrar el carácter, sin importar el origen étnico, el género, la edad, la religión, la identidad o la discapacidad.  Sobre el trabajo:  Kent está buscando un Ingeniero especialista 1 Instrumentación para apoyar a los proyectos en curso. Esta posición se encuentra en nuestra oficina de Bogotá, Colombia.  Sus responsabilidades:  Elaborar y revisar diseños (documentos y planos) e incorporar comentarios, de acuerdo con solicitudes puntuales del área de Ingeniería y de los Proyectos, utilizando el software y paquete office y normas, con el fin de dar cumplimiento a los requerimientos de cada disciplina. Registrar el consumo de Horas – Hombre de cada entregable. Planear la ejecución de cada proyecto, definido el alcance, las normas aplicables y asignando prioridades al grupo de trabajo para cumplir con el Plan Detallado de Trabajo (PDT). Gestión de Calidad Técnica en entregables. Estimar y revisar cantidades de obra de acuerdo con la especialidad, a partir de los documentos de diseño, con fines presupuestales. Apoyar en las a las consultas técnicas que realice el cliente, interactuando en reuniones formales y periódicas, con el fin de resolver adecuadamente las inquietudes e identificar los posibles cambios de alcance o re trabajo que obliguen a aplicar en forma inmediata acciones de control de cambios.  Sus conocimientos/habilidades, educación y experiencia:  Calificación / Certificación:  Profesional en Ingeniería Electrónica Experiencia mínima de 8.1 años Conocimiento, interpretación y aplicación de Normas y Estándares aplicables al sector de Petróleo y Gas. Experiencia en diseños en el sector Oil & Gas de acuerdo con la especialidad. Conocimientos en planificación, presupuesto, control y seguimiento de actividades de los proyectos. En particular debe mostrar conocimientos intermedios en la lectura de reportes MS Project o plataforma equivalente. Preferiblemente con conocimiento en preparación de propuestas, estimación de horas hombre, para las diferentes etapas de las ingenierías (conceptuales, básicas y detalladas). Evaluaciones técnicas de ofertas de proveedores. Interpretación de planos P&ID’s Conocimiento de Autocad Manejo de Office (Word, Excel, Power Point) Conocimientos de HSEQ. Manejo e interacción de equipos de trabajo  Requisito de habilidades:  Criterios para selección de instrumentos de medición. Actualizaciones y avances de los sistemas de control, seguridad e instrumentos. Capacidad de diseñar funciones instrumentadas de seguridad. Conocimiento teórico y práctico a nivel profesional acordes a la especialidad. Conocimientos en sistemas de control, seguridad e instrumentación.  Comunicación:  Deseable inglés intermedio. Excelentes habilidades de comunicación: verbal, escrita, de presentación, etc.  Usted piensa que una carrera en nuestro equipo podría coincidir con su perfil, ¡envíe su solicitud en línea ahora!

Descripción: Acerca del empleo What You'll Do  As a part of BCG’s GAMMA A&S team you will work closely with consulting teams on a diverse range  of business, advanced analytics and we development topics. You will have the opportunity to leverage web development and rapid prototyping methodologies to deliver value to BCG's Consulting (case) teams and Practice Areas (domain) through software development expertise and accelerated execution support.  You will collaborate with case teams to gather requirements, specify, design, develop, deliver and  support analytic solutions serving client needs. You will provide technical support through deeper  understanding of relevant software solutions and processes to build high quality and efficient web  applications.  YOU'RE GOOD AT  Technical expertise  Experience in data analysis and with statistics tools and methods: Strong expertise in R or Python Data cleaning, variable transformation, etc. Regression analysis, factor analysis, PCA, decision trees, etc. Machine learning algorithms such as NLP, random forest, etc. Experience in core data visualization tasks and tools (one or more of the following): Design visually compelling reports Build interactive dashboards and data exploration tools Experience with Tableau, R shiny or other visualization tools Experience with collaboration tools & ticketing systems (e.g. JIRA, Confluence, GitHub) is preferred Experience with big data environments a plus: Amazon Redshift, Hadoop/HIVE, Teradata  You Bring (experience & Qualifications)  Undergraduate degree related to data science, statistics, machine learning, mathematics, computer science is required; advanced degree is preferred 2+ years of industry experience focused on statistics & machine learning or related areas Fluent written and spoken English (other languages desirable) Work management, organization and planning Excellent organizational skills, attention to detail, efficient time management Proactive communication of issues, priorities and objectives Ability to thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced, demanding environment Customer and business focus Strong collaborative skills and ability to adjust approach to effectively interact with clients at all organizational and technical levels Focus on excellent client service and close attention to client needs Values and ethics Demonstrates competence and character that inspires trust Flexible, self-motivated, and proactive out-of-the-box and critical thinker Able to respect all BCG and client information as personal and confidential  YOU'LL WORK WITH  Our data analytics and artifical intelligence professionals mix deep domain expertise with advanced analytical methods and techniques to develop innovative solutions that help our clients tackle their most pressing issues. We design algorithms and build complex models out of large amounts of data.  Additional Information  BCG GAMMA A&S combines innovative skills in computer science, statistics, and machine learning  with deep industry expertise. The BCG GAMMA A&S team is comprised of data engineers, data  scientists and business consultants who specialize in the use of advanced analytics to get high-impact  business results. Our teams own the full analytics value-chain end to end: framing the business  problem, building the data, designing innovative algorithms, creating scale through designing tools  and apps, and training colleagues and clients in new solutions. Here at BCG GAMMA A&S, you’ll have  the chance to work with clients in every BCG region and every industry area. We are also a core  member of a rapidly growing Digital enterprise at BCG – a constellation of teams focused on driving  practical results for BCG clients by applying leading-edge analytics approaches, data, and technology.

Descripción: Acerca del empleo About Orica  At Orica, it’s the power of our people that leads change and shapes our futures. Every day, all around the world, our people help mobilise vital resources essential to progress. Established in 1874, we have grown to become the world leader in mining and civil blasting with a diverse of team of more than 13,000 across the world.  It’s an exciting time to join us – we are shaping the future of mining through digital and automated technologies, embracing new ways of thinking, pioneering innovation and reimagining the way we work.  About The Role  This role is accountable for: Leading Orica’s Business Conduct program in the combined Americas regions, including ensuring that all issues or incidents that may constitute a breach of the Code of Business Conduct (Code) in these regions are appropriately recorded, analyzed, and investigated. Supporting the Manager, Business Conduct in managing compliance with legal and policy frameworks for whistleblower management and protection; and in monitoring and reporting on the efficiency and effectiveness of the Business Conduct program to relevant internal stakeholders. Supporting the Manager, Ethics & Compliance Americas in the implementation, management, and ongoing monitoring of a framework to maintain compliance with key regulatory requirements on trade sanctions and anti-bribery/corruption. What You Will Be Doing  The key accountabilities for this role include: BUSINESS CONDUCT You will support the Manager, Business Conduct in ensuring that Orica’s investigations framework is consistent with applicable laws, regulations, and better practice in respect of whistleblower management and protection. You will lead the triage process for concerns, allegations and incidents that are raised in the Americas regions via Orica’s “Speak-Up” line, and any other allegations, concerns, or incidents that are reported to you. You will ensure that all allegations, concerns, or incidents from the Americas regions that are reported to the Speak Up line or separately to you are adequately and timely reviewed in accordance with the Group Procedure Code of Business Conduct: Reporting & Investigations, and that the requisite action is taken within the set or reasonable time frame. You will communicate effectively and in a timely manner with reporters and internal stakeholders on relevant issues. You will support the internal stakeholders who undertake the investigations. You will develop and manage relationships with outsourced providers that provide Orica with investigations support. You will support the Manager, Business Conduct in maintaining an appropriate monitoring regime and produce ongoing reporting on the efficiency and effectiveness of the Business Conduct program for relevant stakeholders, including the Board and Business Conduct Committee. You will support the Manager, Business Conduct in ensuring that all relevant stakeholders, including the Business Conduct Committee, are appropriately engaged in relation to any developments in Orica’s business conduct practices and themes. ETHICS & COMPLIANCE - You will support the Manager, Ethics & Compliance Americas in: Identifying and managing corruption and trade sanctions risks across the Americas regions Focusing on continually enhancing the compliance culture across the Americas regions Managing the approval and notification steps under the Ethics & Compliance program for ethics and compliance matters in the Americas regions Partnering with the business and other functional teams (e.g.: Legal, Finance, and Audit) to pro-actively identify and resolve ethics and compliance risks and challenges in the Americas regions Delivering, tracking, and reporting on employee training programs related to ethics and compliance across the Americas regions Monitoring and reporting on new and relevant ethics and compliance developments across the Americas regions Conducting and assisting in investigations into ethics and compliance issues across the Americas regions. Supporting the Manager, Ethics & Compliance EMEA in reviewing and actioning sanctions screening blocks in the SAP GTS system What You Will Bring Relevant tertiary qualification in law, finance or other relevant degree Minimum 5 years post-qualification experience with a first tier employer Previous experience in managing code of conduct matters. whistleblower activities or investigations desired Previous experience with anti-corruption and/or trade sanctions compliance desired Experience in working across multiple countries with high corruption risk profiles desired Role dimensions  Regional remit for the management of the Business Conduct program in the Americas regions  Regional remit for supporting the Manager, Ethics & Compliance Americas in the management of the Ethics and Compliance program in the Americas regions  Regional remit for supporting the Manager, Ethics & Compliance EMEA in reviewing and actioning sanctions screening blocks in the SAP GTS system  Your Qualifications Sound judgement and ability to work with highly sensitive information Ability to operate independently Demonstrated skills in influencing, coordinating, consulting, facilitating and coaching Organised and disciplined in delivery of outcomes Interpersonal awareness; ability to work with all levels of the organisation Business and commercial acumen What We Offer  As part of a truly global company, you will have the ability to grow and learn in a diverse, collaborative culture. We foster relationships and learning through connected global and local teams, promote flexible and diverse career paths and support the development of your knowledge and skills.  You will be paid a competitive salary, learn from talented individuals across multiple disciplines and be able to thrive in a safe workplace within a collaborative culture. Ignite your career at a place where your distinct potential can find its home.  We respect and value all  Orica promotes and fosters a culture of inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment everywhere we operate. We treat our people and applicants with fairness, dignity, and respect, getting the best of everyone’s contributions. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, nationality, age, military or veteran, marital or disability status.

Descripción: Acerca del empleo  Description  We are hiring a Cloud DevOps & Infrastructure Engineer for our AWS Solution Practice team to work with EPAM’s strategic clients. Together with the team, you will support clients’ implementation of AWS products through architecture guidance, best practices, data migration, capacity planning, implementation, troubleshooting, monitoring, and more.  Req.#306897875  #REF_HOU_CO  Responsibilities  Act as the trusted technical advisor for the clients to resolve complex AWS Infrastructure and DevOps challenges Communicate effectively via video conferencing for meetings, technical reviews and onsite delivery activities Assist the clients with the configuration and deployment of their AWS infrastructure, which include but not limited to the following services: accounts, identity and access management, network architecture, application security, observability, cost optimization, and billing Provide the clients with the guidance on how to design their cloud applications for optimal scaling, including CDN design, load balancer setup, caching, compute optimizations, continuous integration and delivery pipeline, and others Support EPAM’s clients and deploy solutions and deliver the workshops to educate and enrich clients’ knowledge Support clients’ implementation of AWS products through architecture guidance, best practices, data migration, capacity planning, implementation, troubleshooting, monitoring, and more  Requirements  Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, related technical field or equivalent practical experience Experience using cloud platform enablement technologies tools such as Terraform and CloudFormation Maintaining internet facing production-grade applications in virtualized environments (cloud computing platforms and services) Ability to manage internal or client-facing projects, troubleshooting clients' technical issues and working with engineering, sales and services teams and customers Experience with scalable networking technologies such as Load Balancers/Firewalls and web standards (REST APIs, web security mechanisms) History of containerization, artifact repository, and orchestration technologies (such as Docker, Helm, Kubernetes, Mesos) Hands-on experience with deployment technologies (such as Puppet, Chef, Salt, Ansible) Understanding of open source server software (such as NGINX, RabbitMQ, Redis, Elasticsearch) Familiarity with IT security best practices such as encryption, certificates, and key management AWS DevOps Professional certification, or equivalent experience  We offer  We trust our people. Descripción: Acerca del empleo Interested in working in a global environment with different cultures? If you think you'll enjoy challenging projects, learning new things and achieving best results, this may be the next step in your career!  What The Day Will Look Like You will carry out complex funding and accounting actuarial valuations, coordinating responsibilities with the Retirement Solution Line in North America (USA and Canada) and meeting defined deadlines You will be in compliance with and drive usage of processes, templates, precedents, and compliance guidelines as a competent checker You will demonstrate a good understanding of actuarial valuation principles You will maintain and build learning resources for the team, such as best practices or training materials for particular types of work You will focus on quality and efficiency You will be able to clearly communicate both with junior analysts and with global experts  Skills That Will Lead To Success Industry knowledge and good work experience (employee benefits and retirement programs preferred) Ability to work well in a collaborative team environment by being respectful and encouraging others, presenting openly and constructively and being an active listener Excellent project management skills demonstrated by ability to handle multiple valuation projects independently Proactively help less experienced colleagues with technical valuation knowledge and review of their work Act as a role-model for junior Analysts, coach new analysts on professional conduct and good work ethics and provide constructive feedback Strong Microsoft Office skills (Excel, Word) Pensions domain experience will be an advantage Advanced English  Education  Educated to University degree level, preferably in Mathematics, Statistics, or Actuarial Science.  Proficient English is required.  We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment.

Descripción: Acerca del empleo Acerca del empleo  Acerca de usted:  Si tiene ambiciones de clase mundial para alcanzar las estrellas mientras mantiene los pies en la tierra, somos el equipo para usted. Hemos creado una nueva generación de empresas, centradas en el futuro con una ambición reinventada en todas las disciplinas del sector energético.  Amamos a las personas que conocen su propio potencial y no tienen miedo de usarlo. Sabemos que juntos, somos mucho más que la suma de nuestras partes. Por lo tanto, celebramos a las personas que quieren crecer y desarrollarse a medida que trabajemos juntos en algunos de los proyectos más grandes en el escenario mundial de la energía.  Nuestro propósito y creencias:  En Kent, estamos abordando el mayor desafío de nuestro tiempo: llevar a nuestro mundo la energía que necesita de la manera más responsable jamás imaginada.  Es la energía de cada miembro de nuestro equipo impulsada por nuestras creencias lo que está haciendo que esto suceda. Cualquiera que sea nuestra habilidad, nuestro idioma o nuestra cultura. Estas creencias nos definen y nos dirigen todos los días para ser los mejores, para nosotros, nuestros clientes, nuestras partes interesadas clave, las comunidades en las que operamos y el planeta:  JUGAMOS A LO GRANDE  Prosperamos en AGILIDAD EMOCIONAL  Somos FANÁTICOS DEL RENDIMIENTO  Estamos construidos sobre el PENSAMIENTO INFINITO  Lea más sobre el Propósito, las Creencias y los Principios Rectores que nos impulsan: https://kentplc.com/who-we-are/purpose-beliefs  Nuestra visión para la Diversidad, la Inclusión y la Pertenencia:  Reconocemos que la diversidad y la inclusión son catalizadores del éxito. Estamos aumentando la conciencia sobre los beneficios de la diversidad de las personas, la diversidad de experiencias y la diversidad de nuestras perspectivas. Crear una cultura de inclusión donde todos los empleados sientan un sentido de pertenencia.  La combinación de nuestra energía es alimentada por diferentes nacionalidades, en 6 continentes y 24 países. Nuestro compromiso es celebrar el carácter, sin importar el origen étnico, el género, la edad, la religión, la identidad o la discapacidad.  Sobre el trabajo:  Kent está buscando un Ingeniero Especialista Experto SCI para apoyar a los proyectos en curso. Esta posición se encuentra en nuestra oficina de Bogotá, Colombia.  Sus responsabilidades:  Respuesta a TQs Desarrollo de Conceptos Técnicos Atención de RSPAs Desarrollo de Ingenierías-diseños Ágiles Análisis de Riesgos Talleres de constructibilidad, peer review, design review, RCA Informe de Seguimiento y Control de Procesos de Ingeniería Mapas de Activos de Conocimiento y Hojas de Ruta Visitas a campo Y Otras derivadas del cargo  Sus conocimientos/habilidades, educación y experiencia:  Calificación / Certificación:  Profesional en Ingeniería Mecánica Experiencia mínima de 6.1 años  Requisito de habilidades:  Conocimientos en sistemas de protección contraincendio y F&G para el sector Oil &Gas. Conocimiento de normas NFPA, API y estándares corporativos de la industria del petróleo. Debe tener experiencia especifica en el desarrollo de: Diseños conceptuales, básicos y detallados de sistemas contraincendio y F&G, participación en talleres de seguridad pre-arranque de sistemas contraincendio y F&G, emisión de conceptos técnicos para modificaciones prioritarias de sistemas contraincendio y F&G estructuración de alcances técnicos para desarrollo de diseños básicos y detallados de sistemas contraincendio y F&G, revisión técnica de entregables de ingeniería de sistemas contraincendio y F&G.  Comunicación:  Excelentes habilidades de comunicación: verbal, escrita, de presentación, etc.  Usted piensa que una carrera en nuestro equipo podría coincidir con su perfil, ¡envíe su solicitud en línea ahora!
